loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 20-year-old single guy, who has a passion for working with different types of electronics and trying to find a way to fix them. Since he could not get into college to study a related subject, Abdullah decided to follow his passion using other ways.

Abdallah started by opening a shop selling cell phones and accessories a year ago. He even took courses to learn how to fix such electronics and added that skill as one of his additionA. services in the store.

His future plans are to get into the cell phone wholesale business and even add other types of electronics to his store, So he applied for this loan as a start to buy cell phone items wholesale.

loans.use: To buy cell phone items wholesale.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with two school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a fish selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Fatuma dreams of expanding her business and selling at wholesale in the future. 

With the 15,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she wants to purchase bundles of fish for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of fish for sale.

loans.name: Felicite

texts.en:
Felicite is 35 years old. She has 2 children who are 6 and 9 years old. They are both in school. 

Felicite has been selling fruit for 10 years. This business has enabled her to pay school fees for her children. It has also enabled her to meet the needs of her family. She is requesting a loan to buy more fruit in order to make more profits. With the profits, she plans to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is 31 years old, married and has five children.  To earn a living, she operates a retail shop.  She has sustained her business for 11 years.  She has managed to increase her business stock with previous loans from Faulu Kenya.  In five years, she sees herself opening another retail shop and building rental houses.  She has requested 100,000 KES to buy rice, sugar and cooking fat.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and cooking fat.

loans.name: Nigogo

texts.en:
Nigogo is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 2 years, she has operated a retail shop, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She sells household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour and rice. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KSHS 15,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and rice for her retail shop. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and rice for her retail shop.

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en:
Immaculate is 49 years old and she has 8 children between the ages of 17 and 36 years old.  She sells foodstuff such as beans, cassava and sweet potatoes, as well as charcoal.  She has been in this business for 12 years and it has enabled her to meet her family's needs.

Immaculate is requesting a loan to buy more food items.  With the profits, she plans to save and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy food to sell.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is 27 years old and married, with two children aged one and five.  He sells household goods such as utensils, basins and buckets.  He appreciates Faulu Kenya because the organization has helped him to add business stock.  Stephen works hard in his business so that one day he  can open another shop.  He has requested  80,000 KES to buy more utensils.

loans.use: To buy more utensils

loans.name: Kanze

texts.en:
Kanze is a married woman with 8 children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 4 years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Kanze dreams of expanding and establishing a retail shop in the future. 

With the KSHS 80,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy hair braids

loans.name: Hà's Group

texts.en:
Hà is a 34-year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Hà is the group leader of an 8-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Diên Lộc nhóm 06  (6).

Hà is married and has 2 school-aged children. She owns & operates a food stall where she sells herbs & spices. She has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3.500.000 VND a month.

Hà joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a new loan of 5.152.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  This will be her 1st loan from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Đức is a 51-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her livestock business by buying chickens and chicken feed.


2.  Gái is a 57-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her chicken raising business.


3.  Minh is a 49-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her chicken raising business.


4.  Khánh is a 25-year-old male who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support his furniture making business.


5.  Mến is a 27-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her chicken raising business.


6.  Minh is a 24-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her pig raising business.


7.  Liễu is a 54-year-old male who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support his chicken and duck raising business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hà là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Hà là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 8 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Diên Lộc nhóm 06  (6).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các loại thảo mộc & gia vị trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Hà thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hà kiếm được khoảng 3.500.000 VND.  Hà đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND để mua cám lợn.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Đức là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Gái là 57 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Minh là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  Khánh là 25 tuổi nam.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


5.  Mến là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi lợn.


6.  Minh là 24 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi lợn.


7.  Liễu là 54 tuổi nam.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc gà, vịt.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kagala Development Group

texts.en:
16 years is the length of time that 49-year-old Dodovico has demonstrated his hard work ethic in his food sales business in the many food markets in and around the metropolis of Mukono. Dodovico is a family man who takes pride in the fact that his is a stable family with 2 buoyant children aged 22 and 25. They are all in good schools and giving a good account of themselves. He says his wife is always at his beck and call, helping him as he sells his food (bananas, sweet potatoes and beans). 

The difficult experiences he has gone through in the past 16 years of running this business have made him come to terms with what he needs to do to elevate his business prospects. He has also learnt to take stock of what will create a bigger niche for his business and how to make the best out of bad business bargains. In this kind of business, one is destined to climb the ladder of financial success as long as you continuously restock because demand for food will be high, even if food prices rise. Dodovico has always strived to restock whenever he runs short on supplies. 

This business was started with cash savings from his previous charcoal and timber trade. Weekly, he says this business generates shillings 100,000 profit. With this loan, he is going to purchase more foods to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas, sweet potatoes and beans to resell

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is a married woman with 8 children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has  neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 4 years, she has operated a goat-meat-selling business.  She sells via wholesale to butcher shop operators in the area. Getrude faces a major challenge of seasonality and delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit.  She dreams of establishing a slaughterhouse in the future.

With the KSHS 80,000 loan, she wants to purchase goats. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase goats.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a call center officer who works at the Ministry of Education eight hours a day. He is a 35-year-old man who has four children under the age of 11.

5 months ago he rented a place and turned it into a cafeteria/market, where he serves sandwiches and drinks as well as different kinds of snacks. But since he already has a full-time job during the day, he hired a young man to work and help him while he is at work. 

Ali has applied for this loan to buy a coffee maker and add it as another type of drinks that the cafeteria can serve, and to add more goods. In the future, he want to expand and employ more people to work.

loans.use: To buy a coffee maker and to add more goods to the cafeteria.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is 21 years old and lives in Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are currently in school. Olivia has a business selling coffee, which she has run for five years. She also has a second business selling fish.
To help expand her business, Olivia has requested a loan of 350,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more coffee for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Olivia hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. In the future, she hopes to buy a sewing machine.
Olivia is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by assisting her in improving her business by gaining more knowledge about how to handle a business.

loans.use: to purchase more coffee for resale.

loans.name: Kadii

texts.en:
Kadii is a married woman with six children.  Four have completed their education while 2 still attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is seasonality: during the hot dry season, the availability of vegetables is lower. She dreams of expanding her stall in the future.

With the KSHS 30,000 loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bundles of vegetables, bananas, tomatoes, potatoes and onions for sale. She joined Yehu because of simplicity in lending procedures.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of vegetables, bananas, tomatoes, potatoes and onions for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase summer clothes for resale.

loans.name: Nairoshi

texts.en:
Nairoshi has practiced farming in Nakuru town for the past 11 years. She is 35 years old and married to Moses. 

She was introduced to KADET by one of her friends and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy a motorbike for transportation services as a secondary business. She will employ someone to operate the motorbike in Nakuru town. This will supplement her farm income.

In the future, Nairoshi hopes to become a leading farmer in Nakuru town. She also hopes to buy a pick-up truck, which she will be using to transport her farm produce to the market.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to supplement her farm income

loans.name: Luka

texts.en: Luka is 29 years old, married and blessed with a five-year-old child.  He earns his living by repairing vehicles.  In addition, he owns a vehicle which he uses for a transport business.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has gained business knowledge that has helped him to sustain his business for nine years.  He hopes to start importing new cars for sale in the future.  He has requested 60,000 KES to buy spare vehicle parts.

loans.use: To buy spare vehicle parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, sufurias (cooking pans) and plates.

loans.name: Suubi Savings And Development Group

texts.en:
Thirty-eight-year-old Idd subsists on earnings from a brick sales business that he operates from Mukono. The happily married, principled and down-to-earth father of two says he has been in this business for a decade now. 

Ten years has been a time frame long enough for him to make his deductions on how to survive and weather the unpredictable storms such business come with. He has also learned to be philosophical in the face of financial and other operational adversity that plagues businesses. In many respects, this has been of paramount importance in his business operations as he has learned to strike a balance. 

Many of his clients are truck drivers who are being caught up in the construction boom that is pervading Mukono and its surrounding environs. By all accounts, Idd makes strong and durable bricks. He has built a good rapport with many of his clients. The strong and durable bricks are liked by many of his clients, who in turn prevail upon other people around Mukono to purchase durable and sturdy bricks from him. 

As he casts his mind to the future, Idd knows the prospects for the future success of his business are good. Idd is also formerly employed as a teacher. Teaching is a profession he holds dear to his heart. Monthly, he says his business sales profit amounts to Uganda shillings 380,000, and he says with this loan, he is going to purchase a modern brick-making machine.

loans.use: The purchase of  a new brick-making machine

loans.name: Mwanaharusi

texts.en: Mwanaharusi is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school while the third is not yet old enough to go. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped-in water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. For the past two years, she has made a living by selling water door to door from her hand cart. Her customers are water vendors in her area. Mwanaharusi's biggest challenge is the seasonal nature of her business, because during the rainy season few people need to buy water. She dreams of expanding her business and supplying water wholesale. She has applied for a loan for Kshs 30,000 to buy another hand cart for her water-selling business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase another hand cart for her water-selling business.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en: Johnson is 39 years old, married and has for the last five years made a living selling shoes. He has two employees who help him in his tasks.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has managed to save his money and secure loans for his business.  He is applying for a loan for 50,000 Kes to buy a sewing machine, acquire a trading license and buy new shoes to sell to his customers.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine, acquire a trading license and buy new shoes to sell.

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar is 37 years old and a widow, who has been working as school teacher for people with special needs and learning difficulties for almost a year now.

Before finding this job, Sahar always dreamt of helping people with special needs in their life, and since it is expensive to send those kids to a special needs school, she started giving private lessons at her house, specially to people who have learning difficulties.

Now Sahar has both jobs, one at the school and the other at her house after work. Since she has experience on how to approach her students, she added giving English lessons as one of her services.

Now Sahar has applied for this loan to enhance the teaching area at her house so she can provide the best service for her customers.

loans.use: To enhance the teaching area at her house.

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen is a 33-year-old single mother of five children, and she rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. 

She has been operating a bar and lodge business for six years. Her hardship is bad debtors and her vision is building a house and owning a hotel.

Allen intends to use the loan to buy food and drinks to sell.

loans.use: To buy food and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Juweiria

texts.en:
Juweiria is a married woman with six children, five of whom attend school while one is still young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a tailoring business. In addition she also sells goat meat, which contributes to her income. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. 

She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business. She dreams of owning a dressmaking school in the future.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the KES 70,000 she wants to purchase bundles of cloth materials.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of cloth materials.

loans.name: Benadeta

texts.en:
Benadeta is 40 years old and a single mother of five children aged 18 to 3 years. 

She is a hard-working woman and the sole bread winner for her family. 

Benadeta lives in a two-room rented house with her children in Hioma, Uganda. Her goal is to educate her children. 

For eight years she has been selling produce. She started by selling bananas then later diverted into the sale of maize and beans. 

Benadeta needs a loan to purchase cereals like maize and beans for resale.

loans.use: To purchase beans and maize for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy another refrigerator.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase goats and cattle to slaughter in the butchery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goats to raise and sell.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is 16 years old and lives in Uganda. She is single and has no children. Justine has a business selling clothes, which she has run for four years.
To help expand her business, Justine has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Justine hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her siblings. In the future, she hopes to open a poultry farm.
Justine is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by giving her access to sufficient capital to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac is a 24-year-old single man.  He runs a butcher shop with one employee.  He joined Faulu Kenya so that he would get business loans easily.  So far, he has serviced one loan from Faulu Kenya which he used to boost his business.  He has requested a loan of 30,000 Kes to buy a deep freezer.  Isaac hopes to open a big restaurant in the future.

loans.use: To buy a deep freezer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy maize and beans for sale.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a business woman who hails from Kyenjojo district. She is a Ugandan female aged 40 years who owns a boutique that sells second-hand clothes. She dreams of educating her six children and setting up other income-generating activities from which she can earn an extra income. She acquired her initial capital from a retail shop she owned. Margret wants a loan to buy jeans and shirts for resale in her boutique.

loans.use: To  buy jeans and shirts for resale.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: Fred is a Ugandan male aged 51 years who needs a loan to buy cattle for resale, a business he has operated for five years. He hails from Kyenjojo district, a father of three children, and has a wife who is a farmer in the same area.  He lives in a semi-permanent house with five people that he takes care of and he dreams of educating his children. He acquired his initial capital from farming to start off the cattle trade and faces a problem of transporting his cattle to the market and he longs to buy a truck to use in transport in future.

loans.use: To buy cattle for resale.

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is a Ugandan male aged 39 years who needs a loan to buy dried maize and beans for resale, a business that he has operated for eight years. He hails from Kyenjojo district, a father of eight children, and lives in a semi-permanent house with 10 people that he takes care of. He dreams of educating his children to a self-reliant level. He acquired his initial capital from growing maize and savings from the sale of same. He faces a problem of transporting his produce to the market and agricultural price fluctuations.

loans.use: To buy dried maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 21 years old and lives in Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom are currently in school. Stella has a salon business, which she has run for four years.
To help expand her business, Stella has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase hair braids for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Stella hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for the family. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.
Stella is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase hair braids for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a Ugandan female aged 38 years who needs a loan to pay labourers for weeding her watermelon garden. She hails from Kyenjojo district, a mother of four children aged 16, 14, 12 and 4 years. She dreams of educating her children and setting up other income-generating activities to supplement her income. A farmer of nine years, she acquired her start-up capital from accumulated savings from her rental houses.

loans.use: To pay labourers for weeding her watermelon garden.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a Ugandan male aged 40 years who needs a loan to buy dried maize and beans for resale, a business that he has operated for seven years. He hails from Kyenjojo district, a father of five children, and lives in a semi-permanent house with seven people that he takes care of. He dreams of educating his children to a self-reliant level. He acquired his initial capital from growing maize and savings from the sale of same. He faces a problem of agricultural price fluctuations.

loans.use: To buy dried maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is 21 years old and lives in Uganda. She is single and has no children. Prossy has a pig production business, which she has run for three years. She also has a second business making mats.
To help expand her business, Prossy has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more pigs for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Prossy hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.
Prossy is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has aided her prospects for the future by helping her access more capital, which has improved her business.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs for resale.

loans.name: Gwanika Twimuke Group

texts.en:
Edrine wants a loan to buy foodstuffs for her restaurant business. Aged 23 years, she hails from Kyenjojo District of Uganda and is a single mother of one child whom she lives with in a semi-permanent house. 

Having acquired her initial capital from farming, she dreams of growing her restaurant to a hotel. Edrine is a member of Gwanika Twimuke, a group where each member guarantees the others to acquire a loan.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Abariki Group

texts.fr: La cliente  Nyane est entrepreneur, conseillère du groupe d’affaire « Abariki», âgée de 27 ans, mariée, mère de 3 enfants. Elle s’entraide avec son mari dans leur petit business. La cliente est vendeuse de cigarettes au rond point Birere. Elle vend également des poissons salés pour ses revenus supplémentaires. Il y a 5 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Elle démarra son business avec  50 $ reçu de son mari. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec les cigarettes(1 carton de cigarette Stella)à marchander. En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise, scolariser ses enfants et construire une maison. La cliente remercie Hekima pour ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire « Abariki» est majoritairement féminin.
texts.en:
Nyane, a client, is an entrepreneur and the advisor for the business group "Abariki". She is 27 years old, married, and the mother of three. She and her husband mutually assist each other in their small business. She sells cigarettes at the Birere roundabout. She also sells salted fish for additional revenue. She has been in this business for five years. She started it with $50 from her husband. 

This new loan must serve to supply her with cigarettes (a box of Stella) to be sold. Her ambition is to expand her enterprise, to educate her children, and to build a house. 

As our client, Nyane thanks Hekima for acting in favor of the poor who are excluded from traditional banking. It's appropriate to note that the business group "Abariki" is primarily composed of women.

loans.use: to buy a box of Stella cigarettes

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Azer

texts.ru:
Etomu molodomu cheloveku 23 qoda. On ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. Azer yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione, posolok Makhmudlu vmeste so svoimi roditelyami.
Azer uje 2 qoda kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. On seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korov dlya razvitiya svoyeqo novoqo biznessa i uvelicheniya molochnoqo produkta kotorogo on prodayot.
texts.en:
This young man is 23 years old.  He is single and has no children.  Azer is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person). He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region in the village of Makhmudlu with his parents.  

Azer has been a herdsman and cattle breeder for two years.  He now needs 2000 AZN to buy cows to expand his business and increase the quantity of milk products he produces for sale.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Latifah

texts.en:
Latifah is 16 years old and lives in Uganda. She is single and has no children. Latifah has a business selling clothes, which she has run for three years.
To help expand her business, Latifah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Latifah hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself. In the future, she hopes to become an accountant.
Latifah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business, whose profits now pay her school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en: Anastasia is 44 years old, married and has four children.  She has been farming for over ten years.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to get financial education and access business loans easily.  She hopes to have more cows in her farm for more milk production in the future.  She has requested 20,000 Kes to buy animal feed.

loans.use: To buy animal feed.

loans.name: Kigugo Gwebulamidde Association Group

texts.en:
Joseph, a hardworking 47-year-old father of 4, depends on profits from his 20-year-old fish sales enterprise in Mukono. He does a good business, despite the high competition and seasons when fish are scarce.  

Twenty years is a long time in business and Joseph says it would be ill-advised for somebody to write him off.  Given the nature of his business, which is small scale, many of his friends always doubted that he would last long. The odds were stacked against him, but with his self-efficacy, determination and strong belief in his own abilities, he prevailed. 

Joseph toils hard everyday to be able to live within the income that he earns.  He is also a teacher and at times he says he uses his monthly savings to purchase more fish in case he runs short on supply. This normally happens when the earnings and working capital from his main business is not sufficient. Weekly, he says he earns 100,000 shillings in sales profits.  He says with this loan, he is going to purchase more fish to resell. 

One male client by the name of Eric was absent when the photo was taken. I marked him as unpictured.

loans.use: to buy  more fish to sell

loans.name: Hafswa

texts.en:
Hafswa is 21 years old and lives in Uganda. She is single and has one child, who is not currently in school. Hafswa has a business selling fruits and vegetables, which she has run for five years.
To help expand her business, Hafswa has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more fruits and vegetables for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Hafswa hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to own a retail shop.
Hafswa is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by giving her access to capital, which has improved her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Ahlinaz

texts.ru:
Ahlinaz 54 qoda. Ona zamujem i imeyet 4 detey. Ahlinaz yavlyayetsya IDP personom ona pereselenec iz qoroda Agdam, seychas ona projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoim mujem i detmi.
Ahlinaz uje 10 let kak imeyet magazin gde prodayet pisheviye produkti .Ahlinaz bilo trudno soderjat 4 detey na zarplatu muja i poeotmu ona reshila otkrit magazin i tem samim uvelichit yejemesachniy doxod. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi rasshirit pomesheniye svoyeqo magazina dlya vmesheniya bolshe tovarov i razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa.
texts.en:
Ahlinaz is 54 years old.  She is married and has four children.  Ahlinaz is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person). She is a refugee from the city of Agdam who now lives in the Absheron region with her husband and children.  

Ahlinaz has owned her own grocery shop for ten years.  It was hard for Ahlinaz to support four children on her husband's salary, so she decided to open a store and increase their monthly income.  Now she needs 2000 AZN to enlarge her shop in order to carry more goods and expand her business.

loans.use: to enlarge her shop.

loans.name: Saidat

texts.en:
Saidat is 21 years old and lives in Uganda. She is married and has three children, one of whom is currently in school. Saidat has a business making mats, which she has run for three years. She also has a second business – farming.
To help expand her business, Saidat has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more materials for making mats for resale, and fertilizers for her farming business. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Saidat hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, she hopes to own a retail shop.
Saidat is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for making mats for resale, and fertilizers for her farm.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is 18 years old and lives in Uganda. She is single and has no children. Getrude has a business keeping cattle, which she has run for one year. She also has a second business making mats.
To help expand her business, Getrude has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more cattle for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Getrude hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to own a retail shop.
Getrude is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by encouraging her to be hardworking.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for resale.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 20 years old and lives in Uganda. She is married and has one child, who is not currently in school. Judith has a business selling coffee, which she has run for two years. She also has a second business selling bread.
To help expand her business, Judith has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more coffee for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Judith hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.
Judith is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her more job skills such as agriculture and tailoring.

loans.use: to purchase more coffee for resale.

loans.name: Obadiah

texts.en: Obadiah is 66 years old, married and has five children. He is a retired teacher who now raises livestock to support his family. He started farming 40 years ago and joined Faulu Kenya to have easier access to financial resources. He used his previous loan to buy a dairy cow and has benefited from the increased milk production. He is requesting a new loan, for 20,000 Kes, to buy another cow.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Javira

texts.en:
Javira is 17 years old and lives in Uganda. She is single and has no children. Javira has a small retail shop, which she has run for six years. She also has a second business running a poultry farm and rearing domestic animals.
To help expand her business, Javira has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities, such as sugar, for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Javira hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself. In the future, she hopes to take care of herself.
Javira is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save money.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities, such as sugar, for resale.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 17 years old and lives in Uganda. She is single and has no children. Eva has a business selling charcoal, which she has run for two years. She also has a second business running a bar.
To help expand her business, Eva has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more charcoal for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Eva hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself. In the future, she hopes to own a salon.
Eva is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by giving her the opportunity to read story books that have increased her knowledge.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Sulaina

texts.en:
Sulaina is 21 years old and lives in Uganda. She is married and has no children. Sulaina has a business selling coffee, which she has run for three years. She also has a second business selling vegetables.
To help expand her business, Sulaina has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more coffee for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Sulaina hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.
Sulaina is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving the lives of women. As a girl, Sulaina feels happy that she is able to provide everything on her own.

loans.use: to purchase more coffee for resale.

loans.name: Tugolokoke Development Group

texts.en:
Retailing has been 41-year-old Polline's business inclination for the past 9 years. Mukono is where she plies her trade. A worthwhile and return-value enterprise is what she calls it. She says this on the basis of the fact that she has been able to shoulder most of her family's responsibilities with earnings from this business.  

The good graces she has been enjoying have not come easy though as she has had to work painstakingly hard to establish herself. The idea to start this business she reveals came from her husband.  Polline principally sells home products in her shop.

This happily married mother of 5 says she has never regretted making the decision to venture into this business. With the passage of time, she has been brought to terms with the fundamentals and precepts of running this genre of business. She has used the knowledge she has acquired to streamline, improve and bring changes to bear on her business. 

On the side Polline also ekes out supplementary profits from a pig husbandry and sales business.  Weekly, she says her profits are about 100,000 Uganda shillings.  With this kiva loan, she says she is going to purchase more retail home products like plastics and cutlery to resell. 

Charles' face (the male group member) is not seen in the group photo.  He is marked as unpictured.

loans.use: to buy home products to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard is 29 years old, married and has one child. For the last two years, he has made a living by dairy farming and supports his family by selling milk produced by his cows. Since joining Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save money and gained important knowledge about managing a business. In the future, he hopes to open a cattle ranch. He is applying for a loan for 20,000 Kes to buy a freezer for preserving milk.

loans.use: to buy a freezer for preserving milk.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is 58 years old and married to Agnes. Together they have 6 children with ages ranging from 9 to 28. Nicholas sells various items from a small kiosk. He intends to use the requested loan of 10,000 KES to expand his business to become more profitable. He would like to move from a kiosk into a fully stocked retail shop in the future. 

Francis learned about KADET Ltd through a friend. This is his first loan with KADET. He plans to use the proceeds from the loan to boost profits and expand his business. This includes increasing stock of goods like sugar, flour, biscuits and others items so that he does not have stock shortages.

loans.use: buy goods to sell

loans.name: Vidadi

texts.ru:
Vidadi 53 qoda. On jenat i imeyet uje 3 detey. Vidadi yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione derevnya Bala Behmenli vmeste so svoyey drujelubnoy semyoy. 
Vidadi uje 13 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom. Eto uje vtoraya ssuda Vidadi, v perviy raz on bral 1200$ i udachno oplatil svoyu ssudu. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korov dlya razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa.
texts.en:
Vidadi is 53 years old.  He is married and has three children.  Vidadi is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person). He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region in the village of Bala Behmenli with his loving family. 
 
Vidadi has been a herdsman for thirteen years.  This is his second loan.  The first time he borrowed $1200 and successfully paid it off.  Now he needs 2000 AZN to buy cows to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Purity

texts.en: Purity is a 28-year-old member of Wendani B Group in Faulu Kenya. In the group, the members share business ideas, save their money, and guarantee each other's loans. Purity runs a retail shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for thirteen years. She also practices dairy farming for more income. Being a single mother of two, she works hard in her business to meet her children's needs. She hopes to someday expand her shop into wholesale. With 20,000 KES, Purity will buy sugar and rice.

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 50-year-old widowed woman living alone. She is from Lebanon. In 1990, she started her business working as a farmer in her own land. Because of her older age, she had to hire a part-time employee to help her with the work. She is specialized in cultivating all types of vegetables according to the season, all sold to local agricultural markets. 

She obtained her first Kiva loan and was a very good client with punctual payments. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase farming supplies such as fertilizers and seeds. She is sure that the loan will help her increase her profits by 15%.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies such as fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Mutiifu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kabuo est présidente du groupe d’affaire « Mutiifu», âgée de 33 ans, femme vivant seule, mère de 4 enfants.  La cliente est entrepreneur d’un mini restaurant de l’auberge, situé tout proche du marché central Virunga. Environ quatre ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Elle vient de réaliser 10 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Elle démarra son business avec  50 $ de crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec  les aliments et recettes destinés à la cuisine de restaurant (1 sac de haricots,50 kg de pommes de terre,20 litres d’huile de table, les épices, etc.). En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise, scolariser ses enfants et construire une maison.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire « Mutiifu» est majoritairement féminin.
texts.en:
Kabuo, the client, is president of the business group “Mutiifu”. She is a 33-year-old woman living alone and is the mother of four children. The client is a businesswoman in a mini restaurant at the inn located close to the central Virunga market.

She has been practicing this activity for four years. She has completed 10 credit cycles with Hekima. She started her business with a USD 50 loan from Hekima. This new loan will allow her to get supplies for the food necessary in making the recipes and cooking at the restaurant (one bag of beans, 50 kg of potatoes, 20 liters of cooking oil, spices etc.)

In addition, she is planning on enlarging her business, send her children to school and build a house. The client thanks Hekima for its actions dedicated to poor women excluded from the classic banking system. We ought to point that the business group “Mufiitu” is mostly made up of women.

loans.use: to purchase 1 bag of beans, 50 kg of potatoes, 20 liteers of cooking oil and spices.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cosmetics and salon products

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet is 33 years old. She is married and has one child. To earn a living, she runs a retail shop. Apart from operating a retail shop, she is a church pastor. Annet has three years of experience in her business. She has learned business skills from Faulu Kenya, which have enabled her to expand her business. She dreams of opening other outlets of her business in the future. She has requested 20,000 KES to add a stock of sugar, rice, and soap.

loans.use: to add a stock of sugar, rice, and soap.

loans.name: Silvia Marcela

texts.es:
La señora Silvia Marcela de la ciudad de Managua es una persona trabajadora, para darle un mejor nivel de vida a su familia y así salir adelante para el futuro de sus hijos y que sean profesionales y ser unos excelentes trabajadores.
En esta oficina de Ceprodel se presentó la señora anteriormente mencionadaa solicitar crédito para mejorar su vivienda que se encuentra en mal estado, este crédito lo invertirá en compra de materialesde construccióncomo arena, cemento, bloques, hierro, piedrín y pagar mano de obra una parte y la otra en cancelar deudas pendiente, para levantar pared.
texts.en:
Silvia Marcela is from the city of Managua.  She works hard so that she can give her family a better standard of living.  She also works hard so that in the future her children will get ahead, become professionals, and be excellent workers.

She came to the Ceprodel office to request a loan in order to improve her home, which is in bad condition.  She will use part of this loan to buy construction materials like sand, cement, blocks, iron, gravel, and to pay for the labor to put up a wall.  She will use the other part to pay outstanding debts.

loans.use: to pay off consolidated loans and to improve her house.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
En el municipio de Managua, la señora Juana es una persona luchadora debido a que ha sabido llevar el bienestar a su casa para darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia. Ella se ha esforzado para ser el sostén de su hogar con buenos valores morales como persona.

Con este crédito que Ceprodel le ha otorgado agradece porque así les ha dado un mejor nivel de vida a sus hijos, con este desembolso lo utilizara para comprar materiales como verjas y puertas para darle mejor seguridad a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Juana lives in the Managua municipality.  She is a tenacious person, and she has known how to watch out for the well-being of her household.  She does this in order to improve her family’s living conditions.  She has worked hard to support her home and to be a person with good moral values.

She is grateful for this loan from Ceprodel because it has given her children a better standard of living.  She will use this loan to buy materials like iron gates and doors in order to provide her house with better security.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to improve her home.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen is 26 years old and is married to Fredrick, who also contributes to the family income.  She has been farming for a period of about six years and earns an income of about KES 20,000 a month.

This is Doreen' first loan from KADET LTD.  She was introduced to KADET by a staff member.  She wants to use this loan to buy fertilizer and pestcides for her farm. 

In the future, she hopes to expand her farm as well as her salon, a secondary business.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy is 40 years old. She is married and has four children. She sells charcoal to earn a living. She has been in the business for eight years.  She is able to provide for her family with the income she gets from her business. She hopes to expand her family in the future. She has requested 20,000 KES to buy charcoal.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 39 years old. He is married to Nelius, who also contributes to the family income. He has been running his auto spare parts shop for a period of about five years and earns an income of about KES 20,000 a month.

He  was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET staff member. This is his first loan with KADET. He plans to use it to buy more car spare parts for his shop. He hopes to expand his business, give his children quality education and improve their living standard.

loans.use: buy auto spare parts

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 58 years old with one child. He has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 11 years.  
 
He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer and also to pay for labor as he will employ one person to help him with preparing and planting.

In the future, James hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay for labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, maize, beans, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Marlon José

texts.es:
Marlon José de la ciudad de Managua, es conocido como una persona trabajadora de buenos valores morales que se ha ganado el aprecio de muchas personas, que se desempeña en el área administrativa dando lo mejor de él, a sus compañeros de labores.

Actualmente solicitó crédito a Ceprodel, este crédito tendrá lo utilizara en compra de materiales de construcción tales como zinc, perlín y pago de mano de obra. Con estos materiales reparara el techo de su vivienda para una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Marlon José is from the city of Managua.  He is well-known as a hard-working person with good moral values.  He has won the esteem of many people.  He works in administration, and he gives the best of himself to his work colleagues.

He is currently requesting a loan from Ceprodal to buy construction materials like corrugated metal roof sheeting and structural beams.  He will also use the loan to pay for labor.  He will use these materials to repair the roof of his house in order to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to make improvements to his house.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 48 years old and married to Ann. They have four school-going children. He has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the past 16 years.
  
He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers, and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer and also to pay for labor as he will employ one person to help him with preparing and planting.

In the future, David hopes to increase the size of his farm and practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay for labor

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en: Oliver is a 27-year-old single man. He runs a laundry to earn a living. He has been in the business for six years. He has managed to sustain his business because of his good reputation. He has also benefited from Faulu Kenya, because he has gained new skills for running his business. He has requested 20,000 KES to buy a laundry machine and an iron box.

loans.use: to buy a laundry machine and an iron box.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is 37 years old and married. He uses his sewing machine to make bags. He also makes clothes to earn extra income. Julius has been operating his business for two years.  He hopes to supply his bags to students in other regions in the future. He sees himself having a very stable business in five years. He has requested 20,000 KES to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Traice

texts.es:
Traice
Operación 2011-137
350000 colones

Traice tiene 27 años de edad, en este momento tiene 3 meses de embarazo y vive con su pareja Greivin, en la casa de sus padres. Es una joven emprendedora y con muchos deseos de superación, termino la carrera de terapeuta física en la Universidad, pero ante la dificultad de conseguir empleo, esta trabajando en un oficio que aprendió hace mas de 10 años, el arreglo de uñas de pies y manos y actualmente se está especializando en la el arte de uñas artificiales.

Se enteró de Fundación Mujer por medio de una visita realizada a la Ofician de la Mujer en la Municipalidad de Puntarenas, vive en la zona de Carrizal de Puntarenas en la costa del Pacífico Central de Costa Rica, ella se ha estado capacitando en el arte de las uñas artificiales y desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de materiales para esta nueva labor, la cual le va a incrementar los ingresos y espera continuar ahorrando para el próximo año casarse.

Desea ofrecerle a su hijo, que está en su vientre, la oportunidad de contar con una buena calidad de vida. Por la mañana atiende los oficios de la casa y en la tarde empiezan a llegar las clientas o va a visitarlas a domicilio. Con este préstamo, la solicitante va a adquirir materiales para su negocio y continuar capacitándose para mejorar el servicio a sus clientes.

El impacto del crédito es de suma importancia, ya que les da la oportunidad de comprar materia prima y apoyar a su familia ahorrando para alquilar una casa, su moral de pago se demuestra excelente, y las recomendaciones que presenta la demuestran como una persona horada y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Tracie is 27 years old.  Right now, she is 3 months pregnant and lives with her partner Greivin, in her parents' home.  She is an entrepreneurial young woman who has a great desire to improve herself.  She finished a university degree in physical therapy but, faced with difficulty finding work, she is now working in a trade that she learned more than 10 years ago, fixing people's toenails and fingernails.  She is currently specializing in artificial nails.

Tracie found out about Fundación Mujer through a visit to a Women's Office in the town of Puntarenas.  Tracie lives in Carrizal district, in Puntarenas, on the Central Pacific coast of Costa Rica.  She has been training in the art of doing artificial nails and would like to invest her loan in buying materials for this new line of work.  This will help her to increase her income and she hopes to continue saving so that she can get married next year.

Tracie would like to offer her unborn child the opportunity of enjoying a good quality of life.  In the morning, she takes care of her housework and, in the afternoon, either her customers start to arrive or she goes to visit them at home.  With this loan, the borrower would like to acquire materials for her business and continue training so that she can improve her service to her customers.

The impact of this loan is of utmost important since it will give Tracie the opportunity to buy supplies and to support her family, saving up so that she can rent a house.  Her repayment behavior is excellent and the references she has provided show her to be an honest and hard-working person.

loans.use: to invest in materials for a new field that she is working in (fixing people's nails)

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua, el señor Juan Francisco es una persona casada que se desempeña como operario para llevar el bienestar a su hogar y ha logrado mantener a su familia con esfuerzo de su trabajo y así darle una buena condición de vida a su familia. Él se ha caracterizado por ser una persona excelente y con buenos valores morales como persona.

En esta oficina de Ceprodel se presentó el señor Juan Francisco a solicitar crédito para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, el objetivo de este crédito lo necesita para la compra de materiales de construcción como bloques, arena, cemento, piedrín, hierro esto será utilizado para hacer un anexo de un cuarto y así darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, Juan Francisco is a married man who works to provide for the well-being of his household.  He has managed to support his family with his hard work, and to provide good living conditions for his family.  He is characterized as a fine person who has good moral values. 

In this office of Ceprodel, Juan Francisco came to request a loan to improve the conditions of his home.  He will use this loan to buy construction materials such as cement blocks, sand, cement, gravel and steel, to add a room to his house.  In this way he can provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to make improvements to his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise from her catalogues.

loans.name: Marina Esther

texts.es:
Durante 10 años Marina  de 55, se dedicó a la venta de chicha, bolis, helados y fritos que fabricaba desde su casa en el barrio Carrizal, donde vive con su cónyuge y su hija de 36 años de edad, desde hace 45 cuando aun habitaba con sus padres y hermanos recién llegados de Guacamayal en el departamento del Magdalena,  para buscar un mejor estar en la ciudad.  
Marina siempre le ha gustado apoyar su hogar, porque el producto de sus ingresos  son justamente para compensar muchos de sus gastos , pues aunque su esposo es contratista y trabaja para una empresa,  entre los dos logran con su trabajo  suministrar  mayor bienestar su familia. 
Este es el octavo financiamiento que Marina hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización con la que ha logrado un nuevo capital de trabajo,  con el que ha agregado a su actividad inicial, la venta de mercancías variada como cosméticos, ropa calzado accesorios entre otros artículos de la canasta familiar; así mismo ha logrado ser más oportuna con su selecta clientela, la  que cada día  va en aumento. Con su credikiva  comprará arroz, aceites, víveres, enlatados  y otros productos de la canasta familiar que tiene por encargo. Su meta más adelante es tener  su propio local donde pueda exhibir sus mercancías en un punto comercial bien posicionado. Mientras Marina construye su sueño, continua perfeccionando su actividad y trabajando con una utilidad no menor del 20%, que poco a poco muy seguramente incrementará con su disciplina y con la base de valores con los que ella cuenta.
texts.en:
For ten years Marina, 55, sold chicha (beverage made from corn), bolis (frozen fruit treats), ice cream and fried fast food that she prepared at home in the Carrizal neighborhood where she lives with her spouse and 36-year-old daughter.  Forty-five years ago, still living with her parents and siblings, they were recently arrived in Guacamayal in Magdalena Department, seeking a better life in the city.

Marina has always liked to contribute to her home because what she earns is used precisely to pay many of her expenses because, although her husband’s a contractor and works for a firm, between the two of them they manage to supply greater wellbeing for their family.

This is the 8th loan Marina has had with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization that has provided new working capital that she used to add to her initial activity the sale of miscellaneous merchandise like cosmetics, shoes, clothes and accessories, among other items, that are part of a family’s basic shopping basket.  She’s also been timelier with her select clientele which grows daily.

She will use her Kiva loan to buy rice, oil, foodstuffs, canned goods and other items she has on order.  Her goal for later on is to have a locale of her own in a well positioned commercial point to display her merchandise.  While Marina builds her dream she continues to perfect her activity working with a profit margin of no less than 20% which she expects will gradually increase thanks to her discipline and the system of values she has.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, foodstuffs, canned goods and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make improvements to his home, buying construction supplies

loans.name: Maria Filomena

texts.es:
María llegó a la ciudad hace 20 años viuda y en condiciones de desplazamiento con su hija, de 9 años de edad y se radicó en el barrio los Ángeles del Municipio de Soledad, a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla; siendo pionera en el sector, consiguió un quiosco en una avenida principal, donde inició su negocio de venta de cervezas, refrescos y fritos;  hace un año, decidió seguir con su actividad es su casa vendiendo los mismos productos por cajas a vecinos del sector y a esa actividad agregó la venta queso que le envían desde Sincelejo un municipio ganadero  ubicado al noroeste del país, en la Costa Caribe colombiana. Maria en su negocio   vende al mes 64 cajas de cerveza que compra directamente del camión  que distribuye en todos los sectores ; en  su  mayoría sus ventas son de contado y en el momento solo  le adeudan 3 canastas del líquido y cada dia aumentas sus clientes;  para su negocio  de queso  a ella le envían desde Sincelejo  150 libras  cada quince días, producto que  vende a crédito pues tiene clientes que le pagan semanalmente.
En la actualidad Maria está aplicando a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará cajas de cerveza y queso que tiene encargado por clientes fijos a los cuales debe responder oportunamente, para que no lo compren a otros vendedores. Su mayor desafío es la lluvia incesante que disminuye las ventas especialmente las de refrescos y bebidas,  como gaseosas y cervezas, pero como está finalizando el fenómeno de la Niña, sus perspectivas aumentan y se siente muy contenta. Su meta principal es hacer crecer su negocio para poder ofrecerle a su hija el mayor bienestar posible y sobre toda una educación de calidad, pues en el futuro la va a necesitarla para ser exitosa.
texts.en:
María came to the city 20 years ago as a widow.  She moved with her nine year old daughter to the Ángeles neighborhood in the Soledad municipality.  It is 15 minutes from the city of Barranquilla.  Being a pioneer in the area, she obtained a kiosk on a main avenue.  This is where, one year ago, she started her business of selling beer, soft drinks, and fried food. 

She decided to continue her business activity at her house.  She sells the same products by the case to her neighbors in the zone.  She added selling cheese to her business.  The cheese is sent to her from Sincelejo, a ranching municipality in the northeastern part of the country.  It is on the Caribbean coast of Colombia.

In her business Maria sells 64 cases of beer a month.  She buys directly from the truck that distributes to all of the sectors.  Most of her sales are for cash, and now her customers owe her for only three cases of beverages. Each day she gets more customers.

For her cheese business she is sent 150 pounds of cheese every two weeks from Sincelejo.  She sells this product on credit, and her customers pay her weekly.

Maria is currently applying for her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the loan to buy cases of beer and cheese.  She has orders from her fixed customers, and she needs to respond in a timely fashion so that they do not buy from other sellers.

Her biggest challenge is the incessant rain that makes sales go down, especially the drinks like soft drinks and beer.  However, as the phenomena of La Niña is ending, her outlook for the future is improving, and she is very content.

Her main goal is to have her business grow in order to offer her daughter as much prosperity as possible.  Above all, she wants to give her daughter a quality education.  She will need that in the future in order to be successful.

loans.use: to fill orders she has for beer and cheese.

loans.name: Yuvicsa

texts.es: Yuvicsa tiene 19 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para mejorar su calida de vida. Yuvicsa ofrece alquiler de habitaciones de su propio inmueble, ella es dueña de una amplia casa, por ello vio esta oportunidad de ganarse dinero. Se considera una persona emprendedora y muy optimista, por ello desea ahora instalar una tienda en la primera planta de su casa, para que pueda vender productos alimenticios, de esa manera invierte sus ganancias. Tiene 3 años trabajando de esta manera, sin embargo los problemas nunca faltan cuando debe enfrentar con algunos inquilinos que se demoran en el pago o de aquellos que no quieren pagar. Aún así sabe que tiene que ponerle todas sus ganas y esfuerzo para salir adelante, por ello pide de su ayuda para que pueda dar un mantenimiento adecuado a su inmueble para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus inquilinos. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP y es muy puntual en sus cuotas, ya que siempre ahorra para poder pagarlas, en su banco comunal es muy activa y siempre esta pendiente del bienestar de las demás socias. Los setecientos nuevos soles solicitados, los invertirá para arreglar las habitaciones que están en alquiler.
texts.en:
Yuvicsa is 19 years old.  She is a very kind and hard-working woman who lives in her own home and is prepared to work very hard in order to improve her quality of life.

Yuvicsa rents out rooms in her own home.  She owns a large house and so saw the opportunity to earn some money.  She considers herself to be an entrepreneurial and very optimistic person.  For this reason, she would like to set up a store on the first floor of her home so that she can sell food products and invest her profits in this way.

Yuvicsa has been working in this business for three years.  She has problems when she has to face up to tenants who delay payment or don't want to pay.  However, in spite of that, she knows that she has to put all her will and effort into her business if she wants to get ahead in life.  For this reason, she is requesting your help so that she can have appropriate maintenance work done on her building so that she can provide a better service to her tenants.

This is Yuvicsa's fourth loan from MFP.  She is very punctual in making her repayments as she always saves up so that she can make them on time.  Yuvicsa is a very active member of her community bank and she is always watching out for the well-being of her fellow group members.  She will invest the 700 Peruvian soles she is requesting in fixing up her rental rooms.

loans.use: to fix up her rental rooms

loans.name: Giovanni Francisco

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua, el señor Giovanni Francisco se caracteriza por ser un buen trabajador debido a que ha sabido llevar el bienestar de su hogar y ha logrado darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia. Aél se le conoce por ser una persona excelente y con buenos valores morales como persona.

En esta oficina de Ceprodel se presentó el señor Giovanni Francisco a solicitar crédito para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, el objetivo de este crédito lo necesita para la compra de materiales de construcción como bloques, arena, cemento, piedrín, hierro esto será utilizado para hacer un garaje y así darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, señor Giovanni Francisco is known for being a good worker because he has known how to improve  the well-being of his household and give his family a better quality of life.  He is also known for being an excellent person who has good moral values.

Señor Giovanni Francisco came into this Ceprodel office to request a loan to improve the condition of his dwelling.  The purpose of this loan is to purchase construction materials like blocks, sand, cement, gravel and iron.  These items will be used to build a garage to give his family a quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to make improvements to his dwelling.

loans.name: Videla

texts.es: Videla tiene 60 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su querido hijo menor Jelmar D. 28 años y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para mejorar su calidad D. vida. Una D. las tiendas D. abarrotes más concurridas D. la ciudad D. Pucallpa, es la D. Videla, quien a partir D. las 6 D. la mañana empieza con la atención a sus clientes y no para hasta las 9 ó 10 D. la noche. Ella es una vendedora muy alegre y siempre recibe con una sonrisa a las personas que concurren a su tienda. Lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, sin embargo el tener que permanecer parada todo el tiempo afecta sus riñones, además desea también atender a su familia, pero sabe que es parte del sacrificio para salir adelante. Para el futuro  desea que su tienda crezca y se convierta en la principal D. su barrio. Por ello espera D. su apoyo con un pequeño préstamo para que pueda invertir en su negocio. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP y esta segura D. poder pagar todas sus cuentas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es una D. las socias más alegres y responsables. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos para implementar su tienda.
texts.en:
Videla is 60 years old.  She is a very simple and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her beloved son, 28 year-old Jelmar.  She is prepared to work very hard to improve her quality of life.

Videla's grocery store is one of the busiest in the city of Pucallpa.  She starts serving her customers from 6 o'clock in the morning and doesn't stop until 9 or 10 o'clock at night.  She is a very cheerful saleswoman who always greets customers who come to her store with a smile.  She has been in this business for two years and what she most enjoys about her work is chatting to her customers.  Having to stay on her feet all day affects her kidneys and she would like to be able to have time to look after her family but Videla knows that this is all part of the sacrifice she must make in order to get ahead in life.

In the future, Videla would like her store to grow and become the main one in her neighborhood.  For this reason, she hopes that you will support her with this small loan so that she can invest in her business.

This is Videla's second loan from MFP and she is certain that she will be able to make all of her repayments on time.  She is one of the most cheerful and responsible members of her community bank.  Videla will use the 800 Peruvian soles that she has requested to buy more products with which to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy more products to stock her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials for housing repairs

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
La Sra. Guillermina tiene 60 años D. edad. Se dedica a la crianza y venta D. pollos, patos y gallos D. pelea. Ella es casada. Su esposo percibe un ingreso mensual por su pensión D. jubilación. Viven en casa propia ubicada en el distrito D. Tate Camino GranD.. Su vivienda está siendo lentamente reconstruida  con sus esfuerzos después del terremoto del año 2007. Ella es una mujer  muy emprendedora. Su sueño es incrementar la crianza D. animales tener mayor ingresos y así poder tener una mejor calidad D. vida.
La Sra. Guillermina se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo que le estamos brindando con este financiamiento.
texts.en:
La Sra. Guillermina tiene 60 años D. edad. Se dedica a la crianza y venta D. pollos, patos y gallos D. pelea. Ella es casada. Su esposo percibe un ingreso mensual por su pensión D. jubilación. Viven en casa propia ubicada en el distrito D. Tate Camino GranD.. Su vivienda está siendo lentamente reconstruida  con sus esfuerzos después del terremoto del año 2007. Ella es una mujer  muy emprendedora. Su sueño es incrementar la crianza D. animales tener mayor ingresos y así poder tener una mejor calidad D. vida.
La Sra. Guillermina se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo que le estamos brindando con este financiamiento.

loans.use: Incrementar la crianza de animales

loans.name: Emmanuel Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama "Emmanuel" y se ubica en el estado de México. Esta comunidad se distingue porque una de las actividades productivas que predominan en el lugar es el de la Agricultura, ganadería y comercio de pescado, verduras y frutas en los tianguis de la región de la zona norte del Estado de México. El grupo está conformado por 8 integrantes.

La señora Clemencia es integrante del grupo. Ella es originaria y se dedica a la venta de futas y verduras; actividad que inició hace 15 años. Sus ventas las realiza en los tianguis de los alrededores de su municipio. Su negocio le permitio salir adelante y realizar sus sueños de tener un negocio estable y que le ayuda a salir con los gatos familiares ya que conjuntamente con su esposo luchan para salir adelante. Clemencia tiene 33 años, estudio la secundaria, es casada y tiene 3 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella y de su esposo que gracias a su negocio los han sacado adelante con sus estudios. 

Quiere el prestamo para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio que durante los últimos 15 años le ha dado la oportunidad de mantener a su familia y de construír una casita; desea que con el crédito su negocio se siga fortaleciendo. Actualmente  tiene la fe de que saldra adelante y que más adelante pueda establecer un local y vender ahi su mercancia sin dejar sus puestos en los tienguis. Y así seguir logrando sus sueños para que sus hijos lleguen a tener una carrera que les permita tener una buena vida cuando construyan su propia familia.
texts.en:
This group is called “Emmanuel” and is located in the State of México.  This community stands out because the productive activities that predominate are farming, raising livestock and the sale of fish, vegetables and fruit in the "tianguis" (movable markets)  that take place in the north of the State of México.  The group has 8 members.

Clemencia is a group member.  She is a founder and sells fruit and vegetables, a business she started 15 years ago.  Her sales take place at the various movable markets that occur in the outskirts of the municipality.  Her business made it possible for her to get ahead and reach her dream of having a stable business that helps her meet family expenses since, together with her husband, she struggles to get ahead.  Clemencia is 33 years old and completed secondary school.  She’s married and has three children that depend economically on her and her husband.  Thanks to her business they’ve provided them with an education.

She wants the loan to continue investing in her business that for the last 15 years has given her the ability to support her family and build a house.  She hopes that with help from the loan the business will continue getting stronger.  She has faith that she will continue to grow and be able and be able, later on, to have a fixed locale to sell her goods while still continuing to sell in the markets too and thus continue reaching her dreams of helping her children attain careers that will allow them to have better lives when they form their own families.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials to improve his home.

loans.name: Las Chicas Del Mirador Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Las Chicas Del Mirador", porque viven en una loma desD. donD. se ve su comunidad, estan ubicadas en el estado D. México. Verónica es una integrante del grupo, tiene 32 años, tiene 1 hija. Ella es comerciante, se dedica a la venta D. colchas, solicitó su préstamo para adquirir más productos y así tener más variedad D. modelos y tamaños para todos los gustos y necesidades D. sus clientes. La señora verónica se siente muy contenta con la oportunidad que le ofrecen para continuar vendiendo e invirtiendo en su negocio. Con las ganancias que obtenga lograr una estabilidad económica en su hogar y poder ahorrar para la educación D. su hija. Es una mujer trabajadora que busca tener una mejor calidad D. vida y la felicidad D. compartirlo con su familia.
texts.en: The “Las Chicas Del Mirador” (The Ladies of the Vantage Point) Communal bank is named that way because they live on a hill where they oversee their community that is located in the state of México. Verónica is 32 years old and has a daughter. She sells bedspreads and needs the loan to get more products to have a greater variety, models and sizes for all the tastes and needs of her customers. Mrs. Verónica feels very happy with the opportunity that she is receiving to keep selling and investing in her business.
