Por ahora lo que más prioriza es sembrar más plantas de cacao ya que cuenta con 01 hectárea más de terreno por cultivar. Este será su cuarto crédito con MFP, siente que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy querido por el resto de sus compañeros, ya que es muy solidario con ellos. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles solicitados, contratará jornaleros para que le brinden el apoyo en las cosechas de café y cacao ya que estos productos están en temporadas de cosecha.
texts.en:
Miguel, 40, is from the city of Quimbiri. He's married to Teodosia, 40, with whom he has 3 children. They live in their own home in the community of Bethel, next to the disrict of Quimbiri. Miguel is the breadwinner in his family. Since he was a young child his parents taught him to work on the farm. Now he is a farmer and has 4 hectares of land where he grows coffee and cacao, native plants to the Apurimac River Valley forests. He has worked on his own land for 15 years, and at harvest time he has help from day laborers so that he can gather the fruit more quickly. What he likes most about his job is the harvest, since he can see the the returns from his many months of hard work.  He thinks the hardest part of his job is transporting his grains from the field to the storage centers located in the city of San Francisco, which is where they offer the best prices for his products. 

He doesn't have enough money to invest and pay the day laborers ahead of time, which is why he comes to MFP for a loan. He hopes that with the support of each one of you he will be able to invest in his business. Right now his greatest priority is planting more cacao since he has another hectare of land to cultivate. 

This will be his 4th loan with MFP. He thinks this support will help him to progress a lot in his work. With the 1,500 nuevos soles requested, he will contract day laborers to provide support in harvesting coffee and cacao since it's harvest time.

loans.use: to hire day laborers to help harvest his fruit.

loans.name: Trabajando En Armonia Group

texts.es: El señor MElaneo P.  es natural D. Chiclayo tiene  65 años y es soltero desD. muy joven se a dedicado a la pesca ya que toda su familia es pescadora.  El se dedica a pescar y luego venD.  todo su pescado es el puerto. Viaja por lo general los fines D. semana, y durante la semana se dedica a la cerrajeria realiza ventanas y puertas en fierro a pedido. Su deseo mas granD. es poder terminar D. construir su propia casa. Con su prestamo se va a comprar un bote D. segunda para poder salir a la pesca y tambien para poder alquilarlo.
texts.en:
Melaneo is a native of Chiclayo, 65 years old, and single. From a very early age, he has dedicated his time to fishing, as has all his family. He still fishes and sells his catch in the port. On weekends, he goes out to fish, and during the week, he does ironwork, fulfilling orders for customized iron gratings for windows and doors.

His greatest desire is to be able to finish constructing his own house. With this loan, he will buy a second-hand boat to fish in and, also, to rent out.

loans.use: to invest in buying a fishing boat.

loans.name: Cazadoras Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama "Cazadoras" esta ubicado en el estado de México, esta conformado por 11 integrantes entre ellas la señora Rita, ella nos platica que desde los quince años comenzo a vender con su mama tamales, tortillas y quesadillas, más adelante emprendio su propio negocio vendiendo comida guisados y algunos antojitos mexicanos. Ella quiere el prestamo para rentar un local y así hacer crecer su negocio; dar una mejor atencion a sus clientes y sea más saludable. Nos comenta que anhela seguir pidiendo prestamo para invertirlo en su negocio ya que tiene muchos clientes y aveces no puede atenderlos a todos con la calidad que ellos merece y posteriormente comprar su propio local. Tambien desea contribuir con los gastos de su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The group is called “Cazadoras” (Huntresses) and is located in the State of México.  It has 11 members among whom is Rita.  She tells us that she started selling tamales, tortillas and quesadillas with her mother fifteen years ago.  Later on, she ventured into a business of her own selling dishes and some Mexican snacks.  

She wants a loan to rent a locale so that her business can grow and she can provide better service and it can be more healthy.  She comments that she’d like to continue asking for loans to invest in her business because she has many customers but sometimes can tend to all of them with the quality they deserve and later on buy a locale of her own.  She also wants to contribute to meeting family expenses and to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to rent a locale for her food business.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz de 20 años, es una joven soltera alegre y trabajadora con ganas de sobresalir en la vida, vive en su propia casa situada en la comunidad de Bethel anexo del distrito de Quimbiri y lo que más desea es obtener mejores ingresos para así darle una estabilidad económica a su futura familia. Ella es una jovencita muy laboriosa, con su puesto de trabajo trata de sobresalir adelante. Es comerciante y tiene un paraje de abarrotes situado en su comunidad, desde entonces la bodega de Luz es muy frecuentado por sus compradores, debido a su buen trato. Su negocio esta abierto desde muy temprano hasta altas hora de la noche. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes ya que es una de sus habilidades que emplea para ganar mayor cantidad de consumidores, lleva 03 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer de pie casi todo el día. Con el tiempo piensa incrementar sus ganancias abriendo un pequeño mini Marquet dentro de su comunidad Bethel. Este es su segundo crédito de Luz con MFP, siente que este aporte le ayudará mucho con el progreso de su trabajo y esta dispuesta cumplir puntualmente con sus cronogramas de pagos. Se siente muy acorde trabajar con los socios de su banco comunal. Con el crédito solicitado comprara más productos para implementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Luz, 20, is a single, cheerful and hard working young woman with the desire to get ahead in life.  She lives in her own house located in the community of Bethel, an annex of Quimbiri District.  What she most wants is to earn better income to provide economic stability to her future family.  

She is a very hard working young woman; she does her best to get ahead with her work.  She is a merchant.  She has a grocery stand in her community.  Since then her store has been very popular with buyers because of the good treatment they get.  Her business is open from very early until late at night.  What she likes best about her work is chatting with her customers since this is one of her abilities that she uses to win over larger number of consumers.  She’s been in business for three years and considers the most difficult part having to be on her feet almost all day.  In time, she hopes to increase her profits opening a small mini market in the community of Bethel.

This is Luz’s second loan with MFP.  She feels that the contribution will help her business’ progress very much and is willing to repay in a timely fashion.  She is very agreeable to working with her fellow communal bank members.  She will use the requested loan to buy more merchandise to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto, tiene 50 años de edad, es originario de Boaco departamento ubicado en el norte del país ,pero vive en la ciudad de Estelí , de oficio comerciante el se dedica a vender herramientas de trabajo en una ferretería , esta casado , es padre de 6 hijos. Cuando el inicio este negocio tenia 38 años de edad, su inventario en aquel entonces era muy poco, comenzó con capital propio , el tuvo que vender un terreno que tenia para poder iniciar este negocio , anteriormente el vendía granos básicos pero después decidió que vender productos para ferretería se ganaba mejor además tenia que buscar como sacar adelante a su familia. Hoy en día su esposa lo ayuda a atender el negocio, esta ubicado en su casa de habitación. 
El solicito el préstamo para compras más inventario a su ferretería, sus ventas son muy buenas pero le hacen falta más productos para ofrecer. Con esta inversión  espera poder hacer crecer su negocio, pues podrá tener mas inventario para vender, hacer mas clientes, mejorar sus ventas e ingresos también.  
Su meta próxima es expandir su negocio y ahorrar para terminar de preparar a sus hijos para que tengan una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is 50 years old, a native of Boaca department, located in the north of the country, but he lives in the city of Esteli. His trade is merchant and he sells iron work created in his hardware store. He is married and the father of 6 children. 

When he began the business, he was 38 years old. His inventory in those days was very small. He began with his own capital, and had to sell a piece of land to begin the enterprise. Previously, he sold basic grains but, later, decided to sell iron products to earn more money and advance his family. Today, his wife helps him attend the business, which is located in his house of residence.

Rigoberto is requesting a loan to buy more inventory for his hardware store. His sales are very good but he lacks more products to offer. With this investment, he hopes to expand his business. With more inventory to sell he will gain customers and improve both sales and income.

His immediate goals are to expand his business and save money in order to prepare his children for a university education.

loans.use: buy more inventory for his hardware store.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
Rosa, vive únicamente con su esposo, se dedica a atender una tienda D. productos D. primera necesidad, existe desD. hace 20 años, lo heredo D. sus padres, y en la actualidad lo atienD. todos los días.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra D. arroz, aceite, azúcar, frijol, huevos y mas, productos que son demandados a diario por los clientes, esta será una gran ayuda para los clientes ya que encontraran en su tienda, todo lo necesario para el hogar.
Su aspiración es trabajar por tener ingresos que le ayuden a vivir cómodamente con su esposo.
texts.en:
Rosa lives with just her husband.  Her business is serving in a store selling basic household products.  She has owned the store for 20 years and inherited it from her parents.  She currently works in the store every day.

Rosa is requesting a loan to buy rice, oil, sugar, beans, eggs and other products that her customers ask for daily.  This will be a great help for her customers as they will be able to find everything they need for their households in her store.

Rosa's aspiration is to work so that she can make enough profits for herself and her husband to live comfortably.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, sugar, beans and eggs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more beauty products to supply her business.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel owns Brilliant Elegance, a company offering window-cleaning services to businesses and private residences.  He opened Brilliant Elegance five years ago, after he and his wife moved from Idaho to Mission, Texas, so they could be closer to her family.  Before owning Brilliant Elegance, Samuel worked as the CFO for an optometrist’s office.  Dissatisfied with the long hours and low pay, Samuel wanted to position himself strategically so that his hard work would translate into financial independence.  At the time, he was washing windows on the weekends for additional income, so he began exploring the possibility of converting this weekend job into a full-time business.  It was important that he open a business with minimal startup cost, so Samuel thoroughly researched the industry and wrote a business plan budgeting estimated costs and revenues.  Seeing excellent potential for profitability, he opened Brilliant Elegance and never looked back.

His clients come in all shapes and sizes -- from restaurant chains, to grocery stores, to private residences.  Until now, Samuel has typically worked alone and only hired additional workers as needed.  However, in order to meet a growing workload and facilitate further expansion, Samuel is hiring 3-4 full-time employees.  This loan from ACCION Texas-Louisiana provides him the capital to hire these employees and helps him cover payroll over the next couple of months.  Typically, Samuel must wait up to 60 days before his new business accounts begin paying him, so he anticipates this expansion to strain his cash flow temporarily.

A constant challenge for Samuel has been maintaining contracts with clients affected by the recession, because his services are among the first cut by businesses looking to reduce costs.  Samuel says that one of his clients, a national restaurant chain, discontinued his services to save money and transferred the responsibility of washing windows to their employees.  However, after just two weeks, they realized that they couldn’t maintain the windows at the level Samuel did and that their restaurant’s appearance was suffering as a result.  So, they called Samuel back and renewed his contract.  He says that his key to success is showing clients how his services add value to their business by creating an atmosphere that is appealing to customers.

In the future, Samuel wants to expand his business to other markets in Texas as well as move into lateral industries like janitorial services, asphalt and line painting repairs, as well as general building maintenance.  For the time being, though, he remains focused on growing his accounts in the greater-Mission area.

loans.use: to hire new employees and expand business

loans.name: Karen Narobia

texts.en: Karen, 26 years old, started her business of selling clothes and cosmetics door-to-door approximately three years ago with the help of a small loan from her grandmother.  Since that time, Karen has built up a strong client base and her business has grown steadily.  With the increased demand for her products, Karen plans to use the proceeds from this loan to update and increase her inventory so that her business can continue to expand.

loans.use: to update and increase her inventory

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.es:
Lucinda es madre de familia de 47 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia,  la cual cuenta con el servicio solo de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Mórrope, que se encuentra a una hora de distancia aproximadamente del departamento de Lambayeque.  El distrito es una zona turística, agrícola y ganadera.

Lucinda se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales de corral, desde hace 5 años aproximadamente, su corral lo tiene en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales, una vez que llegaron a su desarrollo ideal los vende en el mercado de Lambayeque y Chiclayo.  Otra actividad que realiza es la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su domicilio, con los ingresos que logre obtner por la venta de los mismos podra solventar sus obligaciones familiares.

A solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para continuar comprando animales, arreglar su corral y para la compra de productos para implementar su negocio, las ganancias que logre recaudar será para pagar su préstamo y poder sacar a su familia adelante.
texts.en:
Lucinda is a 47-year old mother who lives with her husband and children in her own home, which only has electrical service.  It is located in the Mórrope district, located approximately one hour’s distance from the department of Lambayeque.  The district is a zone that is known for its tourism, agriculture and livestock.

Lucinda has dedicated herself to raising and selling farm animals for about 5 years.  Her corral is located behind her house.  She gives her animals balanced feed and natural grasses and, once they are the ideal size, she sells them at the market in Lambayeque and Chiclayo.  Another activity she carries out is selling basic products from her house.  With the income she manages to obtain from her sales, she will be able to meet the family’s obligations.

She has requested a loan of 1,000 new Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternative to continue buying animals, fix her corral, and to buy products to supply her business.  The earnings she makes will be to repay her loan and to help her family get ahead.

loans.use: buy more farm animals, repair her corral, and supply her general store with products.

loans.name: Grupo Unido Group

texts.es: La señora Eulogia tiene 53 años de edad, es viuda y tiene seis hijos de los cuales solo uno depende de ella ya que es menor de edad y aun esta estudiando. Luego de fallecer su esposo ella tuvo que salir a trabajar para poder sustentar a sus hijos, vende anticuchos y mollejitas por la noche en la entrada de la zona en la que vive asi mismo vende golosinas en los locales donde  realizan fiestas patronales. Su prestamo actual lo utilizara para invertir en su negocio. Su deseo es poder tener un local propio en donde poder ofrecer sus ricos anticuchos
texts.en:
Eulogia is 53 years old.  She is a widow and has six children.  Only one of her children is dependent on her as he is still a child and in school.  After her husband died, Eulogia had to go out to work in order to support her children.  She sells kebabs and sweetbreads in the evening at the entrance to the area where she lives.  She also sells candies in places where they are celebrating town festivals.

Eulogia will use this loan to invest in her business.  Her wish is to own her own premises where she can sell her delicious kebabs.

loans.use: to invest in buying merchandise

loans.name: Sandra Lorena

texts.es:
Sandra, vive con un hijo, ella se dedica a vender productos cosméticos por revista, esta venta la realiza de forma ambulante, por los caseríos cercanos a su vivienda.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos cosméticos y medicinas para ofrecer a los clientes, el crédito le ayudara para mejorar el inventario de los productos.
Su sueño es que a través del trabajo, logre algún día comprarse una casa donde vivir segura con su hijo.
texts.en:
Sandra lives with her son.  Her business is selling cosmetics through a catalog.  She makes her sales door to door in the small villages near her home.  She is requesting a loan to buy cosmetics and medicines to sell to her customers.  The loan will help her to improve her stock of products.

Sandra's dream is to be able to some day buy a house, through her work, where she can live safely with her son.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics (make-up, creams, lipsticks) and medicines

loans.name: Los Chupaquinitos Group

texts.es:
La Señora Haydee tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera con un hijo menor en etapa escolar, Haydee es socia de la alcancia comunal los "Chupaquinitos", se dedica a la compra y venta de animal vacuno en pie, ella se traslada durante las semanas en las  diferentes ferias de su centro poblado  para realizar la compra de animales y revender a los carniceros y asi generar sus propios ahorros para su canasta familiar y para los gastos de estudio de su hijo. Solicito el préstamo para aumentar su capital de trabajo, el prestamo lo utilizara para la compra de insumos de engorde y alimentacion para el ganado.
la Sra. Haydee se encuentra al centro de las dos señoras de la foto principal esta con chompa de color gris.
texts.en:
Haydee is 35 years old.  She is a single mother and has one son who is in school.  She is a member of "Los Chupaquinitos" community bank and her business is buying and selling cattle.  During the week, she travels to the different livestock markets in her area to buy animals and re-sell to butchers.  In this way, she makes her own savings with which to cover her family's basic expenses and also her son's educational expenses.

Haydee requested this loan to increase her working capital and will use the loan to purchase feed and vitamins for her cattle. Haydee is located in the center of the two women in the main picture and is wearing a gray sweatshirt.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her cattle

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
María tiene 30 años de edad, vive en su casa propia con su esposo e hijos, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Mórrope que se encuentra a 40 minutos del departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se dedica a la actividad agrícola, ganadería y turismo (tiene festividades  religiosas muy bonitas).

María es comerciante desde hace muchos años de ganado vacuno (vacas), su corral se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para qué pueda ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar los gastos de su hogar. 

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para comprar más animales y arreglar sus corral, con la finalidad de que con los ingresos que obtenga pueda brindarlea su familia una mejor calidad de vida.  María es una mujer  muy responsable y trabajadora que se preocupa por tener mejoras para su negocio y seguir solventando sus necesidades familiares y brindarle a sus hijos otras oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
María is 30 years old and lives with her husband and children in her own house, which only has the service of electricity.  It is located in the district of Mórrope, which can be found 40 minutes from the department of Lambayeque.  This zone is dedicated to activities related to farming, livestock and tourism (they have beautiful religious festivals).

María has been a livestock merchant for many years (cows).  Her corral is located outside her house, and she gives them balanced feed and natural grasses so they will grow optimally.  She offers them throughout the various markets in the zone, and that is how she generates good profits to meet the household expenses.

She has requested a loan of 3000 new Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternative to buy more animals and make repairs to her corral.  The end result hopefully being that, with the earnings she obtains, she will be able to provide a higher standard of living for her family.  María is a very responsible and hard-working woman who worries about improving her business and continuing to meet the family’s needs.  She wants to give her children other opportunities in life.

loans.use: buy more animals and make repairs to her corral.

loans.name: Danilo Santiago

texts.en: Danilo Santiago is a 36-year-old married father of three children, ages 4, 9, and 12.  He owns a small tailoring business that produces various types of clothing.  The loan will be used to buy additional fabric to produce more clothes and grow the business.  Danilo Santiago’s dream is to be able to support and ultimately provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy additional fabric to produce more clothes and grow the business

loans.name: Veronica Roxana

texts.es:
Verónica, vive con su esposo y un hijo, ella tiene un ciber y también venD. productos varios, tiene cuatro años D. estar al frente del negocio, ella es una profesional en computación, por lo que se le hizo fácil montar el negocio.
Ella solicita un préstamo para actualizar y dar mantenimiento a las maquinas, ya que con este proceso estará mejorando el rendimiento y el servicio del ciber.
Su objetivo es mantenerse en el negocio, poco a poco ir aumentado el número D. computadoras y D. igual manera mejorar los ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Verónica lives with her husband and son.  She owns an Internet cafe and also sells a variety of products.  She has been running her business for four years.  Verónica is an IT professional and so she found it easy to set up her business.

Verónica is requesting a loan to upgraD. and have maintenance work done on her machines since this will help improve their performance and thereby the service she provides in her Internet cafe.

Verónica's goal is to keep running her business and gradually increase her number of computers.  She also hopes to improve her family income.

loans.use: to have maintenance work carried out on her machines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy footwear, perfume, sheets, towels and clothes in general.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa, vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos de 13 y 10 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de meriendas y tortillas, tiene 6 años de trabajar con este negocio que hasta hoy ha sido la fuente de ingreso con la que cuenta para apoyarse junto a su esposo y juntos velar por las necesidades del hogar.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de ingredientes para las meriendas como: pollo, carnes, frijoles, arroz, aceite y condimentos, también maíz para las tortillas, con esta ayuda contara con todo lo necesario para su negocio.
El objetivo de Teresa es que a través de su esfuerzo, sus hijos puedan estudiar y preparase para mejorar sus oportunidades.
texts.en:
Teresa lives together with her husband and two children aged 13 and 10.  Her business is selling snacks and tortillas.  She has been working in this business for six years and it has been the source of income with which she has supported her family, together with her husband's help.

Teresa is requesting a loan to buy ingredients for making her snacks such as chicken, meat, beans, rice, oil and condiments.  She will also buy corn for making her tortillas.  With this help, she will have everything she needs for her business.

Teresa's goal is to work hard so that her children can study and prepare themselves in order to improve their opportunities.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat, beans, rice, oil, condiments and corn

loans.name: Las Estrellitas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama las Estrellitas y se Ubica en la localidad de Tecpatan estado de Chiapas, la señora quien se le tomo la entrevista se llama Matilde es madre soltera  y su responsabilidad tiene dos hijos: Erlin de veinte años, Yessenia Guadalupe de  quince años.

     Ella se dedica a la compra de hilos para  la elaboración de hamacas, para luego venderlo en la misma localidad y así también vender trastes de tupper, en donde lleva quince años, lo que comenta que le  va bien ya que con ello  ha logrado apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios.

    Aprendió  esta actividad con su mama ya que ella también se dedicaba a lo mismo  y desde muy  joven aprendió  y  cuando se caso dejo de practicarlo, pero para apoyar a su esposo  comenzó de nuevo  así  los  dos sacar adelante a sus hijos que estaban creciendo  quien desafortunada mente la abandono hace unos años, pero aun así ella sigue trabajando.


     Su más grande deseo es que con esta actividad y  el préstamo pueda seguir trabajando para que con ello logre tener ahorros para apoyar  seguir apoyando a sus hijos que están estudiando.

     Los demás integrantes del grupo son: Irma quien se dedica a la compra  de maíz para la elaboración de tascalate, pinol, y también la venta de  refresco, la señora blanca luz: quien invierte el préstamo en la compra de mercancía para surtir su tienda de abarrotes, Jorge Antonio  se dedica  a la copra y venta de pollos de rancho para criarlo y luego venderlo, así también la señora Bertha que invierte el préstamo en la compra de pollos de granja  para luego venderlo  aliñado.
texts.en:
This group is called “Las Estrellitas” (The Little Stars) and is located in Tecpatan, Chiapas.  The woman who gave the interview is Matilde.  She’s a single mother with two children in her care: Erlin, 20, and Yessenia Guadalupe, 15.

She buys cordage to make hammocks that she resells in her same location.  She also sells Tupperware.  She’s been in business 15 years and she comments that she does well because it’s allowed her to provide her children with schooling.

She learned this occupation with her mother since she was in the same line of work and she learned while still very young.  When she got married she stopped doing it but, in order to help out her husband, she started up again so that together they could raise their children who were growing.  Unfortunately, he left her a few years ago but even so she continues to work.

Her greatest wish is that with this activity and the loan she will be able to continue to work so that she can manage to have some savings to continue supporting her children who are still studying.

The other group members are:  Irma, who buys and sells corn to make tascalate and pinol (traditional corn-based beverages from Chiapas) and also sells soft drinks, Blanca Luz, who will use the loan to buy stock merchandise for her grocery store, Jorge Antonio who buys and sells free range chickens to raise and later sell and Bertha who will use the loan to buy free range chickens to later sell butchered.

loans.use: to pay for cordage to make hammocks.

loans.name: Cuanicuti Group

texts.es:
La señora Judith es una mujer muy emprendedora y trabajadora ella es originaria del Distrito Federal, pero se fue a vivir desde hace 15 años a la población de Zitacuaro Michoacán por que a su esposo le ofrecieron un mejor trabajo en esa población. Ella esta casada con el señor Ernesto el cual es Chef, ellos tienen dos hijos un joven de 17 años estudiante de preparatoria y una niña de 8 años estudiante de primaria. ella se dedica hacer banquetes para fiestas como quince años, bautizos, presentaciones, bodas, cumpleaños etc. y repostería para vender a sus clientes, ella hace piernas de pavo, lomos, pavos, ensaladas, sopas, pastas, postres, comenta que quien le enseño hacer todo esto fue su esposo ya que el se había quedado sin trabajo y decidieron hacer este negocio ellos dos. Comenta que ella hace cada tercer día empanadas rellenas de comida o de mermeladas, bisquets, pays, y ya le gente le manda hacer pedidos. Comenta que ella esta pidiendo un préstamo para comprar la materia prima para hacer sus comidas y sus postres para venderlos, dice que surte todos los productos en diferentes tiendas de su población, también comenta que desgraciadamente no ha podido crecer su negocio tan rápido ya que las rentas son muy caras y ya hay mucha competencia en su población. La meta que tiene Judith es hacer un local propio en cual pueda poner su negocio estable y así tendría más clientes.
Los demás integrantes del grupo se llaman Araceli, Manuel, Decire, Minerva, Fabiola, Blanca, Melina, Nadia, Enriqueta y ven a ocupar sus prestamos para invertir en sus actividades económicas como papelería, venta de cosméticos por catalogo, venta de ropa usada, tienda de ropa nueva, zapatos por catalogo, tienda de abarrotes etc.
texts.en:
Judith is a very entrepreneurial and hard-working woman.  She is originally from Distrito Federal but 15 years ago she moved to the town of Zitacuaro, in Michoacán, because her husband was offered a better job in that town.  Judith is married to Ernesto who is a chef.  They have two children: a young boy of 17 who is in high school and an 8 year-old girl who is in elementary school.

Judith's business is catering for events such as 15th birthday celebrations, christenings, society debuts, weddings, birthdays etc.  She also bakes pastries to sell to her customers.  She prepares turkey legs, fillet steaks, turkeys, salads, soups, pastas and desserts.  She tells us that it was her husband who taught her how to do all this since he had lost his job and they decided to set up this business between the two of them.

Judith tells us that every three days she makes empanadas, jellies, biscuits and pies, and people also make orders with her.  She is requesting a loan so that she can buy the raw materials she needs to make the food and desserts that she sells.  She says that she stocks up with products in the different stores in her town.  She also says that, unfortunately, she has not been able to grow her business so quickly because her rent is very expensive and there is a lot of competition in her town.

Judith's goal is to own her own premises where she can set up a stable business and thereby have more customers.  The other members of her group are called Araceli, Manuel, Decire, Minerva, Fabiola, Blanca, Melina, Nadia and Enriqueta.  They will invest their loans in their respective business activities which include a stationery store, selling cosmetics through a catalog, selling used clothes, a [new] clothes store, selling shoes through a catalog and running a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her catering business

loans.name: Virgen De Juquila Group

texts.es:
La señora Petra Constantina es integrante del grupo Virgen de Juquila, se encuentra en Cohuecan, Puebla, México, las integrantes del grupo son las señoras Ernestina, Petra Constantina, Maura y Manuelas van a comprar con su préstamo barro y leña para elaborar sus jarros, ollas, platos, cazuelas y pedestales, la señorita Luisa va a comprar barro, leña y pinturas para elaborar ollas, cazuelas y platos, la señora Diana va a comprar medicamentos analgésicos, antibióticos, gasas, etc. La señora Gabina va a comprar barro y tierra blanca para elaborar platos y tazas, el señor Guillermo va a comprar llantas y mantenimiento para su taxi para dar un mejor servicio.
La señora Petra Constantina tiene 65 años de edad ella es casada tiene 2 hijos Maura de 38 años de edad y Sebastián de 16 años de edad ya trabaja, ella se dedica a la alfarería, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar barro para elaborar ollas y jarros los vende a sus clientes crudos, ella inicio su negocio cuando se caso con lo que le daba su esposo fue ahorrando para  comprar el barro y fue con una vecina para que le enseñara a trabajar el barro, actualmente su hija le ayuda a elaborar las ollas y los jarros, su negocio es importante porque tiene trabajo y tiene dinero para la familia, ella está orgullosa de elaborar los jarros y las ollas y le gusta cuando las vende y tiene dinero, ella se siete contenta y feliz con este préstamo que va a recibir porque va poder comprar su material y tener en existencia para ir trabajando y otra parte la va a ahorrar, sus sueños y esperanzas son tener salud junto con la familia para vivir contentos. San Bartolo Cohuecan es un pueblo bonito siembran de temporal sorgo y maíz, celebran el 24 de agosto al patrono del pueblo San Bartolo hay muchos visitantes, hay feria, misas, comida para los visitante. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por sus préstamos porque nos ayudan mucho en los negocios y que nos bajen el interés”
texts.en:
Petra Constantina is a member of the Virgen de Juquila group, which is in Cohuecan, Puebla, Mexico.  Ernestina, Petra Constantina, Maura and Manuelas are members of the group.  With their loan they are going to buy clay and firewood to make their jars, pots, pans, and stands.

Luisa will buy clay, firewood, and paints to make pots, pans, and plates.

Diana will buy analgesic medications, antibiotics, and gauze, etc.

Gabina will buy clay and white sandy soil to make plates and cups.

Guillermo will buy tires and pay for maintenance on his taxi in order to offer better service.

Petra Constantina, age 65, is married and has two children.  Maura is 38 years old, and Sebastian is 16 years old and works.  She devotes herself to making pottery.  She requested her loan in order to buy clay to make pots and jars.  She sells them to her customers unglazed.  

She started her business when she got married.  She was saving the money her husband gave her in order to buy clay.  She went to a neighbor to learn to work the clay.  Currently he daughter helps her make the pots and jars.  Her business is important because she has work and money for her family.  She is proud of making the jars and pots.  She likes it when she sells them and has money.  She is content and happy with the loan that she will receive because she will be able to buy her material and have it in stock in order to keep working.  She will save the other part of the loan.

Her hopes and dreams are to have good health together with her family in order to live happily.

San Bartolo Cohuecan is a pretty town where seasonal sorghum and corn is grown.  The 24th of August they celebrate the patron saint of the town of San Bartolo.  There are a lot of visitors, a fair, masses, and food for the visitors.  

The members of the group want to tell Kiva and the Fundación Realidad, “Thanks for the loans because they help us a lot in our businesses and that they lower our interest”.

loans.use: to buy clay to make jars and pots.

loans.name: Americanistas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Americanistas se llama  así porque la mayoría de los integrantes son aficionados al equipo de fútbol America, este grupo esta integrado por 9 personas que de dedican al trabajo diario para el sustento de su familia Lourdes (Venta de ropa), Hortencia (Elaboración de bolsas bordadas), Hilaria y Guillermo (Venta de abarrotes), Sofía (Venta de catalogo), Reyna y Juana (Venta de calzado), Adela (Venta de Herbalife), Juan (Taller de serigrafía).
Hilaria es una de las integrantes de este grupo, esta casada con el señor Navor, tiene una pequeña hija. Ella solicito el préstamo porque quiere iniciar un negocio de venta de aborreces en su casa ya que por donde vive no existe ningún otro negocio de abarrotes y pensó que es una buena opción para pueda tener un nuevo ingreso para la aportación en su familia, con el crédito comprara: jabón, aceite, papel higiénico, detergente, azúcar, entre otros productos. 
Hilaria decidió iniciar este negocio porque con lo que su esposo gana no le alcanza para los gastos y como su pequeña hija necesita de muchas cosas a veces no tiene para comprárselas y espera que con este pequeño negocio obtenga ganancias para así poder comprarle todo lo que su hija necesita.
Hilaria comenta que antes de que se casara ella se dedicaba a la elaboración de pan pero cuando conoció a su esposo dejo de hacerlo.
Su meta es hacer su propia casa ya que donde vive es de su suegra, y lo piensa lograr con esfuerzo y dedicación
Esta muy contenta por el crédito otorgado y agradece por este gran apoyo.
texts.en:
This group is called the Americanistas because most of the members are fans of the soccer team, America.   The group is made up of 9 people who work every day to support their families.  Lourdes (clothing sales), Hortencia (makes embroidered bags), Hilaria and Guillermo (grocery sales), Sofia (catalog sales), Reyna and Juana (shoes sales), Adela (Herbalife sales), and Juan (a silkscreen shop).

Hilaria is one of the members of this group.  She is married to Navor and she has a little daughter.  She is requesting the loan because she wants to start a business of selling groceries in her home since there is no other where she lives,  She thought it would be a good option so she could have another source of income for her family.  She will use the loan to buy: soap, oil, toilet paper, detergent, sugar and more.
Hilaria decided to begin this business because her husband doesn’t earn enough to cover the expenses and because her little daughter needs many things and she isn’t able to buy all of them.
Hilaria says that before she was married, she made bread but she stopped once she met her husband.
Her goal is to have her own house since now she lives with her mother-in-law and she plans to succeed with effort and dedication.
She is very happy with the loan offered and she appreciates the support.

loans.use: To buy grocieries such as detergent, toilet paper, sugar, oil, etc

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: Maria Antonia tiene su negocio de venta de tortillas. Hace más de 35 años que tiene este negocio, ella es una persona muy emprendedora y disfruta de su negocio. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de maíz, bolsas, comal y cal. Inicio este negocio gracias a su esposo y que le ha brindado mucho ayuda. Maria siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles a sus clientes buena calidad en sus productos y un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en: María Antonia’s business is selling tortillas.  She’s been in business for over 35 years.  She is a very enterprising person who enjoys her business.  The reason for the loan is to buy corn, bags, a griddle and lime powder.  She started the business thanks to her husband who has provided much support to her.  María has always stood out for providing her customers with good quality products and good service.

loans.use: to buy corn, bags, a griddle and lime powder.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seafood (shrimp, lobster, fish).

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.en: Manuel Antonio is a single father of four who has a small business selling firewood.  After learning the business from his brothers, he has operated on his own for the last twenty years. He has established a strong client base and has been able to support his family.  Manuel Antonio plans to use the loan to purchase more inventory and grow his business.  His dream is to purchase a new vehicle, which would be helpful not only personally, but also for business reasons.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood to sell and grow his business

loans.name: Señor De Wimpillay Chocco Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama “Señor De Wimpillay Chocco” y se reúnen  cada treinta días en la ciudad del Cusco en el distrito de Santiago en el populoso barrio de Winpillay  (Cusco, Perú).  El banco comunal se distingue por estar conformado por gente trabajadora,  profesionales, artesanos y comerciantes. El grupo está conformado por doce integrantes y son varias vez que solicitan un préstamo de la Asociación Arariwa y invertirán el dinero para mejorar sus negocios. 

En esta reunión conocimos a la señora Isabel y nos cuenta que vive en el barrio de Winpillay de la ciudad del Cusco junto con su pareja y sus tres hijos. Desde joven se caracterizo por ser una persona responsable y amable y por ese motivo sus vecinas le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal. Isabel tiene una pequeña tienda de comestibles en su domicilio donde vende sus productos a costos accesibles para sus clientes. Ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería así poder abastecer su tienda y surtir de diferentes productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo leche en tarros. Ella tiene 43 años, es una persona con muchas ganas de superarse y tener un negocio exitoso día con día, siempre con el deseo de brindarles lo mejor a su familia. El sueño de la socia es ver profesionales a sus hijos.
texts.en:
This group is called “Señor De Wimpillay Chocco” and it meets every thirty days in Cusco’s Santiago district, in a crowded neighborhood called Wimpillay (Cusco, Perú).  The communal bank stands out for being composed of hard working people, professionals, artisans and merchants.  The group has 12 members and they have asked for several loans from Asociación Arariwa.  They will use the money to improve their businesses.

We met Isabel at the meeting.  She told us that she lives in Cusco’s Wimpillay neighborhood with her spouse and three children.  Since a very young age she distinguished herself by being a very responsible and kind person and because of this her neighbors invited her to participate in the communal bank.

Isabel has a small grocery store at home where she sells items at accessible prices to her customers.  On this occasion, she needs the loan to buy more merchandise to stock her store and have different basic need items on hand, for example, jars of milk.

She is 43 years old and is a person with a strong desire for self improvement and to have a business that succeeds every day always with the intention of providing the best for her family.  Her dream is to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise, like jugs of milk, for example.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicken, meat, rice, vegetables, oil and condiments

loans.name: Blanca Yadira

texts.es: La Señora Blanca Yadira tiene 40 años. Blanca es casada. Tienen 1 hijo a su cargo. La actividad económica es venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que inicio con productos pequeños ropa para niños, sabanas y otros productos, por lo que decide incursionar comprando más mercadería como es a ropa de adultos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa, calzado, sabanas, cosméticos y ropa en general. El sueño de Blanca es diversificar en sus productos y ofrecer un sin número de productos.
texts.en:
Blanca Yadira is 40 years old.  She’s married and has one child in her care.  She sells general merchandise.  She’s been in this business for over ten years.  She started out with small items, children’s clothes, sheets and other things and later decided to start buying other merchandise like clothes for adults.  

The loan she’s asking for is to use as working capital to buy clothes, footwear, sheets, cosmetics and clothes in general.  Blanca’s dream is to diversify her products and offer countless products.

loans.use: to buy clothes, footwear, sheets, cosmetics and clothes in general.

loans.name: Sonia Lilliam

texts.en: Sonia Liliam is a 71-year-old woman who has operated a door-to-door food vending business for the last nine years.   Her merchandise includes basic grains, milk, meat, and other food products. Sonia Liliam started her business with her own funds and assistance from her son.  She is very proud of the fact that through her hard work over the years, she has been able to buy her own house. The loan will be used to buy more merchandise that Sonia Liliam will then be able to sell.  Her dream is for her grandchildren to have a future full of opportunities.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Gloria Argentina

texts.es: La Señora Gloria Argentina tiene 36 años. Ella es una mujer muy alegre, a pesar de las dificultades que ha atravesado siempre ha mantenido su espíritu de entusiasmo  y esto es lo le ha ayudado con su actividad económica  es su brindar el servicio de costura. Hace más de 10 años que tiene de dedicarse a este negocio. A Gloria siempre le ha gustado su actividad económica ya que le gusta interactuar con la gente. Por lo que es una persona que le gusta el progreso. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento con el fin de invertir en la compra de zipper, hilos, agujas, tijeras y telas.
texts.en: Gloria Argentina is 36 years old.  She’s a very cheerful woman despite the difficulties she’s gone through.  She’s always kept an enthusiastic spirit and this has helped her in her economic activity which is providing sewing services.  She’s been in this occupation for over 10 years.  Gloria has always enjoyed her work because she likes interacting with people.  She’s a person who likes to make progress.  Because of that she’s asking for this loan to buy zippers, thread, needles, scissors and fabric.

loans.use: to buy zippers, thread, needles, scissors and fabric.

loans.name: Jose Vitelio

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y tienen un hijo de dos años, él se dedica a la agricultura, lo inicio cuando era joven y ayudaba a su padre, aprendió el proceso y hoy en día es el trabajo que le ayuda para darle a su familia la alimentación, los cultivos los realiza en terreno alquilado, no tiene un horario fijo.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas, preparara la tierra, e iniciar la siembra, comprara abono y fertilizantes, esta compra le permitirá trabajar adecuadamente y realizar el cultivo con la esperanza de obtener una buena cosecha.
Los sueños de José son crecer y obtener una buena cosecha, para poder comercializar una parte y otra para el consumo de la familia.
texts.en:
José is a farmer who lives with his wife and 2 year-old son.  He started farming when he was young and used to help his father.  He learned the process and now this is the work that helps him to feed his family.  He grows his crops on rented land and doesn't work fixed hours.

José is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies, prepare his land and start sowing his crops.  He will buy manure and fertilizers.  This purchase will allow him to work properly and grow his crops in the hope of obtaining a good harvest.

José's dreams are to grow and obtain a good harvest.  He will sell some of his crops and the rest will be eaten by his family.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Rommel David

texts.en:
Roomel David is married with two children, ages 7 and 14.  For the last ten years he has owned and operated a jewelry making business. After working for another jeweler years ago, Roomel David saved his earnings and bought a spot for his own shop in the central market where he can create and sell his jewelry.   The loan proceeds will be used to buy additional materials to make more products to sell.  

Roomel David’s dream is to construct a house on a piece of land he already owns and to provide a bright future for his children.

loans.use: to buy additional materials to make more products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Dolores Yolanda

texts.en: Dolores is a 65-year-old grandmother who helps support her daughter and two grandchildren who live with her. She has been very successful selling cosmetics door-to-door and plans to use the loan proceeds to buy more merchandise to maintain and ultimately grow her business. Her dream is that her grandchildren will have all the opportunities they would want as they grow up.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.en: Rosa Argentina is a married mother of one child who owns a small business offering perfumes, cosmetics, and clothes among other items.  She started this business with her own capital six years ago when she saw an opportunity in the market for such goods.  With the funds from this loan, Rosa Argentina plans to buy more merchandise to grow her business.

loans.use: buy more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Carmen Isolda

texts.en: Carmen Isolda is 24 years old.  She has a business selling a variety of clothes.  Through her hard work, her door-to-door selling has been very successful.  She has recently secured a spot in the new market and will use the funds from this loan to open her shop there.    Her goal is to continue to grow her business and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: open a new shop at the market

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es: La Señora Irma tiene 35 años D. edad, socia D. la alcancia comunal mujeres emprendedoras, es casada con 3 hijos en la etapa escolar, actualmente tiene una tienda D. productos D. abarrotes y otros, la socia realiza las compras a tempranas horas D. la mañana para dedicarse durante el día a la atención D. su bodega. El Préstamo solicito es para la compra D. una vitrina y exhibición D. los chocolates, galletas, caramelos, bebidas etc. La socia esta ubicada al centro D. las socias esta vestido con chompa color rosada. El Préstamo Solicito D. s/.1,000.00 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Irma, 35, is a member of the “Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Enterprising Women) communal bank.  She is married and has three, school age children.  She has a store where she sells groceries and other items.  She does her purchases early in the morning so that she can tend to her store the rest of the day.

She requested the loan to buy a display case to display her chocolates, cookies, candy, beverages, etc.

In the photo, she’s in the center of the members wearing a pink sweater.  The loan she asked for is for 1000 new soles.

loans.use: to buy a display case.

loans.name: Diosa

texts.en:
Diosa is 45 years old, and is a married woman with eight children. Her husband is a farmer.

Diosa buys bananas, cassava and sweet potatoes from farmers and then sells the products at her town's local market. Diosa has been in this business for two years. She earns about 2,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month from it. She has applied for a loan and plans to use it to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell, such as banana and cassava.

Diosa hopes for her business to prosper. She also hopes to send all her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell, such as bananas and cassava

loans.name: Lorina

texts.en:
Lorina is 25 years old and married. She has two children, aged 3 and 2. 

Lorina is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. She primarily grows rice to sell. Lorina has requested a loan and plans to use it to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes for this loan to help improve her harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Rojica

texts.en:
Rojica is a married woman with four children. The oldest child is only 6 years old. Rojica is engaged in farming and hog-raising businesses. She grows rice, and her harvest is for selling and family consumption. Rojica also raises pigs in her backyard. She fattens the pigs to sell at the market. 

Rojica's loan will be used to buy piglets, feeds and fertilizers. She will also pay rent for the tractor she used in tilling her land.

In the future, Rojica hopes to have a prosperous business. She also hopes to see all her children succeed.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feeds and fertilizers and to pay rent for the tractor

loans.name: Timotea

texts.en:
Forty-eight-year-old Timotea earns a living through buying and selling fruits and vegetables. She has been in this business for four years. Timotea buys and sells bananas, cassava and taro. She earns about 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month from this business.

Timotea's loan will be used to buy more vegetables, such as sweet potatoes, bananas and more. She hopes for this loan to help improve her earnings. She also hopes to earn better and send her four children to school.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables, such as sweet potatoes, bananas and more.

loans.name: San Judas Group

texts.es:
La señora Consuelo, vive en Tecpatan Chiapas, un lugar muy bonito por el rio que atraviesa la localidad. Ella es casada y a su responsabilidad tiene dos hijos, Pedro  de diesi ocho años en sexto semestre de preparatoria y Emir de diez años en cuarto de primaria.
    Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de trastes por catalogo de la marca tupper ware y productos como son: labiales, maquillajes, perfumes, entre otros, de  la marca, jafra y blondi, en donde lleva cuatro años  y ocho meses, de lo que nos comenta que le va bien ya que con ello ha estado teniendo un buen .resultado de su  actividad.
   Inicio con este trabajo por  una compañera quien es la que representa un grupo de jafra y la invito a formar parte  de ello así tener un trabajo que le deje ganancias y sus ingresos sea más concreto para  así solventar sus gastos.
    Su más grande sueño es que  con esta actividad pueda tener más ingresos en su hogar así seguir apoyando a sus  hijos que están estudiando y logren tener una carrera.
     En ello  están integradas dos señora mas y son: la señora María, quien se dedica a la elaboración de comidas y solicito el préstamo para la compra de ingredientes, así también se integra  la señora  María flor de luz: ella invertirá en una nueva actividad que es el de compra y venta de refresco.
texts.en:
Sra. Consuelo lives in Tecpatan Chiapas, a beautiful place that has a river than runs through the town. She is married and responsible for two children. Pedro, age 16, is in his sixth semester of preparatory school. Emir is 10 years old and in the fourth grade.

Consuelo buys and sells utensils through Tupperware catalogs. She also sells lipsticks, makeup, perfumes, and other products manufactured by the Jafra and Blondi brands. Consuelo has been in business for four years and eight months. She says that she has done very well in her business and has achieved good results.

Consuelo started her business with a colleague who works as a representative for Jafra. She was invited to be part of her team, thereby giving her a job where she could earn income and establish a more concrete revenue stream to help cover her expenses. Her greatest wish is to generate more household income from her business. She hopes to continue supporting her children with their education so that they can obtain a degree.

The other two ladies in this group are as follows: • Sra. María prepares food and is requesting a loan to buy ingredients. • Sra. María Flor de Luz will invest in a new business of buying and selling soft drinks.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen utensils and beauty products of various brands.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 41-year-old mother who insisted on helping her retired husband support their family of eight persons. After her husband retired from the military, he start working as a farm keeper but instead of getting a salary they agreed with the farm owner to rent the farm so they could plant some trees and have some sheep to raise. On the farm, they now have olive trees and peach trees; depending on the season, Fatmeh also makes yogurt and butter from the sheep milk. They sell it all. Now Fatmeh has applied for a loan to buy a machine that can help increase her productivity and make cheese.

Since Fatmeh is a conservative person, her husband Hussien appears in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a machine to make yogurt and cheese.

loans.name: Caleb

texts.en:
Caleb is a farmer from the town of Kitale in western Kenya where he has been farming for 3 years. His mixed farm produces milk, maize, vegetables and bananas, which are all sold locally. He earns additional income from his bodaboda (bicycle) transport business. He is 28 years old, married and has 2 children, aged 5 months and 6 years. 

Caleb has requested a loan of 40,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase chickens and chicken feed. He believes that, by venturing into poultry farming, his income will increase and this will enable him to afford a quality life for his family. His main fear is the common poultry disease in the area, which results in huge losses when it strikes. However, he is optimistic that his poultry farm will expand in future and he will be able increase his production of eggs.

He comments that Juhudi does a good job for the farmers.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom has a mixed farm that produces milk, maize, beans and fruits, which are all sold locally. He has been in the farming business for three years now. He also owns a mini bakery and sells fish to the local market. He is aged 39, married and has 5 children between the ages of 2 and 9 years old. Four of the children are currently attending school.

Tom has requested a loan of 41,600KES in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He hopes that, with the dairy cow he will acquire, his family will be guaranteed enough milk for domestic consumption and for selling. The proceeds from this loan will help him provide his children with a good education.

His biggest challenge has been lack of enough animal feed, especially during the dry spell. He hopes that in the next 5 years, he will have acquired at least 5 dairy cows in order to boost his milk production. He comments that Juhudi should hold frequent seminars for clients like the one held in Kitale town in January 2011.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is aged 49 and married. He has two adult children. Benson has been practicing mixed farming for the last 14 years and employs one farmhand. His farm is currently producing milk, maize, vegetables and beans, which he sells to the local market. He also owns a motorbike that provides transport services to the local people. 

Benson has made a loan request of 62,400 KES through Juhudi Kilimo in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He hopes that, with the dairy cow he will acquire, his milk production will increase and this will increase his income as well. The extra proceeds from this loan will help him to improve his family's livelihood.

He faces the challenge of lack of enough dairy feed, which affects his production. He plans to improve his dairy farming in future by increasing the number of his dairy cows.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Misha

texts.en:
Misha is a 63-year-old farmer from the village of Boslebi, Dmanisi District. He is married and lives with his wife Naziko. Misha is machine-operator by profession and works in his and nearby villages. In addition to his main profession, Misha also runs a family agricultural farm.  The family has a plot of the land where potatoes, wheat, haricot and maize are grown. Harvested vegetables and corn are sold locally to the retailers. 

The requested loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and potato seeds. Misha will fertilize the plot and sow the potatoes. According to Misha’s estimations, after fertilizing he will get high quality vegetables and corn and will sell them for a good price. It will improve the income of the family. This increase will be used for renovation of the house and improvement of their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and potato seeds

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab is 45 years old and married. He lives in the village of Didi Dmanisi, Dmanisi District. Zurab lives with his wife Khatuna, 19- and 17-year old sons, 15-year-old daughter and parents. Khatuna is a housewife; all three children go to school. Zurab leads the family agricultural farm; he grows potatoes, maize and haricot on the family-owned plot of land. Zurab trades the vegetables. He sells his own vegetables and also some other cultures, purchased in neighbor villages. The total average income of the family is 900 Laris per month. 

With the requested credit, Zurab will purchase fertilizers and pay for the fuel for his tractor to till the land. Zurab hopes that after fertilizing the land, the harvested vegetables will be of a good quality and will be sold for a good price. 

The profit received from the farm will be used for the education of the children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and fuel for his tractor

loans.name: Anzor

texts.en:
Anzor is a farmer from the village of Bolojauri, South Georgia. He is 53 years old and lives with his family: his wife Nana, his 27- and 23-year old sons, 14-year-old daughter and daughter-in-law. 

All adult members of the family are involved in family agricultural activities. They have one milk cow, the dairy products of which are sold locally. In addition, the family owns 1.25 ha agricultural land where the following vegetables are grown: potato, cabbage, onion, garlic, and beet. Part of the harvested vegetables is sold locally to the retailers and the other part is sold on the open market in Akhaltsikhe (a nearby town). 

With the requested loan, Anzor will purchase seeds for potatoes. This year he will plant more potatoes in comparison with the last years. It is caused by the increased price of the potatoes on the local market. Anzor hopes that their vegetables will be sold for a good price and he'll get his planned income. Part of the profit will be reinvested in the family’s farming activities.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for potatoes

loans.name: Benkelema  2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres de BENKELEMA 2 sont  des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34  ans,  5 enfants et vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à Konona, un situé à environ 30 km de la ville de NIENA région de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ces clientes sont à leur troisième cycle de prêt  de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin en moyen de production et intrant agricole. Les prêts antérieur Sont été remboursés avec satisfaction. 
Ce groupe de femme fait la culture du maïs, du riz, d’arachide, de gombo, de pois de terre, etc.
MAYATOU compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 sacs d’urée 1 sac de complexe céréale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage.  Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20.000 à 25 000 FCFA qui sera utilisée  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the BENKELEMA 2 group are married women who have an average age of 34 years and 5 children and live in large traditional families in Konona, located approximately 30 km from the commune of Niena in the Sikasso region, 3rd administrative region of Mali.
These clients are on their third loan cycle campaign with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to meet the need for means of production and agricultural fertilizer.  The previous loans have been satisfactorily repaid.
This group of women grows corn, rice, peanuts, okra, ground peas etc.  MAYATOU plans to use her loan to buy two bags of urea, one bag of complex fertilizer and the remainder for labor and hoeing costs.  She expects to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 to 25,000 CFA which will be used for the family’s household expenses.

loans.use: To buy agricultural fertilizer and pay for labor costs

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 38 years old, married and has one child.

Ali has a shop selling used and new auto parts since 2007. He is experienced in this field, has a good reputation and is well known in his area.

 He is requesting a $2,400 loan to pay the annual rent for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent for his shop.

loans.name: Saltanat's Group

texts.en:
Saltanat is a young leader of this group. She is 24 and married to a barman. Together they bring up a newly born child. 

Two years ago, Saltanat’s husband received a livestock inheritance from his parents. In order to contribute additional money to the family budget, Saltanat breeds and resells livestock at the higher price. She started livestock breeding two years ago and during this period her business was successful. She earns 1500 soms per month. Saltanat decided to apply for the loan because she needs additional funds in order to increase her number of livestock. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase an additional four animals for breeding. In the future, this young woman wishes to purchase a house in Bishkek (capital of Kyrgyzstan).

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase four livestock animals.

loans.name: Grigol

texts.en:
Grigol is a 37-year-old farmer from the village of Tchvinta, in the southern part of Georgia. He is married and lives with his wife Shorena, 13-year-old daughter, 2-year-old son and mother (retired).  Grigol and Shorena lead the dairy farm of the family. They have three milk cows. They sell the dairy products from the cows on the local market. The total income of the family is 600 Laris per month, including the pension of Grigol’s mother. 

With the requested loan, Grigol will purchase an additional milk cow. They will get more milk and increase the sales of the dairy products. An increase in income will allow the family to purchase more household goods in order to improve the family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Nabil

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, married and has one child.

Nabil has had a shop selling all kinds of chicken since 2010. He has a good reputation and is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan to buy a chicken grilling machine and a chicken cleaning machine. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality life.

loans.use: To buy a chicken grilling machine and a chicken cleaning machine.

loans.name: Benkelema  3 Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres de BENKELEMA  3  sont des femmes mariées. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 33  ans, et ont en moyenne  5 enfants. EIles vivent avec leurs maries, coépouses et leurs enfants à Konona, un village situé à environ 30 km de la ville de NIENA région de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ces clientes sont à leur troisième cycle de prêt  de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin en moyen de production et intrant agricole. Les prêts antérieurs ont été remboursés avec satisfaction. 
Ce groupe de femme fait la culture du maïs, du riz, d’arachide, de gombo etc. 
MARIAM compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 3 sacs d’urée 2 sacs de complexe céréale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage.  Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 45.000 à 50 000 FCFA qui sera utilisée  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en: The 10 members of Benkelema 3 are married women. They are on average 33 years old and have on average 5 children. They live with their husbands, cospouses and children in Konona, a village located about 30 km from the city of Niena in the Sikasso region, the 3rd administrative region of Mali. These clients are on their third loan with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy their needs in terms of production and agriculture ingredients. The previous loans were satisfactorily repaid. This group of women grows corn, rice, peanuts, okra, etc. Mariam plans to use her loan to buy 3 bags of urea and 2 bags of complex grains and the rest on labor and hoeing. She envisions making on average 45,000 – 50,000 FCFA, which will be used towards her family’s daily needs.

loans.use: to buy agricultural ingredients and labor

loans.name: Karar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 23 years old, married and has two children. He lives with five family members; two of them work.

Karar has had a farm for cattle and calves since 2009. He worked in this field since he was child so he has a lot of experience. He has a good reputation and is well known in his area. 

He is requesting a $3,000 loan to build a cow barn. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To build a cow barn.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene comes from the village of Minadze, Akhaltsikhe District. She lives with her two sons (15 and 20 years old) and mother-in-law (74 years old). Irene works as a cook in the local military office. Her salary is 155 Laris per month. Her younger son goes to school and the elder one serves in the army as a contractor. Along with her regular job, Irene also leads the agricultural business of the family: She cultivates 0.5 ha of the family-owned land and grows potatoes and other vegetables. Harvested products are sold locally. In addition, the family owns three milk cows and two calves. Irene produces traditional Georgian cheese from the gathered milk and sells it in the village. 

With the requested loan, Irene will purchase calves to raise and sell in the fall for a higher price. The increase in profits will be used for equipping their house with new household goods, in order to make it comfortable.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Altynai's Group

texts.en:
Altynai, 34, is a leader of this group. Together with her husband she brings up a daughter and a son, both children are preschool age (under seven). 

A year ago, with the initial investment of 3000 soms, the family started cultivating strawberries. They are engaged in the wholesale trade of strawberries.  The monthly income from this kind of business is 12000 soms. Altynai applied for the loan because she needs additional money to repair an apartment. She hopes that the loan will help her improve the family’s living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to repair an apartment.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 24 years old and married.

In 2000 Hasan opened a grocery store where he sells all kind of fruits, vegetables and juices. He has a good reputation and he is becoming well known in his area. 

He is requesting  a $1700 loan to pay the annual rent for his store. He is aiming to earn more profit so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent for his store.

loans.name: Benkelema  4 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres de BENKELEMA  4 sont  des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34  ans,  5 enfants et vivant dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Konona, un situé à environ 30 km de la ville de NIENA région de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ces clientes sont à leur troisième cycle de prêt  de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin en moyen de production et intrant agricole. Les prêts antérieurs ont été remboursés avec satisfaction. 
Ce groupe de femme fait la culture du maïs, du riz, d’arachide, de dah, de pois sucré, de gombo etc.
ROKIA, la présidente du groupe compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 1 sac d’urée et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage.  Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 10 000 FCFA qui sera utilisée  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The 10  members of the Benkelema 4 group are married women averaging 34 years of age, with five children, living in traditional extended families in Konona, a settlement about 30 km from the town of Niena, the Region of Sikasso (the third administrative region of Mali).

These customers are on their third agricultural loan cycle with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, with the goal of having the necessary tools and agricultural inputs. The previous loans have been repaid in satisfactory manner.

This group of women grows corn, rice, peanuts (ground nuts), bissap, sweet peas, okra etc. Rokia, the group’s leader plans to use her loan to  pay for one bag of urea [fertilizer] and other necessities, such as the costs of manual labor and weeding. [S]he envisages achieving an average monthly income of 10,000 West African Francs, which will be used for everyday family expenses.

loans.use: to pay for agricultural inputs and manual labor

loans.name: Moussa

texts.en:
Moussa is 41 years old and he is married. He sells shoes. His business is well-organized and he has two years of experience. He currently employs one person to help him. His business operates from 6 am to 7 pm every day. 

Moussa has requested a loan from kiva lender in order to purchase more women's shoes to sell. With this profit, he will reinvest in his business and save money for his future.

loans.use: to purchase more women's shoes to sell.

loans.name: Seiran

texts.en:
Seiran comes from the village of Tsira, in the southern part of the country. Seiran is 52 years old and married. He lives with his family – his wife Manushak, two adult sons (25 and 30 years old), his daughter-in-law and two grandchildren (five and one year old). 

Seiran is a taxi driver and earns approximately 450 Laris per month. Along with this job, Seiran also gets income from agricultural activities. In particular, he has a business raising calves. Also, with the assistance of his younger son, he cultivates family-owned 1-ha land and grows potatoes, maize and haricot beans, which are sold on Akhaltsikhe open market. 

With the requested credit, Seiran will purchase calves, which will be raised on the farm. In fall they will be sold locally for a higher price. 

Profit received from this business activity will be used for expansion of the family business.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 41 years old. She is married and has seven children between the ages of 10 and 15 years old. She owns a small business selling milk, water and eggs. This business is well known and organized. She has one year of experience and she employees two people to help her.

Rose has requested her first loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to expand her business by purchasing more milk, water and eggs to sell. Rose will be able to earn more profit. With this extra profit, she plans to build her own house and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more milk, water and eggs.

loans.name: Benkelema  5 Group

texts.fr:
Les 7 membres du groupe BENKELEMA  5  sont  des femmes mariées  qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 33  ans, et ont en moyenne  5 enfants. EIles vivent dans des familles polygames à Konona, un situé à environ 30 km de la ville de NIENA région de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ces clientes sont à leur troisième cycle de prêt  de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin en moyen de production et intrant agricole. Les prêts antérieurs ont été remboursés avec satisfaction.
Ce groupe de femme fait la culture du maïs, du riz, d’arachide, de gombo etc.
MARIAM F compte acheter,  3 sacs d’urée, 2 sacs de complexe céréale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage.  Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 45.000 à 50 000 FCFA qui sera utilisée  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille
texts.en: The 7 members of the BENKELEMA 5 group are married women who are on average 33 years old with 5 children.  They live in polygamous families in Konona, located approximately 30 km from the  Niena commune in the Sikasso region, 3rd administrative region of Mali.  These clients are on their third campaign loan cycle with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to meet the need for means of production and agricultural fertilizer.  The previous loans have been satisfactorily repaid. This group of women grows corn, rice, peanuts, okra, etc. MARIAM plans to buy 3 bags of urea, 2 bags of complex fertilizer and use the remainder of the loan for labor and weeding costs.
