Her goals are to have a strong clothing and footwear business, to keep her customers happy thus improving her family’s economic condition.

loans.use: to buy blouses, formal shirts and shoes and football cleats.

loans.name: Walter Ivan

texts.es:
Walter Ivan tiene 30 años de edad, vive en union libre vive con la compañera y con los 4 hijos de 9, 5, 4 y 3 años, viven en Parroquia San Pablo perteneciente al Cantón San Miguel.

Los miembros de la V.R.C UNION Y ESPERANZA  se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia San Pablo a 30 minutos de la oficina en San Miguel los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembra de maíz, papas y al comercio ventas de legumbres y otros.

Walter se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y choclo, este trabajo lo viene desarrollando desde hace mucho tiempo, las compras las realiza en San Miguel y Vende sus productos en San Pablo y San Miguel en las ferias.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas de maíz y choclo, el crédito el ayudado a aumentar los ingresos y la producción, ha enfrentado desafíos como la falta de trabajadores y el variación del clima que en ocasiones a dañado los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar terreno.

Le gusta hacer deporte como el indor y festejar las fiestas .
texts.en:
Walter Ivan, 30, lives with his partner and their four children who are 9-, 5-, 4- and 3-years old, respectively.  They live in San Pablo parrish in the Ecuadorean canton of San Miguel.

The members of the UNION Y ESPERANZA community bank meet in San Pablo, some 30 minutes from our office in San Miguel.  The members of the bank are famers.  They grow maize, potatoes and vegetables, among other crops.

Walter grows maize and corn.  He's built his farm over many years.  He buys supplies in San Miguel and sells his products in the markets in San Pablo and San Miguel.

Walter is applying for a loan to buy seeds for his next maize and corn crop.  The loan will help him increase his production and, in turn, his income. The challenges he faces include a shortage of workers and vagaries in the weather that damage his crops.  His dream is to buy land.

Walter likes to watch sports and go to local festivals.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Fanny Yaneth

texts.es:
Fanny, vive con su esposo, una hija y sus suegros, su hija tiene dos años de edad, tiene un negocio donde vende pupusas y refrescos, este surgió por el apoyo de su esposo y su suegra, trabaja por las tardes, en las mañanas le ayuda a la suegra en el negocio de venta de tortillas y por el momento necesita un crédito para fortalecer el negocio de las pupusas.
Su inversión será en bebidas, refrescos, maíz, chicharrón, quesillo y condimentos, esta compra le permitirá contar con todos los materiales necesarios para la preparación de su venta, y continuar así ofreciendo un buen servicio a los clientes.
El sueño de ella es ser una microempresaria con un negocio rentable, de esta manera generar ingresos que cubran las necesidades de su familia y les permita tener una vida digna.
texts.en:
Fanny lives with her husband, a daughter and her in-laws.  Her daughter is two years old.  She has a business selling “pupusas” (typical Salvadoran fast food) and beverages.  The business started with help from her husband and mother-in-law.  She works afternoons.  In the morning she helps her mother-in-law in her business selling tortillas.  She needs a loan to strengthen the pupusa business.

Her investment will be for beverages, soft drinks, corn, fried pork skin, cheese and condiments.  This purchase will help her have on hand all the necessary ingredients to prepare her items for sale and to continue offering good service to her customers.

Her dream is to become a micro businesswoman with a profitable business to generate income that will cover her family’s needs and allow them to have a dignified life.

loans.use: to buy beverages, soft drinks, corn, fried pork skin, cheese and condiments.

loans.name: Ramona Maria

texts.es:
Ramona Maria tiene 43 años de edad, es casada vive con la esposa e hijos, viven en Parroquia San Pablo perteneciente al Cantón San Miguel.

Los miembros de la V.R.C UNION Y ESPERANZA  se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia San Pablo a 30 minutos de la oficina en San Miguel los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembra de maíz, papas y al comercio ventas de legumbres y otros.

Ramona se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de frejol, morocho un poco de papas y trigo, este trabajo lo viene desarrollando desde hace mucho tiempo, las compras las realiza en San Miguel y Vende sus productos en San Pablo y San Miguel en las ferias.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas de frejol, morocho un poco de papas y trigo, el crédito el ayudado a aumentar los ingresos y la producción, ha enfrentado desafíos como la falta de trabajadores y el variación del clima que en ocasiones a dañado los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar mas terrenso para seguir sembrando y cultivar otros productos.

Lo que le gusta es festejar las fiestas del carnaval y trabajar para tener dinero.
texts.en:
Ramona María is 43 years old, married and living with her husband and children.  They live in San Pablo Parish belonging to San Miguel Canton.

The “Unión y Esperanza” (Unity & Hope) communal bank is located in San Pablo Parish 30 minutes from the San Miguel office.  The members of this communal bank are corn and potato farmers and sell vegetables and others.

Ramona farms corn and beans, a bit of potatoes and wheat.  She’s been in this occupation for a long time.  She makes her purchases in San Miguel and her sales take place in farmers markets in San Pablo and San Miguel.

She is asking for a loan to buy bean seeds, corn, some potatoes and wheat.  The loan has helped her increase income and production.  She has faced challenges like the scarcity of laborers and variations in the weather that occasionally have damaged crops.  Her dream is to buy more land to continue working and plant other crops.

She enjoys celebrating Carnival and working to earn money.

loans.use: to buy bean seeds, corn, some potatoes and wheat.

loans.name: Agip Women's Group

texts.en:
Margaret is 36 years old and happily married with four kids. She is a trained nurse and for the past nine years has been operating a medical clinic in Mukono. Her nursing training is very important in her business. With determination, hard work and prayers, Margaret has made substantial progress.  She earns a monthly profit of approximately 30,000 UGX.

Margaret will use her portion of this group loan to purchase drugs and medical equipment to use in her clinic.

loans.use: to purchase drugs and medical equipment to use in her clinic

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es: María del Carmen, D. 69 años D. edad, vive con su compañero D. vida y sus dos hijos los cuales reciben educación en una escuela cercana a la localidad donD. residen. Ella posee una tienda con la que logran mantener su hogar, se levanta desD. muy temprano a vender en su tienda pues piensa que el trabajo, esfuerzo y dedicación son las mejores armas  para salir adelante y  poder ser feliz junto a su familia. María se ha hecho D. mucha clientela pues en su tienda las personas siempre encuentran lo que necesitan a un precio accesible; además el lugar es muy higiénico y reciben la atención que se merecen,  sus ganas D. sobresalir la han motivado a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita abastecer  su tienda con bebidas, sopas instantáneas, golosinas, pan, granos básicos entre otros. D. esta manera podrá mantener y sacar adelante su negocio y podrá darle a su familia una vida más digna con seguridad económica.
texts.en:
María del Carmen, 69, lives with her life’s companion and two children who are going to school near home.  She has a store that she supports her family with.  She rises very early to sell in her store because she feels that work, effort and dedication are the best weapons to get ahead and to be able to be happy together with her family.  María has a large number of customers because they find what they need in her store at a reasonable price.  Besides, the place is very hygienic and they receive the attention they deserve.  

Her wish to stand out has motivated her to ask INTEGRAL for a loan that will make it possible for her to stock the store with beverages, instant soups, snacks, bread and basic grains, among others.  This way she will be able to maintain and succeed with her business and proviD. her family with a more dignified, financially secure life.

loans.use: to buy beverages, instant soup, snacks, bread and basic grains.

loans.name: Jose Hernaides

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la venta y reparación de celulares y sus accesorios, vive con su esposa y tienen un hijo de 4 años de edad, José inicio trabajando con un amigo, luego se independizo y puso su propio negocio desde hace 6 años.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería, protectores, carcasas, baterías, cargadores y todo tipo de accesorios, este préstamo será una gran ayuda para el negocio y poder brindar un mejor servicio.
Su objetivo es crecer en su negocio, crear estabilidad y un mejor servicio a los clientes, también mejorar las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
José sells and repairs cell phones and their accessories.  He lives with his wife and they have a 4-year-old son.  José started working with a friend but he later became independent and opened his own business six years ago.

He is currently asking for a loan to buy merchandise: protectors, cases, batteries, chargers and all sorts of accessories.  This loan will be a great help for his business and to be able to offer better service.

His goal is to grow in business, to create stability and better customer service as well as to improve his family’s condition.

loans.use: to buy cell phone accessories.

loans.name: Brisimi

texts.es:
Brisimi es un padre de familia de 36 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia en el distrito de Reque, que se encuentra a una distancia corta de la provincia de Chiclayo.   Es un  distrito que se caracteriza por que sus pobladores se dedican a la  actividad agricola y ganadera.

Brisimi se dedica desde hace 5 años a las labores agricolas, en sus chacaras o tierras cultiva donde quiere empezar a sembrar frejol que es un alimento sano y rico para el consumo diario de los pobladores.  El cual lo comercializará una vez que coseche en los diferentes mercados de la zona.

Ha solicitado un préstamo  de 800 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para la compra de fertilizantes  para mejorar sus tierras y tenga una mejor cosecha de frejol, una vez que realice su cosecha podrápagar su crédito y tendrá algunas mejoras para su hogar.  Brisimi es conocido por ser una persona trabajadora, responsable y como todo padre desea que su familia se supere.
texts.en:
Brisimi is a 36 year old father who lives with his wife and children in his own home, in Reque district, a short distance from Chiclayo province.  This is a district which is noted for the fact that its residents work in farming and livestock raising.

Brisimi has been farming for five years.  He works on his land where he would like to start sowing beans which are a good, healthy food that is eaten daily by local people.  When he harvests his beans he sells them in the different markets in his area.

Brisimi has requested a loan for 800 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy fertilizers so that he can improve his land and obtain a better harvest of beans.  Once he harvests his crops, he will be able to repay his loan and have some improvements for his household.  Brisimi is known as a hard-working, responsible person and, in common with all fathers, he would like his family to do well.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to improve his farm land and his crops

loans.name: Jose Del Carmen

texts.es:
Don José, de 34 años de edad, nacido en el departamento de Estelí, el es guarda de seguridad, al mismo tiempo es dueño de una pulpería que la tiene establecida  en su hogar tiene 7 años de trabajar como  comerciante sin  dejar de lado su trabajo como guarda de seguridad.
Don José cuenta que se sintió satisfecho con el logro alcanzado ya que con el primer préstamo lo ayudo a construir parte de su vivienda, darle mejores condiciones a su pulpería, compro más productos para su pulpería, pago mano de obra por la construcción de su vivienda. Ahora  vende un poco mas de igual manera mejoro un poco sus ingresos.  
El solicita el préstamo para comprar mas productos para la pulpería tales como dulces, azúcar, aceite para cocinar, arroz etc. También desea poder componer el techo de su casa y comprar material de construcción y seguir mejorando su casa poco a poco. Su meta es siempre seguir mejorando su pulpería y ahorrar para darle mejor condiciones de vida a su  familia.
texts.en:
Don José, 34, a native of Esteli, is a security guard.  He also owns a small general store that he opened in a room of his house.  He started the business 7 years ago so that he would have an extra income.
Don Jose tells us that he is pleased with his progress.  He used his first loan to make improvements to his house and make the store more accessible to his customers.  He bought merchandise to stock the business and paid for the construction work.  The extra sales have increased his income.  
He now wants to buy more merchandise--snacks, sugar, cooking oil, rice, etc.--to stock the business.  He also wants to repair his roof and buy construction materials so he can go on improving his house.  His goal is to continue building his business so that he can improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his retail store and building materials for the house that he's improving bit by bit.

loans.name: Martha Luz

texts.es: Martha Luz D. cuarenta y dos años D. edad vive con sus hijos en casa propia. Ella posee un comedor cerca D. la localidad donD. resiD., Martha prepara ricos desayunos y almuerzos todos los días pues el lugar es muy concurrido D. personas, se ha hecho D. mucha clientela ya que sus platillos son exquisitos y los  venD. a precios accesibles; además el lugar es muy higiénico y ella muy servicial siempre complace los gustos D. la clientela. Para Martha la razón D. su trabajo es su familia es por eso que le pone su mejor empeño y es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar material para sus comidas como granos básicos, plátanos, embutidos, lácteos, carnes, bebidas entre otros. Así siempre satisfacer el paladar D. sus clientes y al mismo tiempo llevara el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
Martha Luz is 42 years old living with her children in her own house.  She has an eatery near the locality where she resides.  Martha prepares delicious breakfasts and lunches every day because the place is quite busy.  She has acquired many customers because her dishes are delicious and she sells them at accessible prices.  Besides, the place is very hygienic and she is very service oriented and always satisfies her customers’ wishes.  For Martha, the reason to work is her family and this is why she puts her best effort into it.

This is also why she’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to buy the ingredients she needs for her dishes such as: basic grains, bananas, cured meats, dairy products, meats and beverages, among others.  This way she will always satisfy her customers’ taste buds while supporting her home at the same time.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, bananas, cured meats, dairy products, meats and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, corn, beans, fried pork skin and cheese.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago D. 36 años,  es soltero, vive en casa D. unos familiares, ubicada en el distrito D. Illimo, a unos cuantos minutos del departamento D. Lamabayeque.  Esta zona se dedica a L. agricultura y   ganadería.

DesD. hace algunos años Santiago se dedica a L. agricultura,cuenta con sus propias tierras D. cultivo donD. siembra maíz, es un alimento sano y rico que se consume diariamente por los pobladores que una vez que cosecha lo comercializa en el mercado Moshoqueque D. Chiclayo, vendiendolo al por mayor y menor, con L. finalidad D. aumentar sus ingresos y poder solventar sus gastos personales.

Ha solicitado un préstamo  D. 2200 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para L. compra D. semillas D. maíz amarillo y fertilizantes para preparar y mejorar sus tierras y su producto, el cual posteriormente será vendido para el consumo D. los pobladores.  L. venta D. su maíz mejorará su calidad D. vida y D. las personas con las que vive.  Santiago es una persona empeñosa, responsable y con muchas ganas D. salir adelante mediante trabajo y esfuerzo.
texts.en:
Santiago is 36 years old, single, and lives in a house belonging to some family members.  The house is located in Illimo district, some minutes from Lambayeque department.  The people in this area work in farming and livestock raising.

Santiago has been farming for some years.  He owns his own farm land where he grows corn.  This is a good, healthy food that the local people eat every day.  When he harvests his corn, he sells it both wholesale and retail in Moshoqueque market, in Chiclayo, with the aim of increasing his income and covering his personal expenses.

Santiago has requested a loan for 2,200 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy yellow corn seeds and also fertilizers to prepare and improve his land and crops.  He will later sell these crops for people to eat.  The sale of his corn will improve Santiago's quality of life and that of the people he lives with.  He is a hard-working and responsible person who has a great desire to get ahead in life through his work and efforts.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers to improve his land and crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric, cosmetics, hooks, needles and thread.

loans.name: Nelly Maribel

texts.es:
Nelly Maribel tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera vive con lo padres y un  hijo de 4 años, viven en Parroquia San Pablo perteneciente al Cantón San Miguel.

Los miembros de la V.R.C UNION Y ESPERANZA  se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia San Pablo a 30 minutos de la oficina en San Miguel los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembra de maíz, papas y al comercio ventas de legumbres y otros.

Nelly se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y en pocas cantidades siembra frejol, este trabajo lo viene desarrollando desde hace mucho tiempo, las compras las realiza en San Miguel y Vende sus productos en San Pablo y San Miguel en las ferias.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas de maíz y frejol, el crédito el ayudado a aumentar los ingresos y la producción, ha enfrentado desafíos como la falta de trabajadores y el variación del clima que en ocasiones a dañado los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar terreno para sembrar.

Le gusta trabajar y le gustaria ternimar los estudios.
texts.en: Nelly Maribel is 24 years old, single and lives with her parents and her 4-year-old son in the parish of San Pablo, canton of San Miguel. The members of the V.R.C. Union y Esperanza community bank is located in San Pablo, about 30 minutes from the San Miguel office. The members make a living in agriculture, planting corn and potatoes, and selling legumes and other items. Nelly also makes a living in agriculture, planting corn and a small quantity of beans. This job has been developing for a long time. She makes her purchases in San Miguel and sells her products at the trade fairs in San Pablo and San Miguel. She is requesting the loan to purchase corn and bean seeds to increase her production and income. She has faced challenges such as a lack of workers and variations in climate, which at times can damage her crops. Her dream is to purchase land to sow. She enjoys working and would like to finish her studies.

loans.use: to purchase corn and bean seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, yeast, water and other ingredients.

loans.name: Djénèbou

texts.fr:
Djénèbou N. est une veuve de 37 ans et mère de cinq enfants qui vit avec ses enfants chez son défunt époux à Wayerma I, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso.
Djénèbou N. mène des activités diverses et variées : achat et vente des draps de lits,  de pagnes wax et  des chargements de bois de chauffe depuis plus de quatre  ans. Elle jouit d’une forte réputation dans ces activités et reçoit beaucoup de commande, mais ses ressources ne peuvent pas lui permettre de les satisfaire. Ainsi, elle a besoin de ce cinquième prêt individuel pour acheter, 15 chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe, 5 paquets de draps et 4 complets de tissus brodés respectivement dans les localités environnantes de la ville de Sikasso et à Bobo Dioulasso (Burkina Faso) afin de satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’accroitre.  
Elle est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de trois ans et bénéficia de plusieurs prêts solidaires (P.S.) avec une association de femmes de son quarter. Tous  ces prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
  Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en: Djénèbou N. is a 37-year-old widow and the mother of five children living with her children in the home of her deceased husband, in Wayerma I, a working-class district in Sikasso City. For over four years, she has had various occupations: buying and selling bed sheets, Wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth), and loads of firewood. She enjoys a strong reputation and receives many orders. But her resources no longer allow her to meet the demand. And so, she needs this fifth individual loan to buy: 15 cart loads of firewood, 5 packets of sheets, and 5 sets of embroidered fabrics respectively from towns surrounding Sikasso City and in Bobo Dioulasso (Republic of Burkina Faso) in order to meet the needs of her ever-growing customer base. She has been associated with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso for over three years and has benefited from several solidarity loans with a women's association in her district. The previous loans have all been properly repaid. With this new loan, she envisions making a monthly profit of 150,000 francs CFA that will be used to help cover family expenses and the loan interest. The rest will be invested in her business.

loans.use: to buy various goods

loans.name: María Santos

texts.es: María Santos D. treinta y cinco años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida y sus hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una venta D. artículos D. uso personal que son D. muy buena calidad, por lo tanto son los preferidos y más buscados por las personas del lugar, además los venD. a precios cómodos que sus clientes pueden pagar. María es una mujer carismática llena D. energía, siempre está muy activa, positiva y recibe a las personas que la visitan con una sonrisa que la identifica, ella está dispuesta a nunca renunciar al entusiasmo que la mueve para llevar a su hogar el pan D. cada día por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar más productos como cremas, desodorantes, perfumes, shampo, entre otro; así podrá satisfacer las necesidades D. sus clientes y al mismo tiempo llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: María Santos, 35, lives with her common-law partner and children in her own house.  She sells high end personal care products which are the most popular and sought after by the local people.  She sells at good prices so her customers can pay.  María is a charismatic woman full of energy.  She is always very active and positive and receives everyone who visits her with a smile.  She is adamant about keeping her enthusiasm in order to earn a living, and is requesting a loan through INTEGRAL so she can buy more products such as creams, deodorants, perfumes, and shampoo, among other items.  This way she will be able to satisfy customer demand and insure the household income.

loans.use: To buy creams, deodorants, perfumes and shampoo

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio, vive con su esposa, su suegra y dos hijos, es empleado y su esposa tiene un negocio de venta de pupusas, esta venta la realizan todas las tardes, los fines de semana como él no trabaja colabora vendiendo refrescos y licuados.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar mobiliario para el negocio, específicamente mesas y sillas, también comprara mercadería como chicharrón, quesillo, condimentos, estos pues para las pupusas.
Su pretensión es aumentar las utilidades del negocio, con un negocio más fuerte y ofreciéndole a su familia una mejor solvencia económica.
texts.en:
Julio lives with his wife, mother-in-law and two children.  He is employed and his wife sells "pupusas" (stuffed tortilla) every afternoon.  On weekends, since he doesn't work, he helps out selling softdrinks and smoothies.

He is requesting a loan to buy furniture for the business, specifically tables and chairs, and also buy goods such as pork rind, cheese, and condiments for the pupusas.

He hopes to increase profits and make the business stronger so he can provide his family with a sound economy.

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs, as well as pork rinds, cheese and condiments.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
Ramiro de 37 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa de sus padres; cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, la cual se encuentra en la zona rural de la provincia de Chiclayo.  Los pobladores se dedican al comercio al por mayor y menor de productos, agricultura y turismo.

Desde hace algunos años Ramiro tiene su mototaxi (transporte que se utiliza para movilizarse en distancias cortas, con un cupo máximo de 3 personas) la cual alquila para que la trabajen mañana y tarde, el servicio que brinda es como carpintero metálico actividad donde realiza puertas y ventanas de metal, en un local alquilado, con los ingresos de ambas actividades podrá mejorar en su desarrollo personal. 

El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 3000 nuevos soles y su destino será para implementar su taller de carpintería metálica y para brindarle mantenimiento e implementación de su mototaxi que esta presentando algunos desperfectos y necesita tenerla en buen estado para que siga trabajando.  Ramiro es un que con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo a podido consegir que sus negocios crezcan y pueda seguir ayudando económicamente a sus padres.
texts.en:
Ramiro is 37 years old, single, and lives in his parents' home.  The house only has electricity and is located in the rural area of Chiclayo province where local people sell products wholesale and retail, farm and work in tourism.

For some years, Ramiro has owned a motorcycle taxi (a mode of transport that is used to move short distances and can carry a maximum of three people).  He hires out his vehicle for other people to work with every morning and afternoon.  Ramiro is a metal worker.  He makes doors and windows from metal.  He carries out this business from rented premises and uses the income from both businesses to improve his personal development.

Ramiro has requested a loan for 3,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which he will use to equip his metal shop and also to have some maintenance work done on his motorcycle taxi which has some problems but which he needs to keep in a good state of repair so that it keeps working.  Ramiro is a man who, through a lot of effort and hard work, has been able to grow his businesses and continue helping his parents financially.

loans.use: to equip his metal shop and to have maintenance work done on his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Haby

texts.fr:
Haby a plus de 53 ans mariée et mère de 7 enfants (5 garçons et 2 filles). Elle réside avec son époux, ses deux coépouses et leurs enfants à Hamdallaye, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Haby après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès notamment l’agriculture au village, s’est initiée à cette activité d’achat et de vente des calebasses et divers depuis plus de dix ans. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ sept ans. Après 6 prêts solidaires (prêt du groupe) dans une Association des femmes de son quartier (Association BENKADI de Hamdallaye), elle est à présent à son quatrième prêt individuel. Tous  les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elle sollicite ce  nouveau prêt pour acheter, 15 colis de calebasses à Tona région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative du Mali) avant de les revendre  en détail au grand marché de Sikasso près de la mairie centrale de la localité à une clientèle composée généralement des femmes et surtout de miniers.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 200 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt
texts.en:
Haby is over 53 years old, married, and the mother of seven children (five boys and two girls). She resides with her husband, her two co-wives, and their children in Hamdallaye, a working-class district in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having run many businesses without success, especially in agriculture in the village, she got started in the business of buying and selling calabash containers and various other goods over ten years ago.

Concerned about further satisfying her burgeoning customer base, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso about seven year ago. After six solidarity loans (group loans) in a women's association in her district (Association BENKADI de Hamdallaye), she is now on her fourth individual loan. The previous loans have all been properly repaid. 

Haby is requesting this new loan to buy 15 packets of calabashes in the Tona region of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali) and then will sell them retail at the main market of Sikasso, near the central town hall. Her customer base is generally comprised of women and especially miners. 

With this loan, Haby envisions making a monthly profit of 200,000 francs CFA that will essentially be used for increasing her working capital, to help cover family expenses, and to pay the interest on the loan.

loans.use: to buy packets of calabash containers

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira es una madre de familia de 56 años de edad, vive con sus hijos mayores de edad en su casa propia la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicado en la zona rural de Tongorrape que pertenece al distrito de Motupe, la misma que está en el departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se caracterizan por su actividad agrícola, ganadera y turística  que desarrollan sus pobladores.

Elvira ha puesto  en su casa un pequeña vitrina con golosinas, la cual ofrece a los niños que acuden a un colegio que está cerca a su casa, desde hace unos 6 meses, con los ingresos que obtenga  podrá solventar los gastos diarios de su casa.

Mediante una visita a Edpyme Alternativa Elvira trata de adquirir un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para comprar más productos para abastecer su pequeña tienda y para cubrir algunos gastos personales, al ofrecer mayor variedad de productos podrá incrementar sus ganancias, lo que le permitirá  cubrir su crédito y tener una mejor calidad de vida.   Elvira es conocida por sus vecinos, por ser una persona alegre, dispuesta a ayudar a otros y con muchas ganas de tener mejoras en su casa para los suyos.
texts.en:
Elvira is a 56 year-old mother who lives with her grown-up children in her own home which has only electricity.  The house is located in the rural area of Tangorrape, in Motupe district, in Lambayeque department.  This area is noted for the farming, livestock raising and tourist activities that the local people are engaged in.

Elvira has set up a small display case in her home which contains candies.  She sells these to the children who attend a school near her home.  She has been in this business for some six months and she uses the income she makes to cover her household's daily expenses.

Through a visit to Edpyme Alternativa, Elvira requested a loan for 500 Peruvian soles to buy more products with which to stock her small store and also to cover some personal expenses.  By offering a wider range of products, she will be able to increase her profits which will, in turn, allow her to repay her loan and enjoy a better quality of life.  Elvira is known by her neighbors as being a cheerful person who is ready to help others and who has a great desire to make improvements to her household for the sake of her family.

loans.use: to buy more products to stock her store and also cover some personal expenses

loans.name: Safiatou

texts.fr:
Madame Safiatou est une mariée de 43 ans et mère 4 enfants qui réside  avec  son époux dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Kaboïla II, le centre ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer à l’école pour des raisons sociales, il s’est vite initiée depuis plus de treize ans  aux activités de petit commerce (achat-vente de pagne wax, des tissus brodés, de chaussures, de produits de beauté etc). Elle est beaucoup sollicitée surtout de sa clientèle (composée essentiellement de femmes) pour la qualité de ses produits. Elle reçoit beaucoup de commandes des localités environnantes et son activité marche en merveille et la clientèle est très satisfaite.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ trois ans. Elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel, le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
Elle compte acheter avec ce deuxième prêt 15 pièces de pagne wax, 15 complets de tissus brodés, 20 paires de chaussures plastiques, etc. Elle s’approvisionne à Bobo Dioulasso (au Burkina Faso) ensuite elle les revend de façon ambulante à Sikasso et souvent dans les localités environnantes de Sikasso.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 170 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en: Ms. Safiatou is a 43-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. She resides with her husband in a large, traditional extended families in Kaboïla II, the downtown of Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Not having had the chance to advance in school due to societal reasons, she soon started working in small-scale commerce about thirteen years ago. She buys and sells Wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth), embroidered fabrics, shoes, beauty products, etc. She is in high demand, especially by her customer base (essentially of women), for the quality of her products. She receives many orders from surrounding towns. Business is booming, and her customers are very satisfied. Concerned about further satisfying her burgeoning customer base, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso about three years ago. She is now on her second individual loan. The previous one was properly repaid. She intends to spend her second loan on: 15 lengths of Wax pagne cloth, 15 outfits of embroidered fabrics, 20 pairs of plastic footwear, etc. She gets her supplies in Bobo Dioulasso (in the Republic of Burkina Faso) and will sell them door-to-door in Sikasso and often in towns surrounding Sikasso. With this loan, she envisions making a monthly profit of 170,000 francs CFA that will essentially be used to increase her working capital, to help cover family expenses, and to pay the interest on the loan.

loans.use: to buy various goods

loans.name: Edis Argentina

texts.es:
Edis, vive con sus dos hijos D. 16 y 12 años D. edad, se dedica al comercio D. granos básicos y frutas, tiene 5 años D. tener el negocio y trabaja en lo propio D. lunes a sábado.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo  para invertirlo en maíz, frijol, azúcar, café, y frutas, manzanas, bananos, sandias, peras, para fortalecer el negocio y tener mayor inventario para ofrecer a los clientes.
Su objetivo es mejorar económicamente, dar a sus hijos la oportunidad D. la educación para que puedan superarse.
texts.en:
Edis lives with her two children, ages 16 and 12.  She sells basic grains and fruit and has been in business for five years.  She works Monday through Saturday.

She has requested a loan to buy corn, beans, sugar, coffee and fruit: apples, bananas, watermelon and pears, to strengthen her business and offer more inventory to customers.

Her goal is to improve economically and give her children a good education so they can be successful.

loans.use: To buy corn, beans, sugar, coffee, fruit, apples and bananas.

loans.name: Marina Ines

texts.es:
Marina, es originaria de la comarca el Jicarito localizada en Telica municipio de León, tiene 38 años de edad, es madre de  hijos, de oficio comerciante ella se dedica a vender mariscos, lleva 8 años en esta actividad, debido a su situación económica sus padres eran muy pobres no pudo seguir estudiando,  solo llego hasta 4 año de la secundaria. Inicio vendiendo en las calles de su comunidad donde salía desde muy tempranas horas a vender caminando largas distancia para lograr vender sus productos en ese entonces ella tenia 20 años de edad, con el tiempo fue que decidió dedicarse a la venta de mariscos. Sus hijos mayores le ayudan  vender junto con su esposo, se apoyan como familia, ellos venden en la terminal de los buses y de esta forma es que ellos sobreviven. 
Solicito el crédito para comprar una camioneta, para   ocuparla para trabajar transportar sus equipos de trabajo como la mesas, sillas, hielera (termo helado), marisco y así ya no utilizar un carretón. Con esta inversión espera poder sacar su negocio adelante, tener ahorros, mejorar sus ventas, desea poder constituir un negocio familiar solido. Dentro de sus planes futuros esta poder comprar un local  en le mercado, ampliar su negocio. Su meta próxima es mejorar si vivienda en especial los dormitorios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marina is from Jicarito County in Telica, a municipality of León.  She is 38 years old and the mother of two children.  She has been selling seafood for a living for 8 years.  Her parents were very poor and she was only able to finish 4th grade.  She began work as a street vendor in her community, going out in the very early morning hours, walking long distances to sell her goods.  She was only 20 years old then and, with time, decided to sell seafood.  Her older children help with sales, as does her husband.  They sell in the bus terminal and are able to make a decent living.

Marina has requested a loan to buy a truck so she can transport her work equipment, consisting of tables, chairs, a cooler, and the seafood.  With this investment she hopes to be able to increase business, save money and improve sales.  She hopes to build her business into a solid family enterprise.  Her plans for the future include buying a market stall and expanding her activity.  Her goal is to make some home improvements, especially to her childrens' bedrooms.

loans.use: To buy a truck to transport work equipment.

loans.name: Renelmo Manuel

texts.es:
Renelmo es un cliente de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia y tiene dos menores hijos a su cargo. Renelmo vive en el distrito San Pedro de Lloc perteneciente a la provincia de Pacasmayo – La Libertad. Esta es una comunidad pequeña y humilde en vías de desarrollo.

Renelmo se dedica desde hace 10 años a la venta de relojes, controles remotos, lentes de sol, entre otros, en un puesto ubicado en  las afueras del mercado de su comunidad. El negocio de Renelmo no cuenta con clientela establecida pero si con gran afluencia, estas ventas le permiten darle comodidades a sus hijos.

Renelmo solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de  2000 nuevos soles para comprar mercadería (relojes y controles remotos) para su negocio, así como para adquirir bienes personales que le son de suma necesidad.

Renelmo ya ha trabajado con nosotros y cuenta con un excelente récord de pagos.
texts.en:
Renelmo is a 39 year old client who lives in his own house and looks after his two young children. He lives in the district of San Pedro de Lloc, which is part of the Pacasmayo-La Libertad province. This is a small and humble community that is in the process of developing.
For the past 10 years, Renelmo has been selling watches, remote controls, sun glasses, and other items from a stall located on the outskirts of the community marketplace. The business does not have an established customer base, but there are many customers and the sales enable him to provide for his children.
Renelmo is requesting a $750 loan from Edpyme Alternativa to buy merchandise (watches and remote controls) for his business, and to buy some personal items that are of the utmost necessity. 
Renelmo has worked with us [Edypme] before and has an excellent repayment record.

loans.use: to buy watches and remote controls and for personal use

location.town: San Pedro de Lloc - Pacasmayo - La Libertad

loans.name: La Rivera Group

texts.es:
Susy Anahi D. 43 años D. edad vive en L. distrito D. Huancayo Perú, socia D. L. alcancía comunal L. rivera, es madre soltera con dos hijos menores, Raúl D. 10 años y Geraldine D. 6 años, L. socia  se dedica a L. venta D. Comida desD. hace 2 años y anteriormente tenía una tienda que no le generaba muchos ingresos, ahora elL. venD. comida y bebidas en L. puerta D. su casa todas las tardes, L. socia agradece mucho a sus hijos por el apoyo condicional y moral que le ayudan para L. venta todas las tardes y asi genera sus propios ingresos y ahorro para los gastos del hogar.  El Préstamo es para L. compra D. arroz, Aceite, azúcar para su negocio. L. socia esta en L. primera fiL. lado derecho con chompa color verD. pantalon jean color azul. L. que no estuvieron son edeli, ana isabel,magaly angelica estan en orden al costado D. L. foto por las socias trabajan.
El Préstamo es  D. s/. 1000.00 Nuevo Soles
texts.en: Susy Anahi, 43, lives in the Huancayo District in Perú.  She is a member of the communal bank "L. Rivera", and a single mother of two children, Raúl, age 10, and Geraldine, age 6.  She has been in business selling food for two years.  Before, she ran a store that did not generate much income, so now she sells food and beverages in the front of her house in the afternoons.  She is very grateful to her children for the unconditional moral support they give her every afternoon so she can generate an income and cover household expenses.  The loan will be used to buy rice, oil and sugar for the business.  The member is the one on the right in the first row, with the green sweater and bluejeans.  The group members who were not present are Edeli, Ana Isabel, and Magaly Angelica who are pictured to the left of the larger photo.  The loan is for 1,000 PEN.

loans.use: To sell food and other items.

loans.name: Juana Alicia

texts.es: Juana Alicia de 59 años de edad, vive con su compañero de vida y su hijo quien asiste a la escuela. Ella posee un negocio de frutas y verduras con el que logra llevar el sustento a su hogar; Para Juana el verdadero trabajo es aquel que le permite convertir sus sueños en realidades y sus ideas en hechos, es por eso  que siempre está muy dedicada a su trabajo, ya tiene una clientela muy grande pues posee el mejor servicio del lugar, además de la fruta y verdura más fresca a un precio accesible; quiere que su negocio crezca es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar bananos, manzanas, mangos, cebollas, tomates entre otros. De esta forma satisfacera la necesidad de sus clientes y al mismo tiempo lograra que su familia posea lo que necesita para tener una vida plena.
texts.en:
Juana Alicia is 59 years old.  She lives with her life partner and her son who is in school.  She owns a fruit and veg business through which she manages to support her household.  For Juana, true work is that which allows you to turn your dreams into reality and your ideas into facts.  This is why she is always very committed to her work.  She has a very large customer base as she offers the best service in her area.  She also offers her fruit and vegetables at an affordable price.

Juana would like her business to grow and so she is requesting a loan from Integral which will allow her to buy bananas, apples, mangos, onions, tomatoes and other products.  This will enable her to meet her customers' needs and, at the same time, ensure that her family has what they need to live a full life.

loans.use: to buy bananas, apples, mangos, onions and tomatoes

loans.name: Argedis

texts.es:
Argedis es un hombre trabajador de 29 años de edad, él vive con su esposa e hijo en una pequeña comunidad rural perteneciente al distrito de Tambogrande – Piura.

Argedis se dedica a la crianza de ovinos y a la agricultura. Cuenta con terreno agrícola en el cual siembra limón y mango que cosecha semanalmente y asiste diariamente. Argedis tiene clientela establecida en su zona, para ambos negocios. La venta de animales y de sus frutos le permite a Argedis darle ciertas comodidades a su familia. Sin embargo, él tiene muchos deseos de darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

Argedis solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles que invertirá en la compra de alimento balanceado para sus animales. Así como, para comprar fertilizantes para que sus cultivos den una mejor calidad de fruto y por lo tanto le genere mayores ganancias.
 
Argedis tiene muchos deseos de superación y tiene buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en:
Argedis is a hardworking 29 year old. He lives with his wife and son in a small rural community in the district of Tambogrande-Piura. 
Argedis works raising sheep and crops. He has agricultural land where he has lemon and mango trees that he harvests weekly and tends daily. Argedis has established customers in his area for both businesses. Selling animals and his fruits enables Argedis to give his family some home comforts. However, he has a strong desire to give his family a better standard of living. 
Argedis is requesting a loan of $375 from Edpyme Alternativa to buy good food for his animals and to buy fertilizer so that his trees will have better quality fruit and therefore generate more income.
Argedis is eager to succeed and has good personal and work references.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy damask cloth, caustic soda, dyes, etc.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
María del Rosario es una clienta de 26 años de edad, ella es madre soltera de un niño y vive en casa de sus padres en una pequeña comunidad rural del distrito Las Lomas de Piura.

María del Rosario cuenta con una tienda (instalada en su propio domicilio) de productos de primera necesidad, en la que vende abarrotes, golosinas, bebidas y productos de higiene personal. Su tienda es una de las más surtidas en la zona y es por ello que cuenta con gran afluencia de clientes. 

María del Rosario solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar mercadería e incrementar los inventarios y así poder atender en menor tiempo a sus clientes. Esta inversión le permitirá seguir creciendo económicamente y mejorar la calidad de vida de su pequeño hijo, ofreciéndole mayores comodidades.

María del Rosario es cliente recurrente de nuestra entidad. Su primer crédito fue KIVA y lo canceló puntualmente.
texts.en:
26-year old Rosario is a single mother of a son. She lives with her parents in a small rural community in the district of Las Lomas de Piura.

Rosario runs a shop out of her home selling basics such as groceries, candy, drinks and personal hygiene products. Her store is one of the best-stocked in the area so she has a large number of customers.

She is seeking a loan of S/. 2000 from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa to buy merchandise and increase her stock so that she can serve her customers in less time. The loan will allow her to continue to grow economically and improve the standard of living of her small son. She will be able to provide him with a more comfortable life. 

Rosario is a regular client of Edpyme Alternativa. Her first loan was with Kiva and she repaid it punctually.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Maria Magdalena tiene 40 años de edad, es casada vive con el esposo y con los  hijos, viven en Parroquia San Pablo perteneciente al Cantón San Miguel.

Los miembros de la V.R.C UNION Y ESPERANZA  se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia San Pablo a 30 minutos de la oficina en San Miguel los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembra de maíz, papas y al comercio ventas de legumbres y otros.

Maria Magdalena se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz y choclo, este trabajo lo viene desarrollando desde hace mucho tiempo, las compras las realiza en San Miguel y Vende sus productos en San Pablo y San Miguel en las ferias.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas de maíz y choclo, el crédito el ayudado a aumentar los ingresos y la producción, ha enfrentado desafíos como la falta de trabajadores y el variación del clima que en ocasiones a dañado los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar mas terreno.

En los tiempos libres le gusta conversar con el esposo.
texts.en:
Maria Magdalena is 40 years old, married, and lives with her husband and children in San Pablo parish, in San Miguel canton.

The Unión y Esperanza (Unity and Hope) community bank is located in San Pablo parish, 30 minutes from our San Miguel office.  The members of this group farm corn and potatoes, and sell vegetables and other products.

Maria Magdalena is a farmer who grows corn.  She has been in this line of work for a long time.  She makes her purchases in San Miguel and sells her products in the markets in San Pablo and San Miguel.

Maria Magdalena is requesting this loan to buy corn seeds.  This loan will help her to increase her income and production.  She faces challenges in her business such as a lack of workers and changes in the weather which sometimes damage her crops.  Her dream is to buy more land.

In her spare time, Maria Magdalena likes to chat with her husband.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds

loans.name: Luis Oswaldo

texts.es:
Luis es un padre de familia 37 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de la Illimo, que se encuentra a una distancia larga del departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona la actividad principal es la agricultura y ganadería.

Luis de hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado porcino (cerdos), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo y así pueda ofrecerlos a los diferentes mercados de la zona obtenindo  muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos diarios.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar animales y su respectiva comida, para engordarlos y poder ofertarlos a sus clientes a un buen precio.  Luis es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su negocio crezca cada vez más para poder cubrir su crédito y poderles dar un mejor nivel de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Luis is a 37 year-old father who lives with his wife and children in his own home which has only electricity.  It is located in the rural area of Illimo district, a long distance from Lambayeque department.  The main business activities in this area are farming and livestock raising.

Luis has been raising and selling pigs for some years.  He has a pen located in an area behind his home.  He feeds his animals with balanced feed so that they grow optimally and he can then sell them in the different markets in his area and make very good profits with which to cover his daily expenses.

Luis has requested a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy animals and their respective feed.  He will fatten the animals and then sell them to his customers at a good price.  Luis is a hard-working, very responsible person and the only thing he wants is for his business to continue growing so that he can repay his loan and be able to provide his family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy animals and feed

loans.name: Kadidia

texts.fr:
Kadidia a plus de 52 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 8 enfants. Elle vit avec son époux et 4 de leurs enfants dans leur famille à Sanoubougou I, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Kadidia après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, s’est initiée à cette activité d’achat et de vente de  fruits (mangues, oranges, ignames, patates, etc.) depuis plus de vingt six ans. Elle mène son activité au nouveau marché de Médine Sikasso. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a maintenant cinq ans. Elle a bénéficié de 2 prêts individuels et elle est  maintenant à son 3ème prêt individuel, tous ses prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce troisième prêt,  2 chargements de camion “10 tonnes” de mangues et d’orange. Elle s approvisionne dans les localités environnantes de Sikasso avant de les revendre soit en gros ou en détail à une clientèle composée généralement de forains venant d’autres villes du pays mais surtout de DAKAR (république Sénégalaise).
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 300 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Kadidia is over 52 years old, married, and the mother of eight children. She lives with her husband and four of their children in their family in Sanoubougou I, a working-class district in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having run many business without success, Ms. Kadidia became introduced to the buying and selling of fruit (mangoes, oranges, yams, potatoes, etc.) over 26 years ago. She operates at the new market of Médine Sikasso. 

Concerned about further satisfying her burgeoning customer base, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso about five year ago. She has benefited from two individual loans, and she is now on her third individual loan. The previous loans have all been properly repaid. 

She intends to spend this third loan on two 10-tonne truck loads of mangoes and oranges. She gets her supplies in the towns surrounding Sikasso and then resells the goods wholesale or retail. Her customer base is comprised generally of fair-goers from other cities in the nation but particularly from DAKAR (in the Republic of Senegal). 

With this loan, she envisions making a monthly profit of 300,000 francs CFA that will essentially be used to help cover family expenses and to pay the interest on the loan. The rest will be invested in her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Lassina

texts.fr:
Monsieur Lassina a 35 ans environ, marié et père de trois enfants. Il réside avec sa famille à Wayerma II, le centre ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Lassina après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, s’est initié  depuis maintenant trois ans aux activités de commerce d’articles divers dont il dispose d’une boutique devant le domicile conjugal, où il mène son activité d’achat et vente  de Cigarettes, bonbons, allumettes, Chewing Gum, lait en poudre, Thé, sucres, savons, etc. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ quatre ans. Il  a déjà  bénéficié  de 3 crédits qui ont été tous correctement remboursés. 
Il sollicite ainsi ce quatrième crédit pour pouvoir acheter, 15 cartouches de Cigarettes différentes, 5 sacs du sucre, 12 cartons du thé,  5 paquets de bonbon, 9 paquets de Chewing Gum, 25 paquets d’allumette, 15 cartons de savons, etc. Ses marchandises sont achetées auprès de commerçants grossistes de la ville avant de les revendre en détail dans sa boutique.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 200 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Monsieur Lassina is about 35 years old, married, and the father of three children. He lives with his family in Wayerma II, a neighborhood in downtown Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After running several businesses without success, Monsieur Lassina has been buying and selling diverse products for three years. He has a shop in front of his family's home, where he trades in cigarettes, candy, matches, gum, powdered milk, tea, sugar, soap, etc. He is very much in demand by his clients because his products are of good quality.

To satisfy his growing clientele, he decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso about four years ago. He has already received three loans which have all been duly repaid.

He is seeking a fourth loan to buy fifteen cartons of various cigarettes, five bags of sugar, twelve boxes of tea, five packages of candy, nine packages of gum, twenty-five packages of matches, fifteen boxes of soap, etc. His merchandise is bought from wholesale sellers in the city to be sold retail in his shop. 

With this loan he plans to make a monthly profit of 200,000 FCFA, which will primarily be used to help pay family expenses, pay interest on his loan, and invest in his business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products.

loans.name: Holger Deifilio

texts.es:
Holger tiene 48 años de edad, es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos, viven en Parroquia San Pablo perteneciente al Cantón San Miguel.

Los miembros de la V.R.C UNION Y ESPERANZA  se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia San Pablo a 30 minutos de la oficina en San Miguel los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembra de maíz, papas y al comercio ventas de legumbres y otros.

Holger se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y trigo, este trabajo lo viene desarrollando desde hace mucho tiempo, las compras las realiza en San Miguel y Vende sus productos en San Pablo y San Miguel en las ferias.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas de maíz y de trigo, el crédito el ayudado a aumentar los ingresos y la producción, ha enfrentado desafíos como la falta de trabajadores y el variación del clima que en ocasiones a dañado los cultivos. Su sueño es mejorar la vivienda.

Le gusta mucho festejar el carnaval.
texts.en:
Holger is 48 years old, married and lives with his wife and children in the parish of San Pablo, located in the canton of San Miguel.

The members of the “UNION AND HOPE” cooperative find themselves located in San Pablo, located 30 minutes from San Miguel.  They dedicate themselves to growing corn, potatoes, and to the business of selling vegetables and other items.

Holger dedicates himself to farming, planting corn and wheat, work he has been carrying out for a long time.  He makes his purchases in San Miguel and sells his products at the markets in San Pablo and San Miguel.

He requests this loan to buy corn and wheat seeds.  The credit has helped him augment his income and his production.  He has faced challenges, such as a lack of workers and changes in climate, that sometimes have damaged his crops.  His dream is to make improvements to his home.

He very much enjoys celebrating at the carnival.

loans.use: buy corn and wheat seeds.

loans.name: Oumou

texts.fr:
Madame Oumou a plus 42 ans et vit avec son époux et ses 7 enfants (2 garçons et 5 filles), à Wayerma I, le centre ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, Madame Oumou s’est initiée à cette activité de restauration depuis plus de quinze ans. Son activité est menée toutes les nuits devant le domicile conjugal à Wayerma I Sikasso où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses mets.  
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant cinq ans. Après 8 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier, elle est à son septième prêt individuel, tous ses prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce présent prêt:, 30 poulets, 2 sacs de pomme de terre, 20 paquets de spaghetti, 45kg de poissons frais, 40kg de haricot, 40 sachets d’Attièkè, 30kg de haricot vert et un stock de bananes plantain (Aloko). Elle achète ses marchandises sur place.  Les plats alimentaires sont vendues au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes, de jeunes (célibataires) surtout de noctambules. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce de ses dépenses, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt .
texts.en:
Oumou is over 42 years old and lives with her husband and seven children (two boys and five girls) in Wayerma I, the central town of Sikasso (the Republic of Mali's third administrative region).

Having had many unsuccessful business ventures, Oumou began her restauration business more than 15 years ago. She carries this out every night in front of her marital home in Wayerma I Sikasso, where she is in great demand from her customers for the quality of her dishes. 

In order to satisfy her ever growing customer demand, she decided to join the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, five years ago. After eight solidarity (group) loans within a women's association in her district, she is now on her seventh individual loan, and all her previous loans have been repaid in full.

With this loan she is planning to buy: 30 chickens, two sacks of potatoes, 20 packets of spaghetti, 45kg of fresh fish, 40kg of beans, 40 sachets of "Attièkè"(couscous made from cassava), 30kg of green beans and a stock of plantain bananas (Aloko). She buys her products locally. She sells her meals for cash and on credit to a customer base made up of women, young (single) people and above all nightowls. 

She expects to make a monthly profit of 150,000FCFA which will be used mainly to expand her business, to contribute to the family's expenses and to pay the interest on her loan.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for restauration business

loans.name: Willian Alexander

texts.es:
William, vive con su esposa y tiene un hijo de 5 años de edad, William se dedica a la venta de minutas, tiene experiencia en el negocio, es propio y lo aprendió desde pequeño, pero se dedica a él desde hace 6 años como medio de ingreso para su hogar.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de jarabe, miel, azúcar, leche y hielo, estos son los ingredientes que él necesita para continuar ofreciendo minutas, con este préstamo espera realizar la inversión y aumentar sus ventas.
Su objetivo es tener buenas ventas, aumentar las ganancias y comprar lo necesario para su familia.
texts.en:
William lives with his wife and has one 5-year old child.  William dedicates himself to selling minutas (ground ice topped with fruit syrup).  He has a lot of experience, as he learned it from a young age.  He has been in business for 6 years, having started it as a means to generate income for his household.

Currently, he requests this loan for the purchase of syrup, honey, sugar, milk and ice.  These are the ingredients he needs to continue offering his minutas.  With this loan, he hopes to realize the investment and augment his sales.  His objective is to have good sales, increase his earnings, and buy what’s necessary for his family.

loans.use: buy syrup, honey, sugar, milk and ice.

loans.name: Discapacitados En Accion Group

texts.es: La Señora Alberta es una mujer muy trabajadora y tiene mucho entusiasmo, ella se dedica a la venta en su bodega que se encuentra en su propio domicilio, a la vez tambien tiene un puesto D. lavado D. autos, aunque aun tiene poco tiempo con ese negocio, pero ella pone un gran optimismo en hacer crecer su negocio. La señora Alberta es parte D. la Alcancia Comunal "DISCAPACITADOS EN ACCION" grupo formado inicialmente en su totalidad por personas con alguna discapacidad fisica, ahora son solo algunos socios del grupo que aun representan el nombre D. la alcancia, pero todos ellos son personas muy emprendedoras, que sueñan con hacer crecer sus negocios, y dar lo mejor para sus familias.
texts.en:
Alberta is a hard-working woman who has a great deal of enthusiasm.  She dedicates herself to commerce from her store, which is located right in her own house.  She also has a car wash and, although she has not had a lot of time in this business yet, she is very optimistic that she can make the enterprise grow.

Alberta is a member of “THE DISABLED IN ACTION”, a group originally comprised entirely of members with some type of physical disability.  Currently, there are only a few members left who still represent the group’s name.  However, they are all very entrepreneurial people who dream of making their businesses grow and proviD. a better life for their families.

loans.use: purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Sériba

texts.fr:
Né le 08 Octobre 1960 à Tinzanadougou, Monsieur Sériba est marié  et réside avec son épouse et leurs enfanfs dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Sanoubougou I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Sériba après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, s’est intéressé  au domaine de l’achat vente de bétails il y a environ 9 ans. Il mène cette activité au marché de bétail du nouveau marché de Médine où il vend des  (moutons, chèvres, etc.). Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de son bétail. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décide de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt individuel pour acheter plus de têtes de bétail dans les localités environnantes que sont entre autres (Bamoukou, Kléla, Koro Barrage, etc.) lui permettant de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante.
 Avec ce prêt il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Born on October 8, 1960 in Tinzanadougou, Mr. Sériba is married and lives with his wife and their children in a large traditional extended family in Sanoubougou I, one of the working-class districts of the city of Sikasso (Mali's third administrative region).
Mr. Sériba gained interest in buying and selling livestock about nine years ago, after managing several unsuccessful businesses. He conducts his business at the livestock market in Medina, where he sells sheep, goats, etc. He is very much in demand with his customers for the quality of his livestock.
To satisfy his ever-growing customer base, he has decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance organization. He is on his first individual loan with them, to purchase more heads of livestock in neighboring towns (for instance Bamoukou, Kléla, Koro Barrage, etc.), which will allow him to better satisfy his ever-growing clientele.
With this loan, he plans on making a 100,000 CFA monthly benefit, which will be used mostly to increase his capital, to contribute to the family's expenses, and to repay his loan's interests.

loans.use: to purchase livestock (sheep, goats, etc.).

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis, vive con su familia, su esposa y dos hijos de 26 y 23 años de edad, él es agricultor desde hace 35 años, desde muy joven aprendió junto a su padre, no tiene un horario fijo, y actualmente iniciara el proceso de siembra de maíz.
Este préstamo le ayudara a adquirir semilla, abono y preparar la tierra, con estos materiales podrá dar inicio a la actividad y producir granos básicos para su familia.
Su objetivo al iniciar cada siembra es obtener una buena cosecha, ayudar a su familia para la alimentación y mejorar las condiciones.
texts.en:
Luis lives with his family, which is his wife and two children, aged 26 and 23 years old. He has been a farmer for 35 years. He learned when he was very young at his father's side. He has no set schedule, and at this time he will begin planting corn.   

This loan will help him acquire seed, ferilizer and to prepare the soil. With these materials, he can begin the activity and produce basic grains for his family. His objective is to have a good harvest, to help his family with food, and to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and to prepare the soil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides,and to prepare the soil.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MUNAY TIKA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Jessica; ella tiene 18 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de agricultura, ella tiene unas tierras de cultivo donde siembra papa, maíz y habas y luego lo vende en el mercado de Urubamba desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de papa, haba y maíz venta. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar papa y fertilizantes para sus tierras de cultivo.                                               
                        
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Jessica is a member of the "Munay Tika" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Jessica is 18 years old, lives with her partner, and has one child.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her farming business.  Jessica owns farmland where she grows potatoes, corn and beans which she later sells in Urubamba market.  She works from 8.00am to 7.00pm.  Through this business, Jessica gets her son ahead in life.  She would like to expand her business selling potatoes, beans and corn and is requesting this loan to buy potatoes and fertilizers for her farmland.

Jessica is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and fertilizers for her land

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MUNAY TIKA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria; ella tiene 50 años de edad y es casada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant donde prepara desayunos, almuerzos y  cenas y también vende gaseosas, cervezas y chicha (bebida a base de maíz), la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el servicio de restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar y para comprar gaseosas y cervezas.                                                  
                     
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Señora Maria is a member of the communal bank "Munay Tika" located in the district and province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco. 

She is 50 years old, married and has 5 children.  She alternates her daily activities with her restaurant business where she prepares breakfast, lunch and dinner as well as selling sodas, beer and chicha (a corn based drink).  She works from 7:00 am until 10:00 pm.  This business helps her to provide for her children.  She wants to expand and improve her restaurant service so she is requesting a loan to buy products to prepare and sodas and beer.                                                    
                     
Señora Maria is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: purchase products to prepare in her restaurant as well as soda and beer.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Lorenzo, vive con su madre y una hermana, es soltero, y se dedica a la agricultura, este negocio inicio hace 30 años, trabaja con la ayuda de unos sobrinos, no tiene un horario fijo para laborar.
Por el momento solicita un préstamo para comprar abono, fertilizantes y preparar el terreno, con este proceso dará inicio al cultivo de este año, dando los cuidados necesarios y esperando tener una buena producción.
Su objetivo es que a través de su trabajo, pueda dar alimentación a su familia y poder comercializar otra parte para tener ingresos.
texts.en:
Lorenzo lives with his mother and sister.  He is single and works in agriculture.  He started his business 30 years ago and works with the help of his nieces and nephews.  He doesn't work on a fixed schedule.  He is requesting a loan to buy manure and fertilizers to prepare the soil.  With these preparations he will start planting for this season.  He will give his crops the necessary care and hope to have a good harvest. 

His goal is to be able to feed his family with his harvest and to market the rest so that he will have an income.

loans.use: purchase manure and fertilizers to prepare the soil.

loans.name: Israel

texts.es:
Israel, vive con su esposa, tiene 36 años es padre de dos hijos de 9 y 4 años de edad, Israel es agricultor, desde joven labora en esta actividad, esta es la fuente de ingreso con la que cuenta para el sostenimiento de su familia.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de plantas de chile, abono y tratamiento para plagas, con esta oportunidad dará inicio al nuevo cultivo, del que espera sea de mucho provecho.
Su objetivo es mejorar las cosechas año con año, apoyar a sus hijos en sus necesidades básicas y formarlos en su educación.
texts.en:
Israel is 36 years old and lives with his wife and two children aged 9 and 4.  He is a farmer who has been farming since he was young.  This is the source of income with which he supports his family.

Israel is requesting a loan to buy chile plants, fertilizers and pest treatments.  With the opportunity he is being given, he will start growing his new crops which he hopes will do well.

Israel's goals are to improve his harvests, year after year, and to support his children in their basic needs and also in their education.

loans.use: to buy chile plants, fertilizers and pest treatments

loans.name: Amigas Solidarias De Miguel Grau Group

texts.es:
La señora Nilda es Presidenta de la Alcancia Comunal "AMIGAS SOLIDARIAS DE MIGUEL GRAU" elegida por su dones de lider, es una persona muy trabajadora e imparcial.
La señora Nilda posee una bodega muy bien surtida en la cual se dedica todos los dias de la semana, con ayuda de su mayor hija, anteriormente tambien trabajaba 2 dias de la semana como empleada de hogar en una casa y tambien del cuidado del anciano que vive en ella, mientras que su mayor hija se dedicaba a vender en su bodega.
La señora Nilda se esfuerza por sus 3 hijos, a quienes quiere ver siendo profesionales en sus estudios, y darle lo que ella no tubo de pequeña para que sean personas de provecho en el futuro.
texts.en:
Nilda is the president of the "Amigas Solidarias de Miguel Grau" community bank.  She was elected for her leadership qualities.  She is a very hard-working and impartial person.

Nilda owns a very well stocked grocery store where she works every day of the week with the help of her eldest daughter.  She also used to work as a cleaner two days a week, cleaning the house of an elderly gentlemen who she cared for as well, while her daughter worked in the store.

Nilda works hard for her three children who she would like to see become professionals.  She would like to give them what she didn't have as a young girl so that they become good, hard-working people in the future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, groceries, food products etc.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MUNAY TIKA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Tomasa; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida, ella prepara diferentes tipos de comida como caldo de gallina, ella vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 1:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de comida. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como gallina, carne y verduras.                                           
                           
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Tomasa is a member of the “MUNAY TIKA” community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Tomasa is 40 years old, lives with her partner, and has five children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling food.  She prepares different types of food such as chicken soup which she sells as an itinerant street vendor from 7.00am to 1.00pm.  Through this business, she gets her children ahead in life.  Tomasa would like to expand and improve her food business.  She is requesting a loan to buy products with which to prepare her food such as chicken, meat and vegetables.

Tomasa is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy products for making meals such as chicken, meat and vegetables

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos, vive con hijo de 39 años, dos nietos, ella se dedica  a la venta de tortillas, tamales, comida típica, la tortillería la tiene desde hace 20 años, estos negocio son su fuente de ingreso para el sustento diario, atiende de 9:00am a 6:00pm.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz, gas, pollo, condimentos, frijol, arroz y queso, esto para producir los productos a los clientes, esto le ayudara para tener todo lo necesario y poder dar abasto a la demanda.
