Susana; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de frutas, ella lo distribuye a todos los mercados del distrito de Urubamba, la fruta lo trae del distrito de Calca, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de fruta. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar fruta como naranjas, plátanos, manzanas, uvas y mandarinas.  
                                                           
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Susana is a member of the "Munay Tika" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Susana is 40 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling fruit.  She distributes her products to all the markets in Urubamba district and buys her fruit in Calca district.  Through this business, she gets her children ahead in life.  Susana would like to expand her fruit business.  She is requesting this loan to buy fruit such as oranges, bananas, apples, grapes and mandarins.

Susana is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy fruit such as oranges, bananas, apples, grapes and mandarins

loans.name: Chabuca

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MUNAY TIKA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Chabuca; ella tiene 24 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y también realiza el servicio de llamadas y la venta de recargas para celulares, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la tienda de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar y fideos y también para pagar las líneas de los celulares.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Chabuca is a member of the "Munay Tika" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Chabuca is 24 years old, lives with her partner, and has one child.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her grocery store business.  She also provides a call service and sells top-ups (minutes) for cell phones.  She works from 6.00am to 5.00pm and, through her business, she gets her children ahead in life.  Chabuca would like to expand her grocery store business.  She is requesting this loan to buy products for her grocery store such as rice, sugar and noodles.  She will also pay for cell phone lines.  

Chabuca is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy products for her grocery store such as rice, sugar and noodles, and to pay for cell phone lines

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MUNAY TIKA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Emiliano; el tiene 45 años de edad y es casado y tiene 4 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de construcción, el realiza diferentes trabajos de construcción como casas y edificios, por medio de este trabajo el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere mejorar el trabajo de construcción y también quiere terminar de construir su casa. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como fierros, bloquetas y cementos.
                                                       
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Emiliano is a member of the "Munay Tika" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Emiliano is 45 years old, married, and has four children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his building work.  He works on different construction jobs such as houses and buildings.  Through this work, he gets his children ahead in life.  Emiliano would like to improve the construction work that he does and would also like to finish building his own house.

Emiliano is requesting this loan to buy construction supplies such as iron, blocks and cement.  He is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies such as iron, blocks and cement

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira D. 63 años D. edad, es casada sin carga familiar, tiene casa propia, contando con los servicios D. agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito D. Chepén, la misma que pertenece al departamento D. la Libertad.  Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

La actividad que desarrolla Elvira es ha la venta D. todo tipo D. productos para el consumo diario D. las personas (arroz, leche, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, gaseosas, etc), en su propio domicilio desD. hace varios años, al encontrarse su negocio en su casa pueD. atender a cualquier hora, lo que le permite diferenciarse D. otras tiendas y así pueda obtener más ingresos para solventar sus gastos diarios.

El crédito solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es D. 2000 nuevos soles, el cual lo destinará para comprar mayor cantidad D. mercadería y poder ampliar su negocio con otros productos una vez que sus ventas aumenten.  El sueño D. Elvira es tener más adelante una tienda mayorita que le genere mayores ingresos para mejorar su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Elvira is 63 years old, married, and does not have any dependents.  She owns her own home which has water and electricity services and is located in Chepén district, in La Libertad department.  The people in this area farm, raise livestock and work in tourism.

Elvira's business activity is selling all kinds of essential household products (rice, milk, oil, sugar, toilet paper, soda, etc).  She makes her sales from her home and has been in this business for several years.  As her business is located in her home, she is able to serve in it at any time which allows her to differentiate herself from other stores and she is thereby able to make more income with which to cover her daily expenses.

Elvira has requested a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa and she will use it to buy a larger quantity of merchandise and expand her business with other products once her sales increase.  Elvira's dream for the future is to own a wholesale store which will make her more income and enable her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more products to expand her business

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Clara de 54 años de edad es una madre de familia que vive con su esposo y  sus 2 hijos, vive en casa propia, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz en el distrito de Mórrope que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque. Se caracteriza por ser una zona de mucha actividad agricola, ganadera y artesana.

Clara se dedica  a la crianza de ganado ovino (ovejas ) desde hace varios años, su corral donde se encuentran sus ovejas está en la parte posterior de su casa.  A sus animales los engorda con alimentos balanceados como con pastos naturales  y una  vez que tengan el peso y el tamaño óptimo las ofrece en el mercado de la zona donde vive, con el dinero que va adquirir por sus ovejas podrá atender las necesidades diarias de su hogar y familia.  Su esposo se dedica a las labores agrícolas en sus tierras de cultivo con los que cuenta.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimento balanceado para sus animales y de fertilizantes para sus tierras de cultivo.  Con los ingresos que obtenga en ambas actividades podrá pagar el crédito otorgado y mejorará la calidad de vida de su familia.  Clara es conocida en la zona por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable y desea mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia en especial la de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Clara is a 54 year-old mother who lives with her husband and two children.  She lives in her own home, which has water and electricity, in Mórrope district, in Lambayeque department.  This area is noted for the fact that many people farm, raise livestock and make handicrafts.  

Clara has been raising sheep for several years and her sheep pen is located behind her home.  She fattens her animals with balanced feed and natural pasture and, when they have achieved an optimum size and weight, she sells them in the market in her area.  With the money that she makes for her sheep, she is able to take care of her family's daily needs.  Her husband is a farmer who farms his own land.

Clara has requested a loan for 2,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy balanced feed for her animals and fertilizers for her farm land.  She will use the income that she makes from both businesses to repay her loan and improve her family's quality of life.  Clara is known in her area for being a hard-working, responsible woman and she would like to improve her family's quality of life, especially that of her children.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her animals and fertilizers for her farm land

loans.name: Susana Del Pilar

texts.es:
Susana de 22 años de edad, es soltera, vive con sus padres en su casa, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Se cacteriza por que la actividad de los pobladores es la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Susana se dedica a la  crianza y venta de aves de corral (pavos y gallinas), su corral que se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa para mayor seguridad de sus animales, los alimenta con comidad balanceada  y granos naturales, una vez que han completado su desarrollo los vende a los distintos mercados de la zona donde vive.  Además cuenta con una pequeña tienda en su casa donde ofrece diferentes productos a sus clientes.

Para poder incrementar sus ventas necesita un préstamo de 800 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para  comprar alimentos balanceados para sus animales y para implementar su tienda con más productos para seguir incrmentando sus ventas y así pueda más adelante realizar algunos estudios superiores.   Susana es una mujer responsable, trabajadora y empeñosa conocida por los pobladores del lugar donde vive, por querer superarse en la vida y ayudar a sus padres económicamente.
texts.en:
Susana is 22 years old and single.  She lives with her parents in their home which is located in the rural area of Tambogrande district, in Piura department.  This area is noted for the fact that its residents farm, raise livestock and make handicrafts.

Susana raises and sells poultry (turkeys and hens).  Her pen is located behind her home in order to keep her animals safe.  She feeds them balanced animal feed and natural grains.  Once they have completed their development, she sells them at the different markets in her area.  She also owns a small store in her home where she sells different products to her customers.

In order to increase her sales, Susana needs a loan for 800 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy balanced feed for her animals and to stock her store with more products so that she can continue increasing her sales.  This will enable her, in the future, to pursue a higher education.  Susana is a responsible, hard-working and tenacious woman who is known by local residents for the fact that she wants to do well in life and help her parents financially.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her animals and to stock her store with products

loans.name: Maximina

texts.es:
Maximina es una madre de familia de 38 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece aldepartamentode Piura.  Los pobladores desarrollan la actividad agrícola, ganadería y artesanía.

Desde hace 4 años Maximina a colocado su picantería en donde vende platos hechos a base de pescados y mariscos en su propio domicilio, donde vende cerveza, es un producto que se vende más los fines de semana.  Con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir sus obligaciones familiares.

Al observar que su negocio va creciendo Maximina a creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para la compra de más cerveza y así pueda obtenermayores ganacias con las ventas que realiza, lo que le permitirá brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.  Maximina es una mujer emprenderora y muy trabajadora con el único objetivo de sacar a su familia adelante.
texts.en:
Maximina is a 38 year old mother.  She lives with her husband and children in her own house.  She has electrical service.  They live in a rural zone in the Tambogrande district, which is in the Piura departments.  The population dedicates itself to agriculture, livestock, and handicrafts.

Four years ago Maximina set up her pub where she sells fish and seafood dishes in her own home.  She sells beer there, which is a product that sells more on the week-ends.  With the income she gets she will be able to cover the family obligations.

Upon observing that her business is growing, Maximina believes it advisable to request a loan for 1,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  She will use the loan to buy more beer.  This way she will be able to get more income from the sales that she makes.  This will allow her to give her family a better quality of life.

Maximina is a very enterprising and hard-working woman whose only objective is to get her family ahead.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of beer.

loans.name: Filemon

texts.es: Filemón tiene 54 años, vive con 2 de sus hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 15 años se dedica a sembrar pastos, que es el alimento importante para su ganado asimismo siembra papa, arveja, zanahoria y papa. Su esposa trabajaba junto a él, pero por razones de buscar mejores opciones se fue a otro país, desde entonces sus hijos lo apoyan en estas actividades. Cuando es temporada de cosecha, son llevados a vender en los mercados mayoristas de su ciudad, así se genera ganancias. Actualmente se ha intensificado en esta actividad, por ello procura aumentar su capital de trabajo (más reses), asimismo  obtiene ingresos cuando vende el pasto que siembra, ya que sus vecinos también cría animales y por ello le solicitan el forraje necesario. En adelante quiere extender sus áreas de cultivo para tener una mayor producción. Este será  su crédito número 1 que tiene con MFP, por tanto pide de su apoyo para que sus planes se cumplan y por ello desea confirmar su compromiso de ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará alimentos para engordar sus reses, asimismo desea comprar semilla de arveja.
texts.en:
Filemón is 54 years old and lives with two of his children in his own home.  For more than 15 years, he has been sowing pasture with which he feeds his cattle.  He also grows potatoes, peas and carrots.  His wife used to work with him but, in order to seek better options, she moved to another country.  Since that time, his children have supported him in his work.

When it is harvest time, Filemón takes his produce to the wholesale markets in his city to sell and make profits.  Currently, he is intensifying his work in this business and he is trying to increase his working capital (by purchasing more cows).  He also makes profits when he sells the pasture that he grows since his neighbors also raise animals and request fodder from him.

In the future, Filemón would like to extend the area of land on which he grows his crops so that he has a better production.  This will be Filemón's first loan from MFP and he is requesting your support so that he can carry out his plans.  For his part, Filemón would like to confirm his pledge to be punctual in making his loan repayments.  He will use his loan to buy feed with which to feed his cattle.  He would also like to buy pea seeds.

loans.use: to buy feed for his cattle and pea seeds

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge Luis de 34 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa de sus padres; cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada  en el distrito de Chepén, a dos horas de distancia del departamento de la Libertad.  Los pobladores de éste distrito se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

Jorge Luis  se dedica a manejar su mototaxi (transporte que se utiliza para movilizarse en distancias cortas, con un cupo máximo de 3 personas) desde hace algunos años, actividad que realiza en la misma ciudad donde vive, cuenta con algunos clientes fijos, a pesar de la competencia que existe, trata en lo posible de movilizar la mayor cantidad de pasajeros, con los ingresos que deja su actividad trata de solventar sus gastos personales.

El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 1500 nuevos soles y su destino será para brindar mantenimiento a su mototaxi y cambio de algunos respuestos porque estaba presentando algunos desperfectos, necesita tenerla  óptima para que pueda seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes, lo que permitirá tener mayores ganancias para tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Jorge Luis es un hombre muy ressponsable, trabajador  y conocido en la zona donde vive el buen trato y el servicio que brinda a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Jorge Luis is 34 years old, single, and lives in his parents' home.  The house has all basic services and is located in Chepén district, two hours from La Libertad department.  The residents of this district work in farming, livestock raising and tourism.

Jorge Luis drives a motorcycle taxi (a mode of transport which is used for travelling short distances and holds a maximum of three people).  He has been in this business for some years and carries out his work in the city in which he lives.  He has some regular customers and, in spite of the competition that exists, he tries as hard as possible to transport as many passengers as he can.  With the income from his work, he tries to cover his personal expenses.

Jorge Luis has requested a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which he will use to have maintenance work carried out on his motorcycle taxi and to replace some parts as it is experiencing some problems.  He needs to keep it in good condition so that he can continue providing a good service to his customers.  This will allow him to make more profits so that he can improve his quality of life.  Jorge Luis is a very responsible, hard-working man.  He is known in his area for the good service that he provides to his customers.

loans.use: to have maintenance work carried out on his motorcycle taxi and to replace some parts

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 27 años vive con su hija en casa de sus padres y disfrutando de la compañía de ellos. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a la agricultura y junto a sus padres siembra en las diferentes extensiones de tierra que poseen, parte que le corresponde es la mitad de la extensión. De esa manera tanto para él como para sus padres asumen los gastos. Del mismo modo, vende animales los fines de semana en la feria ganadera de su localidad y los demás días se dedica a la confección de buzos. Su madre la ayuda en las técnicas del bordado, pues es la principal diseñadora, además es quien vende el tejido artesanal el fin de semana, logrando percibir una cantidad considerable. Por ahora lo que más desea es extender la siembre y desarrollar las otras actividades, por ello pide de su apoyo para que se concrete sus planes. Este será su crédito número 6 con MFP, ella manifiesta su compromiso de continuar pagando sus cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de repuestos para su maquina de coser y sacos de abono para su siguiente siembra.
texts.en:
Maria, 27, lives with her daughter in her parent’s home, enjoying their company.  For more than 6 years she has worked in agriculture together with her parents, farming the different fields that they own.  She was given half of the area to work and this is the way expenses are covered.  She also sells farm animals on the weekends in the cattle market in her town and the rest of the week she knits sweaters.  Her mother helps her with the embroidery but she is the main designer.  She is the one who sells knitted crafts on the weekends and is able to earn quite a lot. 

 Now she wants to plant more and to increase the other work, and that is why she is asking you for support to help her with her plans.  This will be loan number 6 with MFP and she demonstrates her willingness to make all the payments.  She will use the loans to buy replacement parts for her sewing machine and fertilizer for her next crop.

loans.use: To fix her embroidery machine and to buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Yudith Cirila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 30 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, ella vende pantalones, blusas, chompas y polos, ella vende en forma independiente llevando a  diferentes instituciones y al publico en general, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa como pantalones, blusas, polos y chompas.
                                                             
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the “Liderando Las Palmeras" community bank which is located in Cusco district, province and department.

The borrower is 30 years old and single.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling clothes.  She sells pants, blouses, sweaters and tops.  She makes her sales independently and sells to different institutions and to the general public.  The borrower would like to expand her clothes business.  She is requesting this loan to buy clothes such as pants, blouses, tops and sweaters.

The borrower is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy clothes such as pants, blouses, tops and sweaters

loans.name: Eutropia

texts.en:
Eutropia is 61 years old and married with 11 children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. She has been raising livestock for 3 years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Eutropia is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more livestock and fertilizers for her vegetable garden.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream- to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more livestock, and fertilizers for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Savy

texts.en:
Savy, 45, is a motor taxi driver. His wife, Sophy, 41, stays at home and does house work. They have been married since 1989 and have five children: one son and four daughters. Three are garment factory workers and the other two are in school. The family lives in a village along National Road Number One, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Savy hopes to change his business from motor taxi to tuk tuk, because a tuk tuk's passenger cab can carry more goods and people than a motor taxi. That’s why he decided to request a loan of $700 to buy a tuk tuk.

Photo: Savy and his wife.

loans.use: To buy a tuk tuk.

loans.name: Komsort

texts.en:
Komsort is 27 years old. He and his wife, Vanna, 27, have been married since 2006 and have two young children, a son and a daughter. The family lives in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. 

Komsort and his wife are banana and flower farmers. They also buy additional flowers and bananas from fellow villagers and transport them to sell in the Phnom Penh market. 

The couple wants to supplement their business by selling longan, a fruit related to the lychee. Hence Komsort is applying for his first loan of $400 purchase longan for sale.

loans.use: To purchase longan fruit for sale.

loans.name: Pao

texts.en:
Pao is a farmer who weaves at home when she is free from farming. Her husband, Sam-ol, sells cows and oxen. They live on an Island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1982 and have four children: one son and three daughters. 

Pao is requesting a loan of $1,000 to provide her husband capital to purchase more cows and oxen to resell.

loans.use: To provide her husband capital to purchase more cows and oxen for sale.

loans.name: Sreytoch

texts.en:
Sreytoch is a vegetable seller. She buys vegetables from the farmers in her village and sells them in the Phnom Penh market. Her husband, Dara, is a motor taxi driver. They have been married since 1989 and have three children: one son and two daughters. One is married and a garment factory worker, one assists her mother in the business and the third one attends school. The family lives in the area surrounding Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sreytoch is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.name: Bunthoeun

texts.en:
Bunthoeun is a motor taxi driver. His wife, Neang, is a cleaner for a company. They have three sons and five daughters. Three are married and live in separate homes, one is a garment factory worker and the others are in school. The family lives in a Phnom Penh suburb.

Bunthoeun is asking for a loan of $1,200 to build a concrete brick room.

loans.use: To build a concrete brick room.

loans.name: Lun

texts.en:
Lun and her husband Choeun are farmers. They live in a village along National Road Number One, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have four sons and five daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home, one is a garment factory worker, one is a security guard, another one is a motorcycle repairman, and others are in school. 

Lun is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase spare parts for her son’s motorcycle repair business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her son's motorcycle repair business

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is the married parent of three children who works hard to support her family. She has a business selling vegetables in the Philippines and also earns additional income from rice farming. Felicidad has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and her previous six loans from NWTF. 

Felicidad is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell. In the future, she hopes that her hard work will help attain her dream of saving enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to sell

loans.name: Samol

texts.en:
Samol is 53 years old and is a carpenter. He makes beds, cupboards and closets. His wife, Thary, is 51 years old and is a housewife. They have been married since 1979 and have three sons and two daughters. Three of their children are garment factory workers and the other two assist their father in his business. The family lives along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Samol is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase wood and materials for his carpentry business.

loans.use: to purchase wood and materials for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stock to sell in her store

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 53 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past six years, Elma has run a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She also earns an income from fattening pigs. Elma is requesting a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store such as shampoo, sugar, and other grocery items. She has borrowed and repaid 19 previous loans from NWTF.

In the future, Elma aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell in her store

loans.name: Mary Bethanie

texts.en: Mary Bethanie is 42 years old, married and has three children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur who runs a tailoring business in the Philippines, and has applied for a loan for PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials and other supplies for her shop. Mary Bethanie has been in this this line of work for 20 years and is committed to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy materials and other supplies for her tailoring shop.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe is 62 years old, married and has three children. She works hard to help provide for her family by running a sari-sari (or variety) store where she sells items such as canned goods and groceries. She has applied for a loan for PHP 18,000 from NWTF to buy more items to sell to her customers. She has been running her store for 14 years and also runs a business on the side raising pigs. Her goal is to save enough money to send her grandchildren to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari (or variety) store

loans.name: Hay

texts.en: Hay makes a living as a chef, while his wife sells groceries out of their home. They have been married for 10 years and have four children -- one son and three daughters. Two are garment factory workers, one is in school and the fourth is not yet old enough to enroll in school. They live in a village that's located on National Road Number Two about fifteen kilometers outside of Phnom Penh City. Hay is applying for this loan to enlarge and remodel his house, because this will mean a much better life for his family. To make this possible, he is applying for a loan for $1,200. We see Hay and his wife in this photo.

loans.use: to enlarge and remodel his house.

loans.name: Duch

texts.en: Like many people who live in her area, Mrs. Duch makes a living by growing rice. She and her husband have been in this line of work for many years and now have five children, two of whom are grown and married. Mrs. Duch is applying for a loan to buy a motorbike so that she and her family no longer need to hire motor taxis when they need to go places or run errands.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Oun

texts.en: Mrs. Oun lives in Kompong Cham where she and her husband earn about $3 a day by growing rice and potatoes. The couple has four children, one of whom is a driver for a loan company while the other three are still in school.  Mrs. Oun is applying for a loan to help pay for the cost of planting her new potato crop.

loans.use: plant her new potato crop

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali, age 23, is a barber. He opened his barber shop in 2006, and he enjoys his work. He considers it a good source of income for himself and his family, which is why he puts forth a great deA. of effort toward improving his business. He aims to invest solidly in his business for the future. Ali and his wife have one child.

Ali is requesting his third loan from A. Majmoua, a Kiva partner, in order to increase his inventory of the beauty products he uses and sells in his shop, such as hair treatments, gel, aftershave, and severA. other items most frequently requested by his customers.

Ali dreams of a strong future for his family. He is also helping his parents by providing funds to continue building their house. His neighbors describe him as a great father, son, and husband.

Ali hopes to expand his business more in the future and aspires eventually to open a speciA. beauty therapy section.

loans.use: to increase his inventory of the beauty products he uses and sells in his shop

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James, age 46, has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 16 years. He and his wife Ruth have two children, both enrolled in school. 

James was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan. He repaid his previous loan of KES. 20,000 dependably and in good time. He plans to use his new loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer as well as to pay for labor, as he will employ one person to help him in preparing and planting.

In future, James hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer as well as to pay for one additional field laborer

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef, age 27, works in transporting and selling bread, a business he has been engaged in since 2005. He is a hard worker and he is expanding his business into more and more regions. Youssef buys a certain quantity of bread from the bakery, then journeys to severA. grocery stores in nearby villages to sell his wares. 

Youssef believes that this work is a challenge that will allow him to improve the sociA. and financiA. situation of himself and his family. He works hard to fulfill his family's desires and to secure their future needs.

Youssef is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua in order to buy a new and bigger van to increase his product sales during his daily journeys. He is confident that his business will continue to succeed.

loans.use: to buy a new van to allow for improved and expanded delivery of his wares to local villages

loans.name: Sokly

texts.en:
Sokly, age 61, operates a weaving business in her village. She also sells roasted beef and boiled eggs for additional income. She and her husband Po, age 63, live across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married for almost 20 years and have three sons and a daughter. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home, and two assist their mother in her business. 

Sokly is requesting a loan of $1,000 in order to purchase silk material for her weaving business. She will use part of the loan to complete construction of a fence around her house.

loans.use: to purchase silk material for her weaving business

loans.name: Chek

texts.en:
Chek, age 32, is a farmer. When he can spare the time from his farming efforts, he also engages in construction work. He is requesting a loan of $1,000 in order to purchase a motorcycle for commuting to and from his workplace.
 
Chek is unmarried and lives with his parents, brothers, and sisters in a village along National Road Number Six, about 10 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for commuting to and from his workplace

loans.name: Yeun

texts.en:
Yeun is a rice farmer. Her husband Son is a construction worker and raises cows at home as well. He also assists his wife in the farming business. They have one son and two daughters. One daughter is married and the younger one is enrolled in school. Their son works in a garment factory. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh.
  
Yeun is asking for a loan of $1,000 in order to buy a motorcycle for her son to use for commuting to and from work.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her son to use for commuting to and from work

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah, age 48, has worked in construction since 1980, specializing in pasting tiles. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy a new lever that will help him in elevating tiles more easily to higher floors. 

This is Abdullah's third experience with Al Majmoua. His previous loans have helped a great deal in improving his business and he is a borrower in good standing. Abdullah hopes to continue to improve his business through buying more modern technical tools in the future. 

Abdullah and his wife have seven children. He hopes to offer his children the highest standard of living he can provide.

loans.use: to buy a new lever that will help him in elevating tiles more easily to higher floors

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is married with four sons. Two of them work while the others are studying. Her eldest son sells water pipes which are used as a sanitary material while the 2nd one makes iron rods. 

Nasreen who is very skillful is involved in making artificial jewelry. She sells this jewelry to jewelry and cosmetics shops. Nasreen is also a very good housewife and performs her routine tasks very well. Her husband is a retired civil servant.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her eldest son’s business. With the loan, he will buy water pipes which will allow him to fill larger orders on time and earn more profit.

Her son started this business 2 years ago and Nasreen hopes that an investment will bring her family more income and improve their lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy water pipes for plumbing supply business.

loans.name: Pheakdey

texts.en:
Pictured here is Pheakdey, age 31, years old and her husband Rady, age 24. Pheakdey is a garment factory worker and her husband is a construction worker. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh and have been married for almost two years. They have no children as yet. 

Pheakdey is requesting a loan of $1,200 in order to purchase a motorcycle for herself and her husband to utilize for commuting to and from work.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for herself and her husband to utilize for commuting to and from work

loans.name: Majed

texts.en:
Majed, age 24, has worked in house painting since 2006. Majed faced many obstacle at the beginning of his work journey as he was new to the region and had to build up trust and experience gradually. He worked hard in order to prove himself and has achieved a sold customer base, consisting of neighbors, relatives, friends, and friends of friends.

Majed is requesting a loan from Al  Majmoua in order to buy updated machines, specifically a special spray-painting generator and a power generator. These will make it possible for him to offer high-quality work in a shorter period of time.

Majed hopes to keep on improving his business more and more in the future.

loans.use: to buy a special spray-painting generator and a power generator, which will make it possible for him to offer high-quality work in a shorter period of time

loans.name: Kola Ngo Mudu Group

texts.en:
59-year-old Justine, who operates her pharmacy business from Mukono, says she expects a favorable return in her business operations once she gets this Kiva loan. This good-humored single mother of 3 says she set forth in her business 15 years ago. Justine is a lady with enterprise and initiative. She has always been confident of success. 15 years in this business has solidified and widened her insight and understanding of her type of business. 
The fact that she is nurse has also been playing very much in her favor.

Justine plies her trade from a neighborhood in Mukono where there are few pharmacies. The fact that she cares to get the right drugs and restock her pharmacy often has given her strong leverage in the market.  She says her monthly profits are approximately 350,000 shillings. With this Kiva loan, she says she is going to purchase more drugs to resell.

loans.use: purchase medicine to resell

loans.name: Guljan's Group

texts.en:
Guljan is the leader of this group. She is 44 years old and is married to a security guard. Together with her husband, she is raising a six-year-old daughter who is attending kindergarten. In order to earn additional money to meet her family needs, Guljan breeds livestock. She started livestock breeding six years ago with the initial investment of 10,000 soms.

Guljan has applied for this loan because she needs funds to purchase more livestock for breeding.  She will try to use the funds effectively.  Guljan believes that the loan will help her realize the plans. In the future, she plans to save money to repair her house.  

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: 4373 Umucyo Group

texts.en:
Immaculee is 36 years old and is married with three children between the ages of 6 and 10 years old. She is the president of a group which called “Umucyo”. Her business is well-organized. she sells charcoal in her market. She has seven years of experience and works from 6 am until 10 pm every day.

Immaculee and her group have requested a loan from Kiva in order to purchase more goods like charcoal to sell. With their profits, Immaculee and her group will reinvest in their businesses and to build their own houses.

loans.use: To increase her business for buying more sac of  charcoal.

loans.name: Nguon

texts.en: Most of the residents who live in Kompong Cham Province earn income by cultivating different kinds of crops on their farmland. Mrs. Nguon also works in the farm field with her husband. From their crop planting business, they can generate an average income of $2 each day to support their family.  This couple has two single children. Mrs. Nguon would like a loan to buy a water pump for irrigation.

loans.use: buy a water pump

loans.name: Karlygash's Group

texts.en:
Karlygash is the young leader of this group. She is 21 years old and is married to a driver.  Together with her husband, she is raising a daughter and a son, both children are of pre-school age (under seven).  

Karlygash stays at home and takes care of the children, but in order to contribute additional money to the family budget, she also breeds livestock.  She started this activity five years ago with the initial investment of 5,000 soms. With the money from this loan, Karleygash wants to purchase more livestock for breeding. In the future, she wants to make repairs to her home and improve the living conditions for her family.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: purchase more livestock

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 22 years old.  She is married and has one child who is two years old.  She also cares for another dependent child who is a relative. 

Catherine has been running a boutique for five years. She works from 8am until 8pm every day.  She has requested her first loan from Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by buying more water, cooking oil, cassava flour, juice and so on.  With this expansion, she hopes to earn more profits than before. This will enable her to buy her own house, pay school fees for her child and save for the future.

loans.use: buy more water, oil, flour, juice, etc. to resell

loans.name: Ol

texts.en:
Mrs. Ol is 43 years old.  She is married and has two children who are attending school.  She lives in the province of Kompong Cham. She and her husband are local cultivators. They currently generate an income of approximately $4 per day from their farming business.  

Presently, this family faces a problem with their living conditions, as their house is so old and narrow that it is difficult for the whole family to live in. Because of this reason, Mrs. Ol has decided to request a loan from Kiva in order to renovate and repair her old house. With this loan, she and her family can live a more comfortable life.

loans.use: repair her house

loans.name: Nong

texts.en:
Nong is a 30-year-old married woman who is blessed with a child who is enrolled in a local school. She is a rice farmer in Kompong Cham Province. Her husband is a construction foreman who hires employees to provide his building services. 

Recently, Nong's husband has been very busy in his business due to the many clients who need him to build their houses.  However, he is lacking materials for these construction projects. That is why Nong has  requested a loan to buy extra construction materials.  She will use the remainder of the loan to add to their savings to buy a second motorcycle for traveling needs.

loans.use: buy construction materials and a motorbike

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres  de BENKADI  1 sont des femmes toutes mariées,  qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 34  ans, et ont en moyenne  5 enfants. EIles vivent  dans des familles  traditionnelles élargies à MEMISSALA, un situé à environ 30 km de la ville de NIENA région de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ces clientes sont à leur cinquième cycle de prêt  de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire leurs besoin en moyen de production et intrant agricole. Les prêts antérieurs ont été remboursés avec satisfaction. 
Ce groupe de femme fait la culture du maïs, du riz, d’arachide, de gombo. 
YAMA, compte utiliser son prêt  pour acheter,  3 sacs d’urée 2 sac de complexe céréale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage.  Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 50.000 à 55 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
Il ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. 
NB : Lors de la prise de photo la nommée LALA  était au C.S.COM. (CENTRE DE SANTÉ COMMUNAUTAIRE) pour des raisons de santé.
texts.en:
The 10 members of Benkadi 1 are all married women who average 34 years of age and have on average 5 children each. They live in traditional extended families in Memissala, located roughly 30km from the town of Niena in the Sikasso region, 3rd administrative district of Mali.

These women are in their fifth agricultural loan cycle with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet their needs in terms of production and agricultural inputs. The previous loans were satisfactorily repaid.

This group of women grows corn, rice, groundnuts and okra.

Yama plans to use her loan to buy 3 sacks of urea (fertilizer), 2 sacs of complex fertilizer and the rest for plowing and hoeing costs. She expects to make an average profit of 50,000 to 55,000 CFA francs, which will be used for the daily expenses of her family.

She plans to increase her turnover in order to better satisfy her customers.

N.B.: When this photo was taken, the group member named Lala was at the Community Health Center for health reasons.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and pay for plowing expenses

loans.name: Kigombya Twegatte Group

texts.en: Clothing sales has been 39-year-old Jariah's business enterprise for the last 11 years.  Jariah is single with no children.   She operates her business from Mukono. She says she began this business with the persuasion of close friends. Before that, she was into retailing. Hard work and determination have been her towers of strength.  On the side, Jariah also has a retail business.  She says weekly her sales profits are approximately 80,000 Ugandan shillings.  She says with this Kiva loan she is going to purchase more bales of clothing to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to resell

loans.name: Seitkul's Group

texts.en:
Seitkul, the leader of this group, is 58 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband she has raised two daughters and two sons, all of whom are married, employed, and living separately with their families.

In order to earn money to meet their needs, the family breeds livestock. Seitkul sells milk and her husband takes care of the livestock, eventually reselling them at a higher price. In this way they earn 9300 soms per month. Seitkul has applied for the loan to increase their number of livestock.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 21 year old single woman of good reputation.  She has owned a grocery store since February 2010, which she opened because she wanted to be independent and plan for her own future instead of staying at home and depending on her parents to pay for her needs.  She is still young but like most girls her age she dreams of a sparkling future, which we all hope she reaches soon.

Hanan is requesting her first loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, in order to increase her shop's inventory.  She particularly wants to stock up on special summer soft drinks and ice cream, items which are highly requested by customers at this time.  She will also buy a computer to start calculating incoming and outgoing stock and capital, and to make a general income and expenses data sheet.  She hopes to expand her business and open an Internet Cafe in the near future.

loans.use: to increase her shop's inventory

loans.name: Groupe 1 De Benkadi  Ii

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe I de l’association BENKADI  II sont  des femmes mariées,  avec  en  moyenne de 30 ans, 3 enfants et vivant avec leurs maries et leurs  enfants à MEMISSALA, un situé à environ 30 km de la ville de NIENA région de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ces clientes sont à leur cinquième cycle de prêt  de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire leurs besoins en moyen de production et intrants agricoles. Les prêts antérieurs ont été remboursés avec satisfaction. 
Ce groupe de femme fait la culture du maïs, du riz, d’arachide, de gombo etc.
DJENEBA compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 3 sacs d’urée 2 sacs de complexe céréale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage.  Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20 000 à 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of group I of the Benkadi II association are married women, who average 30 years of age, have three children and live with their husbands and families in Memissala, which lies around 30km from the town of Niena in the region of Sikasso, Mali's third administrative region. These customers are on their fifth farming loan with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to satisfy their needs in terms of production and agricultural inputs. The previous loans have all been repaid satisfactorily. 

This group of women grow corn, rice, groundnut, gombo (okra) etc..

Djeneba is planning on using her loan to buy three sacks of urea, two sacks of complex cereals and the rest will be used for labor costs and hoeing. She is expecting to make an average profit of 20,000 to 35,000FCFA, which will be used for the daily household expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and pay for labor costs

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea, 38 years old, is a humble villager living in the province of Kompong Cham. She is married and blessed with two school-aged children, while her husband is a motorbike taxi driver. To earn a living, Mrs. Chea grows crops of rice every year, with which she has had great success. She can plant the crops at least twice a year by following both the rainy and dry seasons. The rainy season is coming now and this would be good for her crops, but she doesn’t have immediate cash to get started with this crop yet. Therefore, Mrs. Chea is looking for a loan to use towards purchasing insecticides, seeds, and fertilizers to produce crops that grow well.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, seeds, and fertilizers to produce crops that grow well.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and pay plowing costs.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 32-year-old divorced woman living with her parents and one sibling. She is from Lebanon. She works at producing handicrafts, embroidery and all artistic work and she's a very talented woman. She works upon request of the clients who ask for speciA. orders. Her work is based at her home and she is well-known in her area. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy textiles and tailoring supplies needed in order to increase her business productivity.

loans.use: to buy textiles and tailoring supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy agricultural intrants and pay for plowing.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 27-year-old single woman living with her parents and one sibling. She is from Lebanon. She has been working as a beauty specialist for the past five years. She works on a freelance basis and sometimes she receives customers at her house. She makes her product purchases from a local beauty center. With her business income she is able to help her parents pay the heavy life expenses. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase beauty products in order to improve her business. In the future, she is planning to open her own beauty salon.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy agricultural intrants and pay for plowing.

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.en:
Antoinette is 29 years old, married, and has two children aged 14 and 13 years old. She sells onions, tomatoes and cooking oil from 8am until 9pm every day. She has 2 years of experience in her business and she employs one person to help her.

Antoinette has requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase more onions, tomatoes and cooking oil to sell.  She plans to reinvest the additional profit in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: to purchase more onions, tomatoes and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase needed products and supplies for carpentry.

loans.name: Groupe 2 De Benkadi Ii

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe 2 de l’association ASS BENKADI  II  sont des femmes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 31  ans et  en moyenne  3 enfants. EIles vivent avec leurs maries et leurs enfants à MEMISSALA, un village situé à environ 30 km de la ville de NIENA région de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ces clientes sont à leur cinquième cycle de prêt  de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin en moyen de production et intrant agricole. Les prêts antérieurs ont été remboursés avec satisfaction. 
Ce groupe de femme fait la culture du maïs, du riz, d’arachide, de gombo etc et dont les ventes font l’objet d’une réelle rentabilité dans la zone.
MAMOU compte acheter, 1 sac d’urée, 1/2 sac de complexe céréale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage.  Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 10 000 à 15 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of group 2 of the association BENKADI  II  are married women with an average age of 31 and on average, three children. They live with their husbands and their children in MEMISSALA, a village situated about 30 km from the town of NIENA, Sikasso region, third administrative region of Mali. 

These clients are on their fifth seasonal loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy their average farming expenses and agricultural entrants. Their former loans have been reimbursed satisfactorily. 

This group of women grow maize, rice, peanuts and okra, etc., crops which can be sold quite profitably in their area. 

MAMOU wishes to buy one sack of urea (fertilizer), one half sack of cereal complex, and use the rest of the loan to pay for plowing and weeding. She expects to make an average profit of 10,000 to 15,000 F CFA which will be used for day-to-day expenses of her family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural entrants and pay for plowing.

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi Karibai is a 44 year old married man with eight children to his name. He is a fisherman in Marereni town in Malindi and has been in this business for the past ten years now. He earns a monthly income of about KES 10,000, which he uses to take care of his family. 


This is Hamisi’s first loan cycle with KADET LTD, and he has requested a loan of KES 10,000. He intends to use the entire loan to purchase new and bigger fishing nets and diving glasses for his business.  He intends to use the anticipated profits to continue looking after his family and continue educating his children who are still in school. In the future, he hopes to have enough savings to allow him to purchase land where he would be able to practice commercial farming.

loans.use: to purchase new and bigger fishing nets and diving glasses for his business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 51-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three young children who are still attending school. He has owned a small grocery store for three years and has 10 years of experience working in the same occupation.  He purchases his products and goods from locA. traders. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase his store’s inventory. He intends to increase his business sales in order to get higher income so that he can improve the family's financiA. status.

loans.use: to increase his store’s inventory.

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les  8 membres du groupe BENKADI 3  sont  des femmes mariées. Elles ont  une moyenne d’âge de 31  ans, et ont en moyenne  4  enfants. EIles vivent dans des familles polygames à N’gona, un situé à environ 40 km de la ville de NIENA région de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ces clientes sont à leur cinquième cycle de prêt  de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin en moyen de production et intrant agricole. Les prêts antérieurs ont été remboursés avec satisfaction. 
Ce groupe de femme fait la culture du maïs, du riz, d’arachide, de gombo, du pois sucré, du sésames etc.
MINATA compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 1 sac d’urée, 2 sacs de complexe céréale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage.  Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 10.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The eight members of the BENKADI 3  group are married women. They have an average age of 31 and on average, four children. They live in polygamous families in N’gona, a village situated about 40 km from the town of NIENA, Sikasso region, third administrative region of Mali. 

These clients are on their fifth seasonal loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, aiming to satisfy their average production and agricultural entrants needs. Their prior loans have been satisfactorily reimbursed. 

This group of women grow maize, rice, peanuts, okra, sugar peas, sesame seed, etc. 

MINATA intends to use her loan to buy one sack of urea (fertilizer), two sacks of cereal-complex, and use the rest of the loan for plowing and weeding costs. She expects to make an average profit of 10,000 F CFA which will be used for everyday expenses of her family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural entrants and pay for plowing.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 25 years old and married with one child who is 5 years old. Her store offers items such as rice, sugar, soap, cooking oil, water, juice, and cosmetics. Her business is open from 5 a.m. until 10 p.m. every day.

Esther has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more  juice, clothes, body lotion and water for sale in her store. She plans reinvest the profits in her business and to save money for her future.

loans.use: to purchase more juice, clothes, body lotion and water.

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en:
Fouzia is a 30-year-old lady. She not only carries out her responsibilities as a housewife but also offers her sewing services to community clients. She is very skillful in her work and can sew designer and non-designer clothes very well. She does this work to supplement the income of her family.  

Her husband is involved in a Punjabi food business. He runs a small restaurant in the market where he sells Punjabi food items like "Biryani" (made with rice and chicken served with salad & pickle) and "Dahi bhalay" (made with yogurt and potatoes and served with spicy sausages). He has obtained a good number of clients in his region due to the good quality of his food. 

Fouzia is the mother of six children: three of them are studying while the others stay at home. Due to financial constraints, Fouzia couldn’t provide them all an education. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband. With the loan, he will buy required ingredients such as rice, chicken, spices and cooking oil, etc. to improve the quality of his food and expand his business. He has been operating this business for the past eight years and Fouzia hopes that an investment will help him increase his profits further.

loans.use: To buy required ingredients for Punjabi food business.

loans.name: Awad

texts.en:
This borrower is a 37-year-old married man from Iraq. He lives with his wife and three children, one of whom works.

Since 2008 Awad has owned a women’s clothing store. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and he has a good reputation and is becoming well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2400 loan to rebuild and renovate his store. He is aiming to increase his capital and to expand his business so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To rebuild and renovate his store.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 61-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and two children. He has owned a vegetable and fruit shop since 1995. Because of his older age, he hired a full-time employee to help him with the work. His story illustrates the day-to-day challenges many people are facing in trying to take care of household, health-related, and all other family expenses and at the same time run a business. 
Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to improve his business and increase his purchases of fruit and vegetables. In the future, he is planning to open a juice shop.

loans.use: to improve his business and increase his inventory of fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more broilers.

loans.name: Gloriose

texts.en:
Gloriose is 30 years old and married with two children who are 10 and 2 years old. She also takes care of three children who are between 14 and 22 years old. She sells items such as cooking oil, juice and so on. Her business is well-organized. She has two years of experience and she works from 7 A.M. until 9 P.M. every day except Sunday. She currently employs one person to help her.

Gloriose has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more goods like cooking oil and juice to sell, so she can improve her business. With the extra profits, Gloriose will reinvest in her business and save for her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more goods like cooking oil, juice and so on.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a welding machine.

loans.name: Lutengo Development Group A

texts.en:
There are downsides in every kind of business one involves himself or herself in. 

38-year-old Joseph says that, though his business is fraught with lots of competition and other operational uncertainties, he is still a good credit risk, owing to the fact that he has been in this business for nine years. This, he says, is not an easy feat in his kind of business.

He says he is still going strong and he always goes to any length to ensure that his business is making progress. 

Joseph is an enterprising business man who says he buys timber from as far away as Mbale in eastern Uganda. Though he has enough in his reserves, he is still pitted in competition in his business against many other already established and up-and-coming timber sales business men.

His advantage has always been that he is able to sell his timber to more flourishing timber markets in Kampala. 

The happily married father of three says it's a business he began with savings from his erstwhile charcoal sales business. Hard work is the key to success in any business undertaking, Joseph says.

Monthly, this business generates him 350,000 shillings as sales profits and he says with this Kiva loan, he is going to purchase more substantial amounts of timber to resell.

loans.use: to buy more timber to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 42-year-old married man living with his wife and two school-aged children. He is from Lebanon. He has been working in the construction field since 2000. He works on a freelance basis. He is specialized in completing brickwork. He cooperates with his wife who works as a teacher in a local school to be able to pay every day expenditures. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase an electric generator. He works with multiple construction projects where there is no electricity and he uses many machines where electric power is essential to make these machines function. So, the loan purpose will help him make his work much easier. In the future, he is planning to expand his business operation by sticking with bigger construction projects.

loans.use: to purchase an electric generator.

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe BENKADI 3 sont des femmes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 32  ans, et ont en moyenne  3 enfants. EIles vivent chez eux avec leurs maries et leurs nombreux enfants à MEMISSALA, un situé à environ 30 km de la ville de NIENA région de Sikasso, 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Ces clientes sont à leur cinquième cycle de prêt  de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin en moyen de production et intrant agricole. Les prêts antérieurs ont été remboursés avec satisfaction. 
Ce groupe de femme fait la culture du maïs, du riz, et d’arachide.
AMINATA compte acheter, 3 sacs d’urée, 2 sacs de complexe céréale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage.  Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 50.000 à 55 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
These members of the BENKADI 3 group are married women with an  average age of 32 and on average three children. They live at their homes with their husbands and their many children in MEMISSALA, a village situated about 30 km from the town of NIENA , Sikasso region, third administrative region of Mali. 
 
These clients are on their fifth seasonal loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy their needs in terms of production materials and agricultural entrants. Their former loans have been reimbursed satisfactorily. 

This group of women grow maize, rice, and peanuts.

AMINATA intends to buy three sacks of urea (fertilizer), two sacks of cereal-complex, and use the rest of the loan for plowing and weeding costs. She expects to make an average profit of 50,000 to 55,000 F CFA which will be used for the everyday expenditures of her family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural entrants and pay for plowing.

loans.name: Benkadi 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les 5 membres de BENKADI 4 sont des femmes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 28  ans, et ont en moyenne  2 enfants. EIles vivent avec leurs maries et leurs enfants à N'gona, un situé à environ 40 km de la ville de NIENA région de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ces clientes sont à leur cinquième cycle de prêt  de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin en moyen de production et intrant agricole. Les prêts antérieurs ont été remboursés avec satisfaction. 
Ce groupe de femme fait la culture du maïs, du riz, d’arachide, de gombo etc 
MAMINATA compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 1 sac d’urée, 2 sacs de complexe céréale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage.  Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20.000 FCFA à 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The 5 members of Benkadi 4 are married women with an average age of 28, and an average of 2 children each. They live with their husbands and children in N'gona, which is about 40 km from Niena, in the Sikasso region, third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

These ladies are on their 5th loan cycle with micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, which will allow them to meet their need for production and agricultural intrants.  The previous loans were all fully repaid. 

The women grow corn, rice, ground nuts, okra, etc. Maminata plans to use her loan to buy one sack of urea, 2 sacks of complex fertilizer, and the rest will be used to pay for plowing and hoeing costs. She expects to make an average  monthly profit of 20,000 to 35,000 CFA francs which will be used for the family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural intrants and pay for plowing costs

loans.name: Habel

texts.en:
Habel is a 58 year old married man with nine children. He has been selling charcoal in Marereni Town in Malindi for the past four years now.  He earns a monthly income of about KES 10,000 from the business. 

This is Habel’s first loan cycle with KADET LTD, and he has applied for a loan of KES 10,000. He plans to use the money to put up a wooden structure that will serve as his business premises, to add to his stock of charcoal for sale, and to buy a new weighing machine for the business. He intends to use the anticipated profits from his business to continue taking care of his family and to save for future investments.

loans.use: to put up a wooden structure that will serve as his business premises, to add to his stock of charcoal for sale, and to buy a new weighing machine for the business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy agricultural entrants and pay for plowing.

loans.name: Aizada's Group

texts.en:
Aizada is the leader of this group. She is 37 and married to a builder. Together they bring up two sons and two daughters. The sons and the older daughter study at school, the second daughter is preschool age (under seven). In order to contribute additional money to family budget and meet the daily needs Aizada breeds livestock and then resells it at a higher price in the market. She started this activity two years ago with the initial investment of 5000 soms and now she earns 3000 soms per month. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase more livestock for breeding. In the future Aizada wishes to build a new house and improve the family’s living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and pay for plowing.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 33 years old and is married with three children between the ages of 9 and 14. Emmanuel owns a boutique where he sells different kinds of body lotion, soap, cooking oil and so on. His business is well known and well organized. He employs one person as a helper and has three years of experience in this business.

Emmanuel has requested his first loan from Kiva, via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase more body lotion, soap and cooking oil to sell. He will reinvest his profits in his business and save for his future.

loans.use: to buy more body lotion, soap and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy agriculture ingredients and labor

loans.name: Benkadi  8 Group

texts.fr:
Les  dix femmes qui constituent BENKADI 8 sont toutes mariées des familles polygames avec une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, et ont en moyenne  4 enfants. Elles vivent à MEMISSALA, un situé à environ 30 km de la ville de NIENA région de Sikasso, 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Ces clientes sont à leur cinquième cycle de prêt  de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin en moyen de production et intrant agricole. Les prêts antérieurs ont été remboursés avec satisfaction. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait la culture du maïs, du riz, d’arachide, de gombo, de sésames  etc.
BINTOU compte acheter, 1 sac d’urée,  2 sacs de complexe céréale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20.000 à 30 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille. Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The ten women that constitute the Benkadi 8 group are all married in polygamous families, are of an average age of 33 years, and have an average of 4 children. They live at Memissala, situated at about 30 kilometres from Niena in the Sikasso region, which is in the 3rd administrative region of Mali.
This is the fifth  farm loan that these clients have taken with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institute in order to satisfy their need in means of production and agricultural products. The previous loans were paid back satisfactorily.
This group of women cultivates corn, rice, groundnuts, okra, sesame etc.
Bintou intends to purchase, I sack of urea, 2 sacks of cereal complex and use the remainder for labour and hoeing costs. She hopes to make a profit of 20.000 to 30 000 FCFA which will be used for the daily family expenses.
She aims to increase her sales to better satisfy her customers.

loans.use: purchase agricultural products and meet labour costs.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 34 years old and married with two children who are 3 and 7 years old. She earns a living by selling cosmetics.  This is her fifth successful year in  business. Her business is well-organized. She operates her business from 8 a.m until 6 p.m every day except on Saturday. She employs one person to help her.

Alice has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by buying more cosmetics to sell. By adding more products and workers, she hopes to earn more profit. With the profit, she will save for her family and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase agricultural products and cover the costs of plowing and weeding

loans.name: Benkadi  4 Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres de BENKADI 4 sont des femmes mariées   qui, ont une moyenne d’âge de 32  ans, et ont en moyenne  4 enfants. EIles vivent avec leurs maries et leurs enfants à MEMISSALA, un situé à environ 30 km de la ville de NIENA région de Sikasso, 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Ces clientes sont à leur cinquième cycle de prêt  de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin en moyen de production et intrant agricole. Les prêts antérieurs ont été remboursés avec satisfaction. 
Ce groupe de femme fait la culture du maïs, du riz, d’arachide, de gombo, pois de terre etc 
FATOUMATA compte acheter, 3 sacs d’urée 2 sacs de complexe céréale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage.  Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 50.000 à 55 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The 10 members of BENKADI 4 are married women who average 32 years of age with an average of 4 children. They live with their husbands and their children in Memissala, a place about 30 km from the city of Niena in the Sikasso region, the 3rd administrative region of Mali.
They are on their fifth Country Loan cycle with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to obtain production means and farm inputs. Their previous loans were repaid in full.
The group grows corn, rice, peanuts, okra, and peas.
Fatoumata plans on buying 3 sacks of urea, 2 sacks of complex cereals, and the rest of the money will be used for labor costs and hoeing. They hope to make an average profit of 50,000 to 55,000 FCFA which will be used to pay for their families' daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and pay for labor.

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.en:
Clarisse is 32 years old and is married with three children between the ages of 4 and 9. Her business is well organized. She employs one person in her business. Clarisse has five year's experience and she sells tableware and children's clothes.
