Clarisse has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy more tableware and children's clothes. She will reinvest the profits in her business and build her own house.

loans.use: to buy more tableware and children's clothes.

loans.name: Lutengo Development Group B

texts.en:
50 year old Teo has been involved in a liquor store business for an amazing 20 years. What is this smiling lady's secret? That is a question many may be prompted to ask. Many people in her place of origin in Mukono hold this happily married mother of 4 in very high regard because she has blazed an unprecedented trail in many respects by surviving this long in this highly competitive business. Her success has come with lots of hard work and determination. Many people have followed her example and have started their own businesses. 

Teo was encouraged by her husband to get established in this business. Weekly she says her sales profits are 80,000 shillings  and  with this Kiva loan she is going to purchase more jerrycans of crude liquor from different local distillers around Mukono. Teo believes that with more sales, she will be able to effectively consolidate her business profits.

loans.use: To purchase more jerrycans of crude liquor to resell

loans.name: Jiguisseme 1 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe JIGUISSEME 1 est composé de femmes mariées du village de Blendio dans l’ex cercle de NIENA région de SIKASSO troisième  région administrative de la république du Mali. Elles  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux-parents, belles-sœurs  etc. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et au moins 5 enfants.
Elles exercent la culture d’arachide de riz et de mil.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe JIGUISSEME 1 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semences d’arachide et de riz, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, exclusivement  au grand marché de Blendio et de Nina ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de NIENA et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
TERNIN la présidente du groupe compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 1 sac d’urée, 2 sacs de complexe céréale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage.  Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 50.000 à 60 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Jiguisseme 1 group consists of married women from the village of Blendio in the former circle of Niéna, in the Sikasso region, which is the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali. The women live in large, traditional families extending to their children, husbands, parents-in-law, sisters-in-law, etc. Their average age is 34, and they have, on average, five children each.

They grow peanuts, rice and millet.

Hoping to make their agricultural work more profitable, the members of the Jiguisseme 1 group decided to take part in the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. The current loan will be used to purchase a sufficient quantity of seeds for peanuts and rice, as well as small equipment and soil inputs for cultivating the plants; these will be purchased exclusively at the large market of Blendio and the city of Nina. After wintering over, the harvests are stored for some time to build their value before being sold at the large market in Niéna and the surrounding markets. They are sold retail (and often wholesale), over the counter to customers who generally come from large cities.

The group president, Ternin, plans to use her loan to purchase one bag of urea and two bags of complex fertilizer, with the remaining amount going towards costs of labor, including hoeing.  She is aiming for an average profit of between 50,000 and 60,000 CFA francs, which will be used to pay off interest on the loan and for her family’s day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase soil inputs and cover costs of labor.

loans.name: Zahara

texts.en:
Zahara, aged 30 is married to Nicholas and they are blessed with two children.She runs a salon business,which she has been doing for the last year. Zahara earns a monthly income of KES.20,000 from the business.

This is her second loan from KADET LTD. She has successfully repaid her previous loan.With the loan funds she will buy salon equipment like hair dryers, salon furniture and hair products.

Zahara intends to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and hopes to own a classic salon in the future.

loans.use: To buy salon equipment like hair dryers, salon furniture and hair products

loans.name: Suyunbek

texts.en:
Suyunbek, who lives in Dj.Rasulov, Tajikistan is dedicated to the cattle business which he practices very diligently in his community. From very early in the morning he tends to the animals and he returns in the afternoons, having been exposed to the sun and exhausted from all this, in order to bring food to his table for his spouse and beloved 4 children. Suyunbek says that he works with only one aim in mind - to provide his children with proper education. Now, Suyunbek would like to expand his business and purchase young cattle. For this purpose, he has applied for a loan of 5000 Somoni and with your help he hopes to reach his aim.      


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase  young cattle

loans.name: Abdukayum

texts.en:
Abdukayum is a young man who, little by little, reaches his goals through being perserverant and dedicated. Thanks to his own strengths and the desire to provide a better future for his family, he has been able to move from being a simple salesman to becoming his own boss. Approximately 3 years ago Abdukayum rented a place which was in terrible condition and started his business. He expanded his grocery and now it is one of the most well known  in his community. Now Abdukayum is requesting a loan of 5000 Somoni to increase his stock of foodstuffs in his grocery store. Abdukayum is ready to work even harder,  to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase soil inputs and cover costs of labor.

loans.name: Olim

texts.en:
Olim is a hard-working man who is in agriculture. He has worked at this business for a long time and has acquired his abilities in ranching and farming over a long period of time. He is a married father with responsibilities for maintaining his 3 children. 

Olim is known as being very responsible and hard-working. Every day, very early in the morning, he starts his job taking care of his fields while at the same time raising cattle in his own pen located at his house. IMON International has been the backbone of his business because of having granted loans which have allowed him to improve his standard of living. This has been achieved through the acquisition of cattle and vegetables for planting. Today, once again, Olim trusts that his loan will be approved and he will be able to improve his business with the purchase of cattle and farm supplies to plant.

loans.name: Munavvara

texts.en:
Munavvara is married and has two children. She sells fabrics for sewing national women dresses at the central market in the city of Khujand. She has been in this business for 10 years. Munavvara is very persistent, disciplined and creative. All of these character traits help her to succeed in her business. 

Adolat's place of business is located at a good spot at the market and she always has many customers. Munavvara would like to borrow 5500 Somoni to increase her assortment of goods for sale. She works hard to develop her business. Munavvara's goal is to be a successful and independent person, able to provide for her family and help others as well.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius, 54 years old, is married and has two children. He repairs bicycles for his living in Marereni town in Malindi. The business gives the client a monthly income of about KES10,000 and it has been in existence for the last four years now.

Julius has been loaned KES10,000 by Kadet Limited and this serves as his first loan cycle from the company. He intends to use his loan to purchase spare parts needed to operate his business. The items he will purchase are spanners, spare wheels, tubes and grease for the wheels. From the anticipated profit from his business, he would like to continue looking after his family and continue educating one of his children, who is still in school.

In the future, Julius hopes to own a garage for motorcycles.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his bicycle business like spanners, spare wheels, tubes and grease for the wheels.

loans.name: Nakyinziro Development Group

texts.en:
Rehema is a 35 year old retail business woman operating from Mukono. She has a decade long track record of hard work in her business. With hard work she says success can be at anybody's feet. 

This happily married mother of 5 says she was inspired by her husband to take root in this business. Teaching was her first profession. Rehema is a qualified teacher. She still teaches in many of Mukono's mushrooming private secondary schools. Weekly, she says, this business generates her shillings 150,000 as profit. With this kiva loan, she says she is going to purchase more sugar, rice, beans, salt, soap and other commodities to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, rice, beans  and other retail commodities to resell.

loans.name: C4712 Tuzamukane B Group

texts.en:
Emmailine is 43 years old and is married with five children between the ages of 5 and 15. Her business is well-organized. Emmailine is the team leader of this group called "Tuzamuke B", which is well known in the business of selling clothes. Their business hours are from 7 am until 7 pm every day.

Emmailine and her team have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase their business by buying more clothes to sell. They will reinvest the profits in their business and save for their future.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.
